original: 'dir de bstan pa ni bstan bcos kyis /
analyzed: 'dir de bstan pa ni bstan bcos kyis /
translated: Here, the treatise demonstrates that:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Since the basic space of phenomena is indivisible,

original: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: it is not tenable for the family to be different.

original: zhes te / 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'di ni nyan thos kyi rigs zhes pa ji ltar dbye zhe na /
analyzed: zhes te / 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'di ni nyan thos kyi rigs zhes pa ji ltar dbye zhe na /
translated: If one were to ask, ‚ÄúHow is it that the family of buddhas, the family of solitary realizers, and the family of hearers are differentiated?‚Äù

original: 'dir lan bstan bcos las /üîΩrten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis //üîΩde yi dbye ba yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: 'dir lan bstan bcos las / rten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis // de yi dbye ba yongs su bsgrags //
translated: The treatise responds:üîΩThe differentiation of the family

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: is proclaimed to be due to the differentiation of the phenomena that are based on it.

original: rten pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rten pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnams kyis te /
translated: The family is differentiated due to the phenomena of buddhas and so forth that are based on it.

original: de'i chos ni dbyer med la /
analyzed: de'i chos ni dbyer med la /
translated: The phenomena of those are indivisible,

original: 'dir ni de'i dbye bas rigs kyi dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i dbye bas rigs kyi dbye ba ste /
translated: but here the differentiation of the family is due to the differentiation of those phenomena.

original: dper na nam mkha' tha mi dad pa la lam bgrod pa po mtha' dag ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' tha mi dad pa la lam bgrod pa po mtha' dag ste /
translated: For example, all those who traverse the path do so in the sky, which is undivided.

original: nyi ma'i lam dang / bya khyung gi lam dang / phye ma leb kyi lam bzhin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i lam dang / bya khyung gi lam dang / phye ma leb kyi lam bzhin zhes pa ste /
translated: The path of the sun, the path of the garu·∏ça, and the path of the butterfly are all the same in that they are traversed in the sky.

original: 'di rnams bsdus nas bstan par 'dod nas rab 'byor la 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams bsdus nas bstan par 'dod nas rab 'byor la 'dri ba ni /
translated: With the wish to teach this in a concise manner, the Buddha asks Subh≈´ti:

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As he said this, the Lord of Secrets said to him, What is the meaning of the term 'basis'?

original: gzhi'i don gang lags zhes pa ni rigs ci 'dra bas yod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi'i don gang lags zhes pa ni rigs ci 'dra bas yod ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of What is the meaning of the term 'basis'? is What is the type of family?

original: gzhi'i don med ces pa ni de'i rigs dngos po med pa ste chos kyi dbyings zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi'i don med ces pa ni de'i rigs dngos po med pa ste chos kyi dbyings zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of The meaning of the term 'basis' does not exist is The type of family is not a thing, which is the meaning of the dharmadhatu.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tha snyad kyi yul gyi phung po la sogs pa gang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / chos nyid de ni de'i chos kyi dbyings la de nyid dag par mthar son pa rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni byang chub ces brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tha snyad kyi yul gyi phung po la sogs pa gang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / chos nyid de ni de'i chos kyi dbyings la de nyid dag par mthar son pa rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni byang chub ces brjod do //
translated: The aggregates, etc., which are the objects of the conventional terms of the bodhisattva, are the very lack of intrinsic reality, emptiness, and the nature of phenomena. That is the dharmadhatu. The attainment of the perfection of purity in that is called enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir na rigs su gyur pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rigs su gyur pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, family is a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the characteristic of non-thing, it is emptiness.

original: yang na byang chub ni rigs su gyur la rten ni med do //
analyzed: yang na byang chub ni rigs su gyur la rten ni med do //
translated: Alternatively, enlightenment is the family, and support does not exist.

original: kun rdzob dang phan tshun dbyer med pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang phan tshun dbyer med pas /
translated: Because of the mutual inseparability of the conventional,

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i dbye ba med do //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i dbye ba med do //
translated: There is no distinction of the supported and the supporting.

original: btags pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being made by designation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Why is that? The realm of phenomena

original: byang chub kyi rigs nyid du ji ltar ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rigs nyid du ji ltar ro //
translated: is the lineage of enlightenment.üîΩBy realizing all phenomena, one is called a bodhisattva.

original: chos thams cad rtogs pas ni chos drug dang zhes pa la @49b sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad rtogs pas ni chos drug dang zhes pa la @49b sogs pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the six dharmas and so on.

original: chags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: chags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: Attachment is the opposing factor

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the observation of unreal things.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma chags chos te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma chags chos te /
translated: The dharma of non-attachment is the opposite of that.

original: ji ltar rigs par de'i gnyen po'i phyir ram de 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par de'i gnyen po'i phyir ram de 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As appropriate, it is the antidote to that or the cessation of that.

original: de rnams la ma chags pa nyid du slob pa ni dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams la ma chags pa nyid du slob pa ni dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Training in that non-attachment becomes virtuous.

original: 'dir de rnams kyi ma lus pa'i dri ma bsal nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa las 'byung ba'i byang chub yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir de rnams kyi ma lus pa'i dri ma bsal nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa las 'byung ba'i byang chub yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, after removing all the stains of those, enlightenment arises correctly from the extremely pure realm of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir na 'di ltar byang chub la rigs logs na med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di ltar byang chub la rigs logs na med do //
translated: Therefore, in this way, there is no separate lineage in enlightenment.

original: chos rnams 'dir ji ltar rab tu bsten te /
analyzed: chos rnams 'dir ji ltar rab tu bsten te /
translated: How are the dharmas here well-established?

original: rigs dman pa la sogs pas de rnams la rab tu mi brten ce na /
analyzed: rigs dman pa la sogs pas de rnams la rab tu mi brten ce na /
translated: By those of inferior lineage and so on, they are not well-established.

original: 'dir bgrod byar gnas pas yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bgrod byar gnas pas yod pa ste /
translated: Here, it is existence as a place to be traversed,

original: thams cad du son pa'i nam mkha'o zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad du son pa'i nam mkha'o zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: like space that pervades everywhere.

original: bgrod pa dang gnas zhes pas rigs las mi g-yo ba'i sbyor bas 'dzin pa'i phyir na rten no //
analyzed: bgrod pa dang gnas zhes pas rigs las mi g-yo ba'i sbyor bas 'dzin pa'i phyir na rten no //
translated: By traverse and place, it is a support because it is grasped by the application of not moving from the lineage.

original: de ltar yang ci yang med pa'i chos kyi dbyings med pa nyid la ji ltar de rnams brten ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ci yang med pa'i chos kyi dbyings med pa nyid la ji ltar de rnams brten ce na /
translated: In that case, how are they supported in the non-existence of the realm of phenomena, which is nothing at all?

original: dper na nam mkha' ci yang med pa la zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa zad par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ci yang med pa la zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa zad par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the sky, which is nothing at all, the light rays of the moon and sun eliminate darkness.

original: dmigs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: Regarding the perspective of the object, the treatise says:

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: The object is all phenomena,

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
translated: and that is virtuous and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang / zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang / zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: the defiled and undefiled phenomena, and those conditioned and unconditioned,

original: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //
translated: the phenomena common to the disciples, and those uncommon to the Sage,üîΩand so forth.

original: ces te sogs pas ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid la rtog par bya bas na rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces te sogs pas ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid la rtog par bya bas na rtogs pa ste /
translated: The mundane realizations are the unwholesome and neutral states, since one should investigate them.

original: dge ba la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa zhes pa ni phung po gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rtogs pa zhes pa ni phung po gnyis te /
translated: The wholesome states are the mundane and supramundane realizations, which are the two aggregates.

original: de gsungs pa ni chos rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni chos rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those are stated in the lines beginning with ‚Äúall phenomena‚Äù and so forth.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi don rim gyis rtogs par bya ba la gang chos rnams thams cad de'i don gyi thabs su 'dir don du gnyer bar byed cing tshol bar byed pas so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi don rim gyis rtogs par bya ba la gang chos rnams thams cad de'i don gyi thabs su 'dir don du gnyer bar byed cing tshol bar byed pas so //
translated: The meaning of the seven realizations is to be realized gradually. Here, one should pursue and seek the meaning of all phenomena as the means to that.

original: des na de rnams la ma zhen pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam @50a * //
analyzed: des na de rnams la ma zhen pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam @50a * //
translated: Therefore, since one is not attached to those, one should pursue the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: pa'i bden pa gnyis las mi 'da' bas dmigs pas dag par rtogs par gyur nas mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i bden pa gnyis las mi 'da' bas dmigs pas dag par rtogs par gyur nas mngon par sangs rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Since one does not go beyond the two truths, one realizes the purity of the object and attains manifest enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore:

original: dmigs pas chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pas chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: All phenomena are objects of observation.

original: zhes 'dis rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba las dmigs pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos 'phen par 'gyur te /üîΩde lta na yang rang bzhin la dmigs dgos te /
analyzed: zhes 'dis rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba las dmigs pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos 'phen par 'gyur te / de lta na yang rang bzhin la dmigs dgos te /
translated: This verse shows that by the power of meditating on the reality of phenomena that are objects of observation, one will come to apprehend phenomena from the freedom of the nature that is the realization of the nature.

original: de kho na nyid tsam po la dmigs pa de don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid tsam po la dmigs pa de don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even so, one must observe the nature because one is striving to observe reality itself.

original: de nyid kyis na rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: For that very reason, Subh≈´ti, the knowledge of all aspects is the observation of the absence of entity.

original: bstan bcos su yang rnam pa bzhi nyid ces so //
analyzed: bstan bcos su yang rnam pa bzhi nyid ces so //
translated: And in the treatise, it says, ‚ÄúIt is the very fourfold.‚Äù

original: 'o na chos rnams dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: 'o na chos rnams dngos po med pa ste //
translated: Well, if phenomena are nonexistent entities,

original: ngo bo med pas ci yang med //
analyzed: ngo bo med pas ci yang med //
translated: since they are essenceless, they are nothing at all.

original: ces pas ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ces pas ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can they be objects of observation?

original: dngos med ces pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa min zhes pa la dgongs pas so //üîΩdngos po med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos med ces pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa min zhes pa la dgongs pas so // dngos po med pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The meaning of non-entity is that it is not an object of entity.

original: rab 'byor gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis med pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Non-entity is non-dual, as it is said: Non-duality, Subh≈´ti, is non-entity.

original: don dam pa la ni gang du yang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dang / dmigs pa'i spros pa med de /
analyzed: don dam pa la ni gang du yang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dang / dmigs pa'i spros pa med de /
translated: In the ultimate, there is no proliferation of an object of observation, an observer, or an observation.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yod dang med pa'i mtha' dang dbus su yongs su brtags pa'i khyad par gyis dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa la byis pa rnams kyis skrag par byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yod dang med pa'i mtha' dang dbus su yongs su brtags pa'i khyad par gyis dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa la byis pa rnams kyis skrag par byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Since dependent origination itself is essentially non-arisen, it cannot be observed by the distinctions of the extremes of existence and non-existence and the middle, and because childish beings are frightened by the absence of observation,

original: de nyid gting dpogs par mi nus pa'i phyir na zab pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gting dpogs par mi nus pa'i phyir na zab pa ste /
translated: it is profound.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the venerable NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also says:

original: yod dang med las rnam 'das pas //
analyzed: yod dang med las rnam 'das pas //
translated: Since it is beyond existence and nonexistence,

original: gang rnams la ni blo mi gnas //
analyzed: gang rnams la ni blo mi gnas //
translated: And the mind does not abide in anything.

original: de yis zab mo dmigs med pa'i //üîΩrkyen gyi don la rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: de yis zab mo dmigs med pa'i // rkyen gyi don la rnam par bsgom //
translated: Therefore, in the profound, non-apprehension,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: One should meditate on the meaning of conditions.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba de ni zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' las grol ba de ni zab pa nyid do //
translated: The freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial is the profundity.

original: gang la dngos med dngos med min //
analyzed: gang la dngos med dngos med min //
translated: Where there is neither existence nor non-existence,

original: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
translated: And does not abide before the mind,

original: de la rtogs pa gzhan med pas //üîΩdmigs pa med nas rab tu zhi //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa gzhan med pas // dmigs pa med nas rab tu zhi //
translated: Since there is no other realization than that,üîΩIt is pacified because of the absence of apprehension.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pas so //
translated: By the aspect of natural peace.

original: de nyid mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid @50b du chos thams cad la dmigs la /
analyzed: de nyid mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid @50b du chos thams cad la dmigs la /
translated: In the state of non-equipoise, one observes all phenomena, which have the nature of conventional and ultimate reality.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa ma lus pa las log pa'i cir yang dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa la gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa ma lus pa las log pa'i cir yang dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa la gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: In the state of equipoise, one abides in the absence of any observation whatsoever, which is the reversal of all conceptual elaborations.

original: dmigs pa la bsgrub pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa la bsgrub pa'i dus su ni /
translated: At the time of accomplishing observation,

original: mtha' rtsom pa bzhin la /
analyzed: mtha' rtsom pa bzhin la /
translated: One should be like a person who has finished their work.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin gyi ched du bya ba ni mtshon bya bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin gyi ched du bya ba ni mtshon bya bzhin no //
translated: The state of the result of that which is to arise is the natural purpose, like the object indicated.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: In that regard, the treatise states:üîΩThe mind of the supreme of all beings,

original: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
analyzed: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
translated: the abandonment and realization,üîΩthe three great things,

original: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gis //
analyzed: chen po gsum gyi rang 'byung gis //
translated: are the natural purpose.üîΩThe three great things are the three: the mind, the abandonment, and the realization.

original: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //
translated: The mind is the supreme of all beings.üîΩThe abandonment is the abandonment of the two obscurations.

original: zhes te / rang las 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pas rang 'byung ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams la de rnams kyi ched du bya ba ni 'dir gang ched du gnyer bar bya ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩsems can kun gyi mchog nyid du sgrub par byed pa la chen po gsum rnams kyis te /
analyzed: zhes te / rang las 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pas rang 'byung ste / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de rnams kyi ched du bya ba ni 'dir gang ched du gnyer bar bya ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod par 'gyur ba'o // sems can kun gyi mchog nyid du sgrub par byed pa la chen po gsum rnams kyis te /
translated: The realization is the realization of the two kinds of selflessness.üîΩThe three great things are the three: the mind, the abandonment, and the realization.üîΩThe mind is the supreme of all beings.

original: de la gsum ni sems dang / spong ba dang / rtogs pa dang gsum ste /
analyzed: de la gsum ni sems dang / spong ba dang / rtogs pa dang gsum ste /
translated: The abandonment is the abandonment of the two obscurations.üîΩThe realization is the realization of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: de la sems che ba nyid ni rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la sems che ba nyid ni rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa'i sems so //
translated: The greatness of mind is the mind like a diamond, and so on.

original: lta ba rnams thams cad spang ba'i don du bstan pa ni spong ba chen po nyid la /
analyzed: lta ba rnams thams cad spang ba'i don du bstan pa ni spong ba chen po nyid la /
translated: The teaching for the sake of abandoning all views is the greatness of abandonment.

original: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa nyid la zhen pa med pa nyid ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa nyid la zhen pa med pa nyid ni /
translated: The absence of attachment to the very mind of enlightenment, and so on, is

original: rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: the greatness of realization.

original: sems chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis ched du gnyer bar byed ces pa ni ched du byed pa chen po'o //
analyzed: sems chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis ched du gnyer bar byed ces pa ni ched du byed pa chen po'o //
translated: The greatness of mind, the greatness of abandonment, and the greatness of realization are the great aim.

original: 'dir ched du bya ba chen po'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems can chen po la dgongs pa'o zhes pa ni sems can chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dir ched du bya ba chen po'i yul yin pa'i phyir sems can chen po la dgongs pa'o zhes pa ni sems can chen po'o //
translated: Here, the great aim is the object of the great being, and so on.

original: 'dir de nyid skabs su bab ces pas rtogs par bya ba'i don du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir de nyid skabs su bab ces pas rtogs par bya ba'i don du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the very same is the object of realization, and so on.

original: rtogs pa'i don ni don med par mi dmigs pas 'dod pa ste rgyu mtshan des na'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don ni don med par mi dmigs pas 'dod pa ste rgyu mtshan des na'o //
translated: The object of realization is the object of desire, because it is not observed as meaningless. For that reason, it is the object of realization.

original: sems can gyi phung po zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa la sems can gyi ris zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa la sems can gyi ris zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúaggregate of sentient beings‚Äù is the brief presentation, and ‚Äúthe class of sentient beings‚Äù is the extensive explanation.

original: de'i mchog nyid ni theg pa chen pos yang dag par bsdus pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i mchog nyid ni theg pa chen pos yang dag par bsdus pa'i ched du'o //
translated: Its supremacy is for the sake of being subsumed by the Great Vehicle.

original: ma lus pa'i 'khor bar bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i sems can gyi phung po'i mchog nyid chen po ni sems can gyi phung po chen po nyid kyis brjod pa @51a * //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i 'khor bar bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i sems can gyi phung po'i mchog nyid chen po ni sems can gyi phung po chen po nyid kyis brjod pa @51a * //
translated: The great supremacy of the aggregate of sentient beings who remain in cyclic existence without remainder is expressed by the ‚Äúgreat aggregate of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: yin no // de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde'i dus la zhes pa ni go skabs te /
analyzed: yin no // de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de'i dus la zhes pa ni go skabs te /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn said to the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva Maitreya, ‚ÄúMaitreya, you should understand that the bodhisattvas who have the four dharmas are those who uphold the holy Dharma.üîΩWhat are the four? They are the four dharmas of self, sentient being, life, and person.

original: 'dir bdag la sogs pa bzhi ni yum chen mor ni bcu gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag la sogs pa bzhi ni yum chen mor ni bcu gsum gsungs te /
translated: Here, the four of self and so on are explained in the Great Mother in thirteen [passages].

original: thams cad kyang grub mtha' tha dad pa las don gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang grub mtha' tha dad pa las don gcig go //
translated: All of them have the same meaning, but they are different philosophical systems.

original: sgra bshad pa tsam gyis tha dad de /
analyzed: sgra bshad pa tsam gyis tha dad de /
translated: They are different merely by way of etymological explanations.

original: de la ngar 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na bdag go //
analyzed: de la ngar 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis na bdag go //
translated: In that regard, it is a self because it is the cause of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba rnams su chud pas na sems can no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su chud pas na sems can no //
translated: It is a sentient being because it is contained within transmigrators.

original: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis ris mthun pa'i lus zad pa dang mi gnas pa'o zhes pa ni srog go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis ris mthun pa'i lus zad pa dang mi gnas pa'o zhes pa ni srog go //
translated: The faculty of life force is the duration and non-interruption of the body of a sentient being of a particular type.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi dbang gis skye bar 'gyur bas rtsom pas grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi dbang gis skye bar 'gyur bas rtsom pas grol ba'o //
translated: It is the beginning of birth due to the power of affliction and karma.

original: khams la sogs pa'i zas kyis gso bar byed ces pas gso ba'o //
analyzed: khams la sogs pa'i zas kyis gso bar byed ces pas gso ba'o //
translated: It is nourished by the food of the elements and so on.

original: skyes bu'i lus la gnod par byed pas na skye bu ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus la gnod par byed pas na skye bu ste /
translated: It is a person because it harms the body of a person.

original: skyes bu'i dbang po dang ldan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang po dang ldan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a person because it possesses the faculties of a person.

original: gzugs kyi khams pa'i skyes bu rnams nyid la skyes pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams pa'i skyes bu rnams nyid la skyes pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that the person of the form realm would not be a person.

original: yang nas yang du 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur bar bas na gang zag go //
analyzed: yang nas yang du 'gro ba rnams su 'jug par 'gyur bar bas na gang zag go //
translated: It is a person because it repeatedly enters the transmigrations.

original: gtso bo yid kyi las rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams su skye bar byed ces pas na shed can no //
analyzed: gtso bo yid kyi las rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams su skye bar byed ces pas na shed can no //
translated: It is a sentient being because it is born in the transmigrations through the power of mental karma.

original: shed kyi bdag po'o zhes pas ni shed bdag go //
analyzed: shed kyi bdag po'o zhes pas ni shed bdag go //
translated: It is the self of a sentient being because it is the lord of the self.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis rten du gyur pas na byed pa po'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis rten du gyur pas na byed pa po'o //
translated: It is an agent because it is the basis of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: las kyi rnam par smin par myong bas na tshor ba po'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin par myong bas na tshor ba po'o //
translated: It is the experiencer because it experiences the ripening of karma.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas yin pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas yin pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
translated: It is the knower because it is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i gnas yin pa'i phyir mthong pa po'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i gnas yin pa'i phyir mthong pa po'o //
translated: It is the seer because it is the basis of the five consciousnesses such as visual consciousness.

original: de rnams kyi lta ba ni de dngos po yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lta ba ni de dngos po yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Its view is the belief that it exists as a thing.

original: 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Arising is samsara.

original: 'jig pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Destruction is nirvana.

original: de gnyis la lta ba mchog tu nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la lta ba mchog tu nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: The view of these two is the view of annihilation and permanence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas 'chad par 'gyur zhes pas ni chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas 'chad par 'gyur zhes pas ni chad par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the belief that after attaining nirvana, it will be destroyed.

original: rtag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rtag par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of permanence is the belief that it will arise permanently.

original: 'on kyang 'di rnams ni sngon du byung ba las phyis med do zhes pa la chad pa la gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod cing med pa la med ces pa ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di rnams ni sngon du byung ba las phyis med do zhes pa la chad pa la gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod cing med pa la med ces pa ni rtag pa'o //
translated: However, the view of annihilation is the belief that what previously existed later becomes nonexistent, and the view of permanence is the belief that what exists by its own intrinsic reality does not become nonexistent.

original: phung po lnga po rnams kyi lus ngo bo nyid med pa de rnams la ngo bo zhes pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po rnams kyi lus ngo bo nyid med pa de rnams la ngo bo zhes pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The aggregates are the body, and their realitylessness is their ‚Äúessence.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de la sogs pa'i log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu @51b 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la sogs pa'i log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu @51b 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, there are such things as wrong views, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism, and so on.

original: chos zhes pa ni rigs pa'i lam zhes pa ste spong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chos zhes pa ni rigs pa'i lam zhes pa ste spong pa chen po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù is the path of reasoning, the Great Way.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Lord, etc.

original: byang chub kyang sems 'di nyid la thams cad mkhyen pa yang sems 'di nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyang sems 'di nyid la thams cad mkhyen pa yang sems 'di nyid do //
translated: Enlightenment is in this mind itself, and omniscience is in this mind itself.

original: zag pa med pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i zag pa thams cad med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i zag pa thams cad med pa'o //
translated: It is without outflows, because it is without all the outflows of death and transmigration, along with their instincts.

original: mnyam pa med pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang ngo //
translated: It is without equal, because it is not like the common worldlings.

original: mi mnyam pa ni sangs rgyas de rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni sangs rgyas de rnams dang ngo //
translated: It is unequal, because it is not like those Buddhas.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ste mi mnyam pa med pa'o //üîΩma chags pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ste mi mnyam pa med pa'o // ma chags pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: It is equal and unequal, because it is without inequality.üîΩIt is unattached, because it is taught.

original: yongs su ma zin zhes pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma zin zhes pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: It is unappropriated, because it is explained.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par bshad zhin to zhes pa ni rtogs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par bshad zhin to zhes pa ni rtogs pa chen po'o //
translated: The rest are explained in the commentary.

original: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of practice:

original: de la go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa ni sems dpa' chen po'i sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs la /
analyzed: de la go cha dang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa ni sems dpa' chen po'i sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs la /
translated: The practice of armor and the practice of engagement are mentioned in the context of the term ‚Äúgreat being.‚Äù

original: gang pos de brjod pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: gang pos de brjod pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: P≈´r·πáa‚Äôs statement of that is from ‚ÄúThen‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang du 'jug pa nyid bgrod pa ste /üîΩ'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
analyzed: gang du 'jug pa nyid bgrod pa ste / 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //
translated: Where one engages is the path.üîΩThe practice of engagement is to be known

original: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: as mounting the Great Vehicle.

original: go cha bgos zhes pa dang / theg pa yang dag par gnas zhes pa'i bar gyi tshig phyis pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: go cha bgos zhes pa dang / theg pa yang dag par gnas zhes pa'i bar gyi tshig phyis pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The practice of armor is from ‚Äúhaving donned the armor‚Äù up to ‚Äúabiding in the Great Vehicle.‚Äù

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi so so'i go cha re re la ma lus pa nye bar gnas pa ni go cha'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi so so'i go cha re re la ma lus pa nye bar gnas pa ni go cha'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: The practice of armor is the complete presence of each of the armors of the six perfections.

original: dpung gi tshogs kyis go gon pa bzhin te //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs kyis go gon pa bzhin te //
translated: It is like donning armor with an army.

original: rgyas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo la'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo la'o //
translated: The extensive practice is in the great mother, the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni go cha ste bsrung ba dang bsrung ba'i sgrub pa ni bar mar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni go cha ste bsrung ba dang bsrung ba'i sgrub pa ni bar mar ro //
translated: Here, the Blessed Lady is the armor, and the practice of protection is intermediate.

original: thams cad du ni rnam pa thams cad rnams kyis te /
analyzed: thams cad du ni rnam pa thams cad rnams kyis te /
translated: Everywhere means in all the modes.

original: ji ltar ched du byed pa la gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ched du byed pa la gzhan gyis mi thub pa'o //
translated: Just as one is invincible in one's purpose,

original: 'dis ni bar du gcod pa thams cad la mda' so sor bsnun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bar du gcod pa thams cad la mda' so sor bsnun par 'gyur te /
translated: one is invincible in all obstacles.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, the treatise states:

original: sbyin pa la sogs rnam drug la //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs rnam drug la //
translated: The six, generosity and so on,

original: de dag so sor bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: de dag so sor bsdus pa yis //
translated: are each subsumed in the six,

original: go cha'i bsgrub pa gang yin de //
analyzed: go cha'i bsgrub pa gang yin de //
translated: and the practice of armor

original: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
analyzed: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
translated: is explained by the six sets of six.

original: ces te gang gis sbyin pa byed pa de ni sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: ces te gang gis sbyin pa byed pa de ni sbyin pa ste /
translated: The one who gives is generosity.

original: rang gi rang nyid yongs su gtong zhing gzhan rang gi byed pa'i sems kyis te /
analyzed: rang gi rang nyid yongs su gtong zhing gzhan rang gi byed pa'i sems kyis te /
translated: One gives oneself to others with the thought of becoming their servant.

original: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi dbye ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold, distinguished as material, fearlessness, and Dharma.

original: de la @52a * //
analyzed: de la @52a * //
translated: Here,

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa ji srid du bdag nyid kyi dngos po yang yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa ji srid du bdag nyid kyi dngos po yang yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The generosity of material things is the giving of one's own body, together with its results, for as long as one lives.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang skyed pas byas pa dang ma byas pa'i gnod pas gzhan rnams la nye bar mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos kyi sbyin pa ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dub pa med par bsam gtan gyis gzhan du bskyed par byas pas gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par byas nas shes rab kyis yang dag
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang skyed pas byas pa dang ma byas pa'i gnod pas gzhan rnams la nye bar mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro // chos kyi sbyin pa ni brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dub pa med par bsam gtan gyis gzhan du bskyed par byas pas gzhan rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par byas nas shes rab kyis yang dag
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is the giving of fearlessness to others by means of morality, patience, and vigor, because one does not harm others, either in deed or in thought.

original: pa ji lta ba'i don nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: pa ji lta ba'i don nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the teaching is the giving of the perfections of vigor, meditation, and wisdom, by means of meditation, because one generates them in others without fatigue, and by means of wisdom, because one teaches the truth just as it is, having understood the thoughts and propensities of others.

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis mi dge ba bcu rnams dang / btags pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams las ldog par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis mi dge ba bcu rnams dang / btags pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams las ldog par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the avoidance of the ten unwholesome actions, both naturally unwholesome and those prohibited by the Buddha.

original: bzod pa dang lhan cig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang lhan cig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three that accompany patience areüîΩpatience in being harmed by others, patience in remaining in the face of suffering, and patience in the face of the characteristics of phenomena, which is the patience in the fact that phenomena are unborn.

original: gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa la bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la lhag par gnas pa'i bzod pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa la bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la lhag par gnas pa'i bzod pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three that accompany diligence are diligence in virtue, diligence in being mindful, and diligence in being diligent.üîΩThe three that accompany concentration are concentration that is the mind being focused by being one-pointed, concentration that is the mind being focused by being one-pointed, and concentration that is the mind being focused by being one-pointed.

original: dge ba'i las la spro ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems rtse gcig pas sems par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i bar du mi gnas pa'i byang chub kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i las la spro ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems rtse gcig pas sems par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i bar du mi gnas pa'i byang chub kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The three that accompany wisdom are the perfection of wisdom of the nonabiding enlightenment of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, the perfection of wisdom of the nonabiding enlightenment of the inseparability of appearance and emptiness, and the perfection of wisdom of the nonabiding enlightenment of the inseparability of appearance and emptiness.

original: byang chub sems kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir rten dam pa dang dngos po mtha' dag kun tu spyod pas dngos po dam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi phan pa dang bde ba la dbang ba yin pa'i phyir dbang dam pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung ba'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa dam pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir rten dam pa dang dngos po mtha' dag kun tu spyod pas dngos po dam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi phan pa dang bde ba la dbang ba yin pa'i phyir dbang dam pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gzung ba'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa dam pa dang /
translated: The ten excellent qualities are the excellent basis because it is the basis of the mind of enlightenment, the excellent thing because it is the universal practice of all things, the excellent power because it is the power to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings, the excellent skill in means because it is the retention of nonconceptual wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba dam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med par byed pas kun nas 'du ba rnam par dag pa dam par rnams ni so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las bshad do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba dam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med par byed pas kun nas 'du ba rnam par dag pa dam par rnams ni so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid du byang chub sems dpa'i sa las bshad do //
translated: the excellent dedication because it is the dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, the excellent purity of the assembly because it is the removal of the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to omniscience, the excellent birth because it is the birth of the bodhisattvas in the lineage of the tathagatas, the excellent name because it is the attainment of the name of bodhisattva, the excellent wisdom because it is the attainment of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, and the excellent abandonment because it is the abandonment of the afflictions of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'dir sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi'o //
translated: Here, generosity, morality, and patience are the training in superior morality, meditative stabilization is the training in superior mind,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhag par shes rab la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhag par shes rab la /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom is the training in superior wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni @52b gsum char gyis yang lhan cig byed pa can no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni @52b gsum char gyis yang lhan cig byed pa can no //
translated: And effort is the companion of all three.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la /
translated: Generosity, morality, and patience are the accumulation of merit,

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: and the perfection of meditative stabilization and wisdom are the accumulation of wisdom.üîΩAnd effort is the companion of both accumulations.

original: brtson 'grus ni tshogs gnyi ga'i grogs te mdor bsdu na ni snying rje'i las kun sems can gyi don du byed pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni tshogs gnyi ga'i grogs te mdor bsdu na ni snying rje'i las kun sems can gyi don du byed pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: In brief, the accumulation of merit is the activity of compassion, which is done for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: And the accumulation of wisdom is the realization of the goal through wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par dmigs su med kyang du rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir rgyun ma chad pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs rnams la rab tu 'jug la ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs su sbyin pa la sogs pa btang snyomsüîΩsu byas nas bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par dmigs su med kyang du rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir rgyun ma chad pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs rnams la rab tu 'jug la ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs su sbyin pa la sogs pa btang snyoms su byas nas bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Generosity and so on are ultimately unobservable, but they exist conventionally. Therefore, they are engaged in the non-concentrated states without interruption, but in the concentrated states, generosity and so on are abandoned by being made into equanimity.

original: de dag gi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la so sor re res mtha' dag bsdus pa la nye bar gnas pas gang zhig gi sgrub pa rgyas par bshad par byed pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la so sor re res mtha' dag bsdus pa la nye bar gnas pas gang zhig gi sgrub pa rgyas par bshad par byed pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: Since each of them is fully included in each of their generosity and so on, the explanation of the extensive practice is that of the characteristic of the stage conducive to liberation.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The practice of armor is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva... and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni 'di 'dra ba'i sems so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni 'di 'dra ba'i sems so //
translated: Thus refers to such a mind.

original: phyogs dang yul grangs kyis yongs su mi chod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du gzhal du med pa dang bgrang du med pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang yul grangs kyis yongs su mi chod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du gzhal du med pa dang bgrang du med pa'o //
translated: Since they are not limited by direction, place, or number, they are immeasurable and innumerable, respectively.

original: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya zhes pa ni ji skad kyi ched du bya ba las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste skur ba 'debs pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya zhes pa ni ji skad kyi ched du bya ba las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste skur ba 'debs pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase to be completely liberated means not to be otherwise than the purpose for which it is done; it is stated as the antidote for denigration.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The phrase does not exist and so forth is [stated] as the antidote for imputation.

original: de ltar na mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po'i dbu ma sgrub pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na mtha' gnyis kyi gnyen po'i dbu ma sgrub pas so //
translated: Thus, the middle way is established as the antidote for the two extremes.

original: de bzhin du thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi go cha gsungs nas bsam pa'i rang bzhin brjod par 'dod nas rigs pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi go cha gsungs nas bsam pa'i rang bzhin brjod par 'dod nas rigs pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: Having stated the armor of the wisdom arisen from hearing, wishing to express the nature of contemplation, he asks logically:

original: de zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes pa ste /
translated: What is that?

original: de la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid la byed pa po gang yang mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid la byed pa po gang yang mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: There, any agent is not tenable in the absence of the two extremes.

original: chos rnams ni phung po lnga po la /
analyzed: chos rnams ni phung po lnga po la /
translated: The phenomena are the five aggregates.

original: de rnams mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams mtha' gnyis dang bral ba nyid kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The reality of their absence of the two extremes is their nature.

original: sgyu ma ni rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gis kun rdzob kyi sgra'i don te /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni rgyu gzhan gyi dbang gis kun rdzob kyi sgra'i don te /
translated: An illusion is the object of conventional terms, being dependent on other causes.

original: de la yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis brtags la /
analyzed: de la yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis brtags la /
translated: In this regard, existence and so forth are investigated.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos nyid nye bar gzung ba nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos nyid nye bar gzung ba nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Emptiness is asserted to be the nature of reality.

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang rkyen @53a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang rkyen @53a * //
translated: Therefore, due to causes and conditions,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis phung po lnga po rnams ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i sgra don la dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnams ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis phung po lnga po rnams ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i sgra don la dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnams ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams so //
translated: the five aggregates are the meaning of the terms of conventional nature, and things, non-things, and so forth are the imagined natures.

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don dam par ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don dam par ste /
translated: The nature of emptiness, the reality, is the meaning of the consummate nature, ultimately.

original: kun rdzob dang de dag ro gcig nyid pas mtha' dag mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'o zhes pas mtha' gnyis dang bral ba grub pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang de dag ro gcig nyid pas mtha' dag mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'o zhes pas mtha' gnyis dang bral ba grub pa ste /
translated: Since the conventional and those [natures] are of one taste, the entirety is free from the two extremes. Thus, freedom from the two extremes is established.

original: de nyid kyi dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: The example of that is stated:

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa ste /
translated: It is like this, for example.

original: mkhas pas phul tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas phul tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the best.

original: nye gnas ni slob ma'o //
analyzed: nye gnas ni slob ma'o //
translated: The attendant is the disciple.

original: de ji snyam zhes pa ni thun mong du dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ji snyam zhes pa ni thun mong du dri ba'o //
translated: The phrase what do you think? is a common question.

original: gang yang zhes pa ni khyad par gyi'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa ni khyad par gyi'o //
translated: The word also is a particular [question].

original: gsod pa ni bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa ni bcom pa'o //
translated: Killing is destroying.

original: 'chi ba ni rang nyid do //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni rang nyid do //
translated: Death is one's own.

original: bshig pa ni mi snang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bshig pa ni mi snang bar byas pa'o //
translated: Destruction is making invisible.

original: mi snang ba ni rang nyid kyis so //üîΩbsams pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab gsungs nas /
analyzed: mi snang ba ni rang nyid kyis so // bsams pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab gsungs nas /
translated: Invisible is by oneself.üîΩHaving stated the wisdom of the nature of reflection,

original: bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin gyi brjod par bya ba la /
translated: with regard to the topic of the wisdom of the nature of meditation,

original: bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: meditation is threefold:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zung du 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zung du 'brel ba'o //
translated: ≈õamatha, vipa≈õyanƒÅ, and their union.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩgal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni / gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of ≈õamatha, it is stated:üîΩIf, when the mind is distracted to names and realities,üîΩto the mind summarized in the six aspects explained previously,

original: ming dang ni de nyid dmigs pa la ste sngon du bshad pa'i rnam pa drug gis mdor bsdus pa'i sems la yang langs pa na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa mi skrag pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang ni de nyid dmigs pa la ste sngon du bshad pa'i rnam pa drug gis mdor bsdus pa'i sems la yang langs pa na brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa mi skrag pa ste /
translated: covetousness, mental dissatisfaction, and so on do not frighten one,

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: how is that?

original: de nyid kyis mi nyams te rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mi nyams te rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not lose that by that, because one sees the fault of distraction.

original: kun tu mi skrag pa ni ngang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu mi skrag pa ni ngang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not at all frightened, because one has become accustomed to it.

original: kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i dbang du gyur pas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la 'bad rtsol mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i dbang du gyur pas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems la 'bad rtsol mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not become frightened at all, because one is spontaneously and effortlessly absorbed in the mind of meditative equipoise.

original: 'di tsam zhes pa ni zhi gnas 'dis sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i go cha brtan pas so //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhes pa ni zhi gnas 'dis sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i go cha brtan pas so //
translated: This much means that one is fully armored in this meditative serenity in order to lead all sentient beings to complete nirvana.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa lhag mthong gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa lhag mthong gsungs pa ni /
translated: Then, the verse beginning with then teaches insight.

original: dmigs pa de ni don dam par min te /
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni don dam par min te /
translated: That meditative object is not ultimately,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid de stong pa nyid mthong nas gang du gang gang gis mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par mthong ba yod pa ma yin la don ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid de stong pa nyid mthong nas gang du gang gang gis mya ngan las 'da' bar byed par mthong ba yod pa ma yin la don ni don dam pa'o //
translated: because when one sees emptiness, the ultimate, one does not see any nirvana, anywhere, by which one might attain nirvana.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sems can gyi don la so sor go ji ltar bgos kyang bgos pa med @53b ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sems can gyi don la so sor go ji ltar bgos kyang bgos pa med @53b ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: Although it is distributed in all aspects of omniscience and the welfare of sentient beings, it is not distributed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: byed pa po dang rgyu med pa'i phyir ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang rgyu med pa'i phyir ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is unmade because there is no maker and no cause.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyis ni rnam par ma bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyis ni rnam par ma bsgyur ba'o //
translated: It is unchangeable because there is no cause of destruction.

original: gnyi ga'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mi 'thad pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mi 'thad pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i ste /
translated: It is unconditioned because it is not tenable that it is the simultaneous condition of both.

original: ma byung ba dang 'byung ba dang de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du tshig gsum mo //
analyzed: ma byung ba dang 'byung ba dang de khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'bras bu thob pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du tshig gsum mo //
translated: The three phrases are respectively in terms of non-arising, arising, its distinction, and approaching the attainment of the result.

original: yang na thams cad shes pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid ni rnam par dag pa la de ni de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na thams cad shes pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid ni rnam par dag pa la de ni de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Or, omniscience is the pure dharmadhatu itself, and that is its nature.

original: de bzhin du de nyid rtag pa'i phyir ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid rtag pa'i phyir ma byas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, it is unmade because it is permanent.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos par byas pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos par byas pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: It is unconditioned because it is not sullied by faults such as desire.

original: gnyen po rnams kyis sbyang du med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po rnams kyis sbyang du med pa'o //
translated: It is not to be purified by antidotes.

original: sems can zhes pa ni de rnams kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes pa ni de rnams kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings are also characterized by non-existence, the nature of the realm of phenomena, which is the ultimate absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rab 'byor la zung du 'jug pas bgrod pa'i lam gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pas rab 'byor la zung du 'jug pas bgrod pa'i lam gsungs pa ste /
translated: Why is it so? and so forth, Subh≈´ti is taught the path of progress through unity.

original: de la phung po lnga po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong la de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin dang yang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong la de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin dang yang bral ba nyid de /
translated: Therein, the five aggregates are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality, and they are also devoid of the nature of suchness, which has the nature of emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i de nyid ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i de nyid ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: That suchness is neither bound nor liberated.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dben pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir dang zhes pa gsum ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung rnams kyis de kho na nyid du skyes pa la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dben pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir dang zhes pa gsum ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung rnams kyis de kho na nyid du skyes pa la sogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir la /
translated: The three phrases ‚Äúbecause of not being real,‚Äù ‚Äúbecause of being void,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of not being produced‚Äù are for the sake of refuting production, etc., in reality by means of direct perception, inference, and scriptural authority.

original: kun rdzob tu ni bcings pa dang grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bcings pa dang grol ba nyid do //
translated: But in the conventional sense there is bondage and liberation.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag dbyer med pa ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag dbyer med pa ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of union is the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: 'dir gsungs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni 'jug pa'i dus su yang go cha mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni 'jug pa'i dus su yang go cha mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas it is stated here‚Äù and so on is for the sake of not abandoning the armor even when one is engaged.

original: gang po'i smra ba rdzogs nas mi sbra ba dang / rab 'byor gyi dri ba drug ste /
analyzed: gang po'i smra ba rdzogs nas mi sbra ba dang / rab 'byor gyi dri ba drug ste /
translated: The six questions of Subh≈´ti follow the conclusion of P≈´r·πáa‚Äôs speech.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba dang de dag phan tshun tha dad pa med pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu 'das pa dang gnas par nges pa dang / gnyen po'i sbyor bas shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtogs pa po'i dbang du byas te gang ji ltar gang nas gang gis gang du gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes /üîΩ'dis @54a * //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba dang de dag phan tshun tha dad pa med pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las shin tu 'das pa dang gnas par nges pa dang / gnyen po'i sbyor bas shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtogs pa po'i dbang du byas te gang ji ltar gang nas gang gis gang du gang zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes / 'dis @54a * //
translated: by whom, how, where, by what, and where will they be liberated?

original: grol ba'i don gyi theg pa'o zhes pa'i theg pa'i don ni lhag ma ste go sla'o //
analyzed: grol ba'i don gyi theg pa'o zhes pa'i theg pa'i don ni lhag ma ste go sla'o //
translated: This is the meaning of vehicle in the statement ‚ÄúThis is the vehicle for the purpose of liberation.‚Äù The rest is easy to understand.

original: ji ltar na chen po nyid ces pa ni 'dri ba dang po ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na chen po nyid ces pa ni 'dri ba dang po ste /
translated: How is it greatness? This is the first question.

original: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'i sbyor ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the application of wisdom and compassion that is desired.

original: ji ltar na de la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur zhes pa ste gang gis bgrod pas de theg pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na de la yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur zhes pa ste gang gis bgrod pas de theg pa ste /
translated: How does one correctly enter it? By what is it traversed, that is the vehicle.

original: 'gro bar bya ba gang la 'di bya ba des 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba gang la 'di bya ba des 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgoing‚Äù is that which is to be gone to by that which is going.

original: 'gro ba ni nges pa 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni nges pa 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: ‚Äú Going‚Äù means ‚Äúto emerge.‚Äù

original: 'di la 'dri ba ni gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'dri ba ni gang nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: The question here is ‚Äúfrom where will it emerge?‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid gang gis 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni 'di'i 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang gis 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni 'di'i 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is ‚Äúby what characteristic will it go?‚Äù

original: gang gis de yang dag par zhugs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de yang dag par zhugs zhes pa'o //
translated: The question is ‚Äúby what will it be correctly engaged?‚Äù

original: 'gro ba dang song ba'i gnas skabs gang du med par 'dod pa 'dri ba ni gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang song ba'i gnas skabs gang du med par 'dod pa 'dri ba ni gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: The question is ‚Äúwhere will it stand, in the state of going or in the state of having gone?‚Äù

original: 'dir ni rigs dman pa la nges par 'byung ba med par 'dod pas dris pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni rigs dman pa la nges par 'byung ba med par 'dod pas dris pa ni /
translated: Here, since it is held that there is no emergence for those of inferior lineage, the question is ‚Äúfrom where will it emerge?‚Äù

original: gang zhig nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //üîΩtheg pa chen po zhes pa ni 'dir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o // theg pa chen po zhes pa ni 'dir ro //
translated: The question is ‚Äúwhere will it stand?‚ÄùüîΩThe question is ‚Äúin what vehicle?‚ÄùüîΩThe question is ‚Äúin what?‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes pas ni chen po bzung la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pas ni chen po bzung la /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the great.

original: tshig bla dags ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig bla dags ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmerely‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: tshad med pa nyid kyis ces pa ni tshad med pas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyis ces pa ni tshad med pas so //
translated: The question is ‚Äúby what is it immeasurable?‚Äù

original: de la dang pos ni dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de la dang pos ni dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: The first is the source of all virtuous qualities.

original: gnyis pas ni gus pa dang / rgyun mchad pa dang / dus yun ring po nye bar bsags pa'i phyir te snga nas bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni gus pa dang / rgyun mchad pa dang / dus yun ring po nye bar bsags pa'i phyir te snga nas bshad do //
translated: The second is the accumulation of respect, continuity, and long duration, as explained above.

original: kun tu gnas zhes pa ni go cha la rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu gnas zhes pa ni go cha la rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Abiding‚Äù means abiding in the armor.

original: 'dir go cha gong du nges par 'byung ba'i sngon du 'gro ba gang ni bsgrub pa la de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir go cha gong du nges par 'byung ba'i sngon du 'gro ba gang ni bsgrub pa la de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the armor is the prerequisite for the prior renunciation, which is twofold:

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: the practice of engagement and the practice of the assembly.

original: de la 'gro ba rtsom pa ni 'jug pa la bya ba'i bsam pa lci ba'i phyir tshogs te thams cad kyi rnam par tshogs pa'i phyir tshogs sam /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba rtsom pa ni 'jug pa la bya ba'i bsam pa lci ba'i phyir tshogs te thams cad kyi rnam par tshogs pa'i phyir tshogs sam /
translated: The practice of engagement is the beginning of going, because the intention to act is heavy. The assembly is the gathering of all the conditions.

original: byang chub chen po 'dis kun tu bsags pas ni tshogs so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'dis kun tu bsags pas ni tshogs so zhes pa ste /
translated: The practice of the assembly is the accumulation of the assembly, because it is the accumulation of the great enlightenment.

original: de gnyi ga yang stong pa dang snying rje dag ro gcig pa nyid du nges pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams kyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang stong pa dang snying rje dag ro gcig pa nyid du nges pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams kyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because they include all of these six perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ram /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir ram /
translated: because they are the essence of the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because they are consistent with the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir te /
translated: and because they are the result of the perfections,

original: ji ltar rigs pas so /üîΩkhams gsum las zhes pa ni gnag cung zhig mi shes pas nyon mongs @54b pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas so / khams gsum las zhes pa ni gnag cung zhig mi shes pas nyon mongs @54b pa'am /
translated: as is appropriate.üîΩThe three realms refers to the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa de ni 'dir khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de ni 'dir khams gsum pa ste /
translated: which are the three realms here.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su brtags pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su brtags pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i khams gsum pa'o //
translated: They are the three realms of the mind and mental factors that are unreal imagination.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said,

original: nyan thos theg pas ni nyon mongs pa de nyid la nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos theg pas ni nyon mongs pa de nyid la nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: the sravaka vehicle is the renunciation of those very afflictions.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The absence of an object is the non-apprehensible dharmadhatu.

original: des mtshon nas ljon pa dang lha'i rigs la sogs pas sngar med pa'i tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: des mtshon nas ljon pa dang lha'i rigs la sogs pas sngar med pa'i tshogs bzhin no //
translated: As this indicates, the Great Vehicle is like an assembly of trees, gods, and so forth that did not exist before.

original: tshig drug po'i lan rnam pa drug po rnams kyis ni theg pa chen po'i che ba nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: tshig drug po'i lan rnam pa drug po rnams kyis ni theg pa chen po'i che ba nyid gsungs te /
translated: The six answers to the six statements teach the greatness of the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhal du med pas chen po nyid dang 'jug pa chen po nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba chen po nyid dang / mtshon cha chen po nyid dang / thob pa chen po nyid dang / gnas chen po nyid de /
analyzed: gzhal du med pas chen po nyid dang 'jug pa chen po nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba chen po nyid dang / mtshon cha chen po nyid dang / thob pa chen po nyid dang / gnas chen po nyid de /
translated: It is great because it is immeasurable, it has great engagement, it has great deliverance, it is the great weapon, it has great attainment, and it is the great abode.

original: gzhal du med pa nyid dang tshad med pa nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa bdun yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa nyid dang tshad med pa nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa bdun yang rung ba'o //
translated: It is also sevenfold, divided into immeasurability and boundlessness.

original: skur pa 'debs pa spong ba'i phyir na kun rdzob gsungs la /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa spong ba'i phyir na kun rdzob gsungs la /
translated: The conventional is taught in order to abandon denial.

original: don dam par ni sgro 'dogs pa spong pa'i phyir te /üîΩde gsungs pa ni 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni sgro 'dogs pa spong pa'i phyir te / de gsungs pa ni 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is taught in order to abandon superimposition.üîΩThe teaching of that is ‚ÄúNevertheless‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa ni 'dir sngon du'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa ni 'dir sngon du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving said this‚Ä¶‚Äù is here at the beginning.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The practice of engaging isüîΩthe four concentrations, the four formless states, generosity, and so forth,üîΩthe path, love, and so forth,üîΩthe possession of the absence of reference points,üîΩthe purity of the three spheres,

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med par ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //üîΩ'jug pa'i bsgrub pa theg chen la //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med par ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni // 'jug pa'i bsgrub pa theg chen la //
translated: the six superknowledges, and the object of intentüîΩin the way of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe practice of engaging is

original: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: to be understood as the vehicle of the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes te / bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa rnams ni gzhan du rnam par 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes te / bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa rnams ni gzhan du rnam par 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: The four concentrations and the four formless states will be explained elsewhere.

original: sbyin pa la sogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Generosity and so forth are the six perfections.

original: lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis bskor ba'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo la mi slob pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis bskor ba'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo la mi slob pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: The path is the essence of the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, the path of distinctive features, and the path of no learning. The one who is beyond training is perfect buddhahood.

original: bgrod par bya bas na lam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod par bya bas na lam zhes pa'o //
translated: It is called a path because it is to be traversed.

original: seng ge bzang pos ni mi slob pa'i lam la khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni ngan pa la gnas pa ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i gnas @55a * //
analyzed: seng ge bzang pos ni mi slob pa'i lam la khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bo zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni ngan pa la gnas pa ste / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas @55a * //
translated: Bhadantasimha means that the path of no-more-learning is established as the nature of the path of distinction, but that is a bad position.

original: skabs su ni mi slob pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs su ni mi slob pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible that the bodhisattva would be in the state of no-more-learning.

original: byams pa la sogs pas 'dod pa la spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i tshang pa'i gnas bzhi rnams ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir tsham med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pas 'dod pa la spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i tshang pa'i gnas bzhi rnams ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir tsham med pa'o //
translated: The four immeasurables of Maitreya and so on, which focus on sentient beings who enjoy desire realm objects, are immeasurable because they focus on all sentient beings.

original: bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms te go rims bzhin du bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang bde ba dang mi 'bral zhing nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang btang snyoms te go rims bzhin du bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang bde ba dang mi 'bral zhing nyon mongs pa med pa'i bsam pa rnams te /
translated: The four are love, compassion, joy and equanimity, which are the intentions to meet with happiness, to be free from suffering, to not be separated from happiness and to be free from attachment, respectively.
