original: skye ma sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / bde ba dang mi bral na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / nyon mongs pa las grol na ci ma rung snyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa ni tshad med pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: skye ma sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / bde ba dang mi bral na ci ma rung snyam pa dang / nyon mongs pa las grol na ci ma rung snyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa ni tshad med pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: How good it would be if they were liberated from the afflictions!

original: bzhi char yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: bzhi char yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
translated: All four are on the stage of action in faith.

original: sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are focused on sentient beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i bdun pa rnams la ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i bdun pa rnams la ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: On the seven stages beginning with the Joyous, they are focused on suchness.

original: de'i gong du ni dmigs pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: de'i gong du ni dmigs pa med pa rnams te /
translated: Above that, they are focused on the absence of an objective referent.

original: stong pa nyid nyi shu po rnams dang chos rnams thams la dmigs pa med pa'i sbyor bas bsgom pa ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyi shu po rnams dang chos rnams thams la dmigs pa med pa'i sbyor bas bsgom pa ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entrance of the application of nonapprehending is the cultivation by means of the application of nonapprehending to the twenty kinds of emptiness and to all phenomena.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa dang gtong pa po dang len pa po mi dmigs zhes pa nas ji srid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sbyin pa dang gtong pa po dang len pa po mi dmigs zhes pa nas ji srid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Practicing the perfection of generosity, one does not observe generosity, the giver, or the recipient.

original: de byang chub smes dpa'o yid la byed par yang mi dmigs zhes pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa'o //üîΩsgom pa po dang bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgom pa rnams gang du yang yod pa ma yin zhes pa bsgom pa dmigs su med pas bsgom pa dang bral bar bsgom pa'i don dmigs pa med pas sbyor bas de ched du byed pas dge pas dge pa'i chos rnams thams cad la bsgom pa de ni ched
analyzed: de byang chub smes dpa'o yid la byed par yang mi dmigs zhes pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i 'jug pa'o // sgom pa po dang bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgom pa rnams gang du yang yod pa ma yin zhes pa bsgom pa dmigs su med pas bsgom pa dang bral bar bsgom pa'i don dmigs pa med pas sbyor bas de ched du byed pas dge pas dge pa'i chos rnams thams cad la bsgom pa de ni ched
translated: Up to practicing the perfection of wisdom, one does not observe the bodhisattva and the attention to enlightenment. This is the engagement of the three spheres being pure.

original: du byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: du byed pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditator, the object of meditation, and the meditation do not exist anywhere. Since the meditation is unobservable, one meditates free from meditation. The meaning of meditating without observation is to engage in the practice of nonobservation. Since one intentionally does that, one meditates on all virtuous phenomena. This is the engagement of intentional action.

original: seng ge bzang pos ni /
analyzed: seng ge bzang pos ni /
translated: Haribhadra says:

original: sems can kun mchog nyid sems la sogs pa can ched du byed pa'o zhes zer ba ni 'phags pas bris pa'i yum bar ma'i tshig ma mthong ngo zhes shes so //
analyzed: sems can kun mchog nyid sems la sogs pa can ched du byed pa'o zhes zer ba ni 'phags pas bris pa'i yum bar ma'i tshig ma mthong ngo zhes shes so //
translated: The one who is intent on the thought of the supremacy of all beings, etc.

original: mngon par shes pa drug po rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug po rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro la /
translated: By means of the six superknowledges, one goes to the buddha-fields;

original: der yang sang rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / de rnams @55b la theg pa chen po nyan pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: der yang sang rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / de rnams @55b la theg pa chen po nyan pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gis 'jug pa'o //
translated: and there, one worships the Buddhas, hears the Mahayana from them, brings beings to maturity, and refines one's own buddha-field. This is the engagement by means of the six superknowledges.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, one turns the wheel of the Dharma, etc. This is the engagement by means of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'jug pa 'di rnams kyis 'gro bar rtsom pa ni mos pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'di rnams kyis 'gro bar rtsom pa ni mos pas so //
translated: One begins to go by means of these engagements by means of resolve.

original: 'gro ba'i rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas sa bdun po rnams la ni 'bad rtsol gyis so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas sa bdun po rnams la ni 'bad rtsol gyis so //
translated: On the seven stages, such as the Joyous, they are by means of exertion.

original: theg par zhugs nas bgrod pa la mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams la ni 'bad pa med pas so //
analyzed: theg par zhugs nas bgrod pa la mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams la ni 'bad pa med pas so //
translated: Having entered the vehicle, on the stages such as the Immovable, they are by means of non-exertion.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the accomplishment of the collections, the treatise declares:üîΩThe six such as love and giving,üîΩthe path of union with serenity and insight,üîΩthe path of skill in means,üîΩand the path of knowledge and merit,

original: brtse dang sbyin pa la sogs drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel pa'i lam gnag dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu ni //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin pa la sogs drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel pa'i lam gnag dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu ni //
translated: the ten powers, the ten powers of the Dharma,

original: gnyen po tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //üîΩrim pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: gnyen po tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi // rim pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: the ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,

original: zhes te / tshogs rnams kyi mthar ji ltar srid par sgyu ma'i chos nyid du so sor blta ste /
analyzed: zhes te / tshogs rnams kyi mthar ji ltar srid par sgyu ma'i chos nyid du so sor blta ste /
translated: the ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma,üîΩthe ten powers of fearlessness,üîΩthe ten powers of the Buddha,üîΩand the ten powers of the bodhisattva,üîΩthe ten powers of the Dharma

original: de la dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gror gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing sang rgyas dang bcas pa'i zhing rnams su lha dang mi rnams su bskyed pa ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de la dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gror gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed cing sang rgyas dang bcas pa'i zhing rnams su lha dang mi rnams su bskyed pa ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of compassion is the pacification of all the sufferings of those who are in the hells, as hungry ghosts, and as animals, and the production of gods and humans in the buddha-fields.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs drug ste /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gsum po ni go cha'i sgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin la gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la legs par spyod
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs drug ste / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gsum po ni go cha'i sgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin la gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la legs par spyod
translated: The six accumulations are those of generosity and so on.üîΩThe three accumulations of the six perfections, of serenity and insight, and of their union, are the practice of the armor, as it is called, in that one practices the perfections well with attention endowed with the knowledge of all things, and in that one induces others to take them up.

original: pa dang / gzhan rnams la yang yang dag par len du gzhug pa ste /üîΩdmigs su med pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: pa dang / gzhan rnams la yang yang dag par len du gzhug pa ste / dmigs su med pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: The accumulation of skill in means is the practice of the perfections with attention endowed with the knowledge of all things, and the practice of the perfections with attention not endowed with that knowledge.

original: zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of the knowledge of the path is the practice of the perfections with attention endowed with the knowledge of the path.

original: gang zhig stong pa nyid nyi shu yongs su shes pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: gang zhig stong pa nyid nyi shu yongs su shes pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is the thorough knowledge of the twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Great Mother, the Transcendent Conqueror‚Äôs Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines:

original: de la nang stong pa nyid ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams te mig la sogs pa'i drug po rnams te /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams te mig la sogs pa'i drug po rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúInner emptiness‚Äù refers to the six inner entities, the eyes and so forth.

original: de de rnams kyis stong pa'o //üîΩphyi stong @56a * //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis stong pa'o // phyi stong @56a * //
translated: These are empty of themselves.

original: pa nyid ces pa ni phyi'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: pa nyid ces pa ni phyi'i chos rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúOuter emptiness‚Äù refers to the six outer entities,

original: gzugs la sogs pa drug po la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa drug po la /
translated: forms and so forth.

original: de de rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: These are empty of themselves.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ces pa ni phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gang zhig dbang po la gnas pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ces pa ni phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gang zhig dbang po la gnas pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúInner and outer emptiness‚Äù refers to the inner and outer entities, which are subsumed within the sense sources.

original: de yang nang gi bdag nyid can gyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi dbang pos kyang ma bsdus pa'i phyir na de des stong la /
analyzed: de yang nang gi bdag nyid can gyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi dbang pos kyang ma bsdus pa'i phyir na de des stong la /
translated: These are empty of themselves, because they are not appropriated by the inner entities and are not subsumed by the outer sense sources.

original: stong pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pa yang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pa yang stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pas stong zhes pa'i don to //

original: chen po stong pa nyid ces pa ni phyogs phyogs kyis stong la /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ces pa ni phyogs phyogs kyis stong la /

original: snod rnams kyang snod rnams kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: snod rnams kyang snod rnams kyis stong pa'o //

analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid ces pa ni don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Emptiness of the ultimate is that the ultimate is nirvana.

original: de des na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de des na stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces pa ni /

analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan nyid med pa'i gzugs //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas pa ste /

analyzed: chos de @56b rnams thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dmigs su med do zhes pa ni de'i mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dmigs su med do zhes pa ni de'i mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is as follows. The past, future, and present are not apprehended. This is the emptiness of their non-apprehension.

original: gdod nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang dus med pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni brtags pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang dus med pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni brtags pa tsam gyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar yang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la yang dag par sbyor ba po gang yang med do //
