translated: Similarly, he arouses enthusiasm for the external body, and so on, and for the internal and external body, and so on. He dwells with mindfulness established and clearly aware, dispelling worldly longing and dejection.

original: de la nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug po rnams so //üîΩphyi'i lus ni nang gi lus las phyi rol gyi 'dus byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug po rnams so // phyi'i lus ni nang gi lus las phyi rol gyi 'dus byas pa rnams so //
translated: Therein, the internal body is the six internal sense spheres, beginning with the eye.üîΩThe external body is the six external sense spheres, beginning with form.

original: phyi nang gi lus ni rang gi lus su son pa'i lhag ma'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus ni rang gi lus su son pa'i lhag ma'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: The internal and external body is the remainder of the elements and the derivative of the elements that are included in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: de yang dbang po ni rang gi bdag nyid can gyi sems kyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dbang po ni rang gi bdag nyid can gyi sems kyis ma zin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the faculties are not grasped by a mind that has itself as its object, nor are they external.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: As for feeling and so on, there are three kinds:

original: lus la dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum phye bas te /
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum phye bas te /
translated: the threefold division is made on the basis of the body.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa'o //
translated: They are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: chos ni sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: chos ni sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: The dharmas are mental factors.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: They are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: lus la sogs par rjes su lta zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid du rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs par rjes su lta zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid du rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Observing the body, and so on‚Äù means observing the reality of the body, and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang lhan cig tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i 'du shes dang lhan cig tu gyur pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Accompanied by the body, and so on‚Äù means accompanied by the perception of the body, and so on.

original: rnam par ma brtags zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pas te /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pas te /
translated: ‚Äú Without conceptualization‚Äù means without conceptual thought.

original: lus 'di ni bdag gi lus te /
analyzed: lus 'di ni bdag gi lus te /
translated: ‚Äú This body is my body.

original: mi rtag pa dang rtag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang rtag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: impermanent, permanent, and so on.

original: de yang rjes su lta ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su lta ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis te /
translated: And that is by the yoga of non-apprehending non-conceptuality.

original: rgyun du bsnyen bkur byas pa la yang de de'i sbyor bas spro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du bsnyen bkur byas pa la yang de de'i sbyor bas spro ba med pa'o //
translated: And even when he is served continuously, he is not elated by that service.

original: rjes su lta ba ni de shes bzhin gyi rnal 'byor gyis rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su lta ba ni de shes bzhin gyi rnal 'byor gyis rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.

original: brjed pa med pa'i bdag nyid can dang / bsrung ba med pa can gyi rnam par g-yeng ba med pas 'jug cing dran pa la mi sbyor bas dran pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: brjed pa med pa'i bdag nyid can dang / bsrung ba med pa can gyi rnam par g-yeng ba med pas 'jug cing dran pa la mi sbyor bas dran pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni brtson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa rnams kyi phan yon gsungs pa'o //üîΩsel la zhes pa ni spangs pa la'o //üîΩ'jig rten zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni brtson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa rnams kyi phan yon gsungs pa'o // sel la zhes pa ni spangs pa la'o // 'jig rten zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams te /
translated: He is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.

original: rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bde ba dang bstod pa rnams la brnab @57b sems te 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang grags pa dang bde ba dang bstod pa rnams la brnab @57b sems te 'dod pa'o //
translated: He is mindful by the yoga of introspection, which is the knowledge of that.üîΩHe is mindful by the yoga of

original: ma rnyed pa dang ma grags pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang smod pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang ma grags pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang smod pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Displeasure is with regard to those who have not obtained, who are not famous, who are suffering, and who are despised.

original: yang dag par 'di sems la gtsor byed ces pas yang dag pa 'am gtso bo la bcom pa nyid kyis yang dag par spong ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'di sems la gtsor byed ces pas yang dag pa 'am gtso bo la bcom pa nyid kyis yang dag par spong ba'o //
translated: They are right efforts because they are the most important mental activities in the process of purification.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are fourfold:

original: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed /
translated: One generates will power in order to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen.

original: 'bad pas don du gnyer zhing brtson 'grus rtsom /
analyzed: 'bad pas don du gnyer zhing brtson 'grus rtsom /
translated: One makes an effort, strives, generates a courageous mind, and exerts oneself.üîΩOne has right mindfulness, right attentiveness.

original: sems kyis yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa'i yang dag par rab tu 'jog go //üîΩde bzhin du skyes pa rnams spangs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa'i yang dag par rab tu 'jog go // de bzhin du skyes pa rnams spangs pa la yang ngo //
translated: One has right concentration, right samadhi.üîΩOne generates will power in order to abandon evil, unwholesome states that have already arisen.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa la yang ngo //
translated: One generates will power in order to produce wholesome states that have not yet arisen.üîΩOne generates will power in order to maintain wholesome states that have arisen.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis de bzhin du bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis de bzhin du bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, he generates enthusiasm for the abiding and transformation of those already arisen, with the armor-like effort, thinking, I will act in that way.

original: 'bad pas don du gnyer ba ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: 'bad pas don du gnyer ba ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: He strives with exertion, with the effort of application.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: He initiates effort, with the effort of non-abandonment.

original: sems kyis rab tu 'dzin pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: sems kyis rab tu 'dzin pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: He fully grasps and stabilizes the mind with the effort of skill in means.

original: de la rab tu 'dzin pa ni bying ba las sems stod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu 'dzin pa ni bying ba las sems stod par byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, full grasping is the uplifting of the mind from laxity.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni rgod pa las bkug nas mngon par sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni rgod pa las bkug nas mngon par sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Full stabilization is the drawing in of the mind from excitement and its full concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni /
translated: The bases of supernatural powers are the supernatural powers in the supramundane dharmas.

original: gnas kyi phyir na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi phyir na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are for the sake of stability.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: the concentration of will, the concentration of energy, the concentration of mind, and the concentration of investigation.

original: de ltar yang kha cig tu ni 'dun pa drag po de nyid kyis legs par rab tu sbyor ba las sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang kha cig tu ni 'dun pa drag po de nyid kyis legs par rab tu sbyor ba las sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In some cases, the concentration of will itself, through its intense application, produces the concentration characterized by one-pointedness of mind.

original: kha cig tu ni yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba skyed pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rnams kyis mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba skyed pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: In some cases, through the energy of the correct exertions, one applies oneself to the abandonment of nonvirtue and the production of virtue.

original: kha cig tu ni zhi gnas rab tu 'dzin pa'i btang snyoms dang / mtshan ma med pa rnams kyis sems yongs su sbyang ba dang / kha cig tu ni bdag gis mi dge ba phra mo la kun tu spyod dam /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhi gnas rab tu 'dzin pa'i btang snyoms dang / mtshan ma med pa rnams kyis sems yongs su sbyang ba dang / kha cig tu ni bdag gis mi dge ba phra mo la kun tu spyod dam /
translated: In some cases, through the equanimity of the control of tranquility and the signlessness of the foundations of mindfulness, one purifies the mind. In some cases, one examines oneself, thinking, ‚ÄúDo I or do I not practice subtle nonvirtue?‚Äù

original: ci min nam zhes bdag la yongs su spyod par byed ces yang dag par nye bar sems @58a * //
analyzed: ci min nam zhes bdag la yongs su spyod par byed ces yang dag par nye bar sems @58a * //
translated: One thus correctly reflects on oneself.

original: pa ste / 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: pa ste / 'di rnams ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: These are the concentrations of will, etc.üîΩWhen these have arisen, he applies the effort of the correct exertions to abandon the latent propensities of the entanglements, since they are far removed.

original: skyes pa 'di rnams la ring du gyur nas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyis bag la nyal rnams spong ba'i yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pas spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa 'di rnams la ring du gyur nas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyis bag la nyal rnams spong ba'i yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pas spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: He becomes endowed with the eight formative forces of abandonment, which are:

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms rnams te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms rnams te /
translated: will, effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, full awareness, volition and equanimity.

original: de la gang du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Herein, will is the desire for the generation of mundane and supramundane meditative concentration in whatever place.

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni nges par 'joms pa ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni nges par 'joms pa ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Effort is the definite conquest of all unwholesome dharmas.

original: gong ma'i rtogs pa'i chos yod pa nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan par nus pa nyid kyis yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i rtogs pa'i chos yod pa nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan par nus pa nyid kyis yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the confidence in the Dharma of realization of the higher stages, because of the existence of the qualities of the Buddha, etc.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can las shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can las shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is pliancy.üîΩThe Dharma of insight is right view.üîΩThe mental factor of volition is intention.üîΩThe mental factor of equanimity is the absence of defilement.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of abandoning will and determination, etc.

original: de la dran pa ni shes bzhin gyi phyogs la lhag mthong gi chos ni yang dag pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni shes bzhin gyi phyogs la lhag mthong gi chos ni yang dag pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of desire, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of investigation, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of mind, etc.

original: de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms te /
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of concentration, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of equanimity, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of abandoning will and determination, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of desire, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of investigation, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of mind, etc.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of concentration, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of equanimity, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of abandoning will and determination, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of desire, etc.

original: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / rnam par gtong bas yongs su bsgyur ba ste /üîΩde la dben pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / rnam par gtong bas yongs su bsgyur ba ste / de la dben pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of investigation, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of mind, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of concentration, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of equanimity, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of abandoning will and determination, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of desire, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of investigation, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of mind, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of concentration, etc.üîΩHe cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the requisite of equ

original: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal lo ;
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal lo ;
translated: Cessation is suffering.

original: / rnam par gtong ba ni lus kun tu gtong ba'o //üîΩde nyid yongs su bsgyur ba la dbang byed pas dbang po ste /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skyed par byed pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir na ste /
analyzed: / rnam par gtong ba ni lus kun tu gtong ba'o // de nyid yongs su bsgyur ba la dbang byed pas dbang po ste / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skyed par byed pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir na ste /
translated: Giving up is giving up the body.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang lnga'o//
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang lnga'o//
translated: The faculties are the five faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang rab tu ldan pas rtags mthong nas gong du khyad par skye ba la nges pa skyed pas ston pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis rtogs pa la yang kun tu yid ches pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang rab tu ldan pas rtags mthong nas gong du khyad par skye ba la nges pa skyed pas ston pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis rtogs pa la yang kun tu yid ches pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.üîΩThe faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.

original: de ni de'i dad pa'i dbang po'o dad pa bla lhag pas brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams @58b bla lhag nas dbang po sgom par byed pas de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de'i dad pa'i dbang po'o dad pa bla lhag pas brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams @58b bla lhag nas dbang po sgom par byed pas de ltar 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The faculties are called faculties because they control the transformation of the roots of virtue into the states of being of the higher realms and the transcendence of sorrow.

original: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par g-yeng bas thub par dka' ba'i phyir dang bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir stobs su bsgrags pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par g-yeng bas thub par dka' ba'i phyir dang bskyod par mi nus pa'i phyir stobs su bsgrags pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is difficult for demons, etc. to disturb it through distraction, and because it cannot be moved, it is called strength.

original: dad pa'i stobs nas ji srid du shes rab kyi stobs kyi bar ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs nas ji srid du shes rab kyi stobs kyi bar ro //
translated: It is the strength of faith, etc., up to the strength of wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rtogs pas byang chub ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi don rtogs pas byang chub ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Enlightenment is perfect enlightenment, because the meaning of reality is realized on the path of insight.

original: de'i yan lag ni bdun te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni bdun te /
translated: Its members are seven:

original: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir yan lag ste /
translated: They are members because they cause perfect enlightenment.

original: dran pa dang / chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: dran pa dang / chos rab tu 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: They are mindfulness, the analysis of phenomena, effort, delight, fitness, samƒÅdhi, and equanimity.

original: de'i rjes la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad sgom par byed de /
translated: After that, one cultivates the noble path with eight members.

original: yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The eight members are right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis yongs su bcad pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Among them, the path of seeing is defined by right view.

original: pha rol yang dag par thob pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol yang dag par thob pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the attainment of the other shore.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni yang dag par kun nas lta ba'i ngag gang de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni yang dag par kun nas lta ba'i ngag gang de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Right speech is the attainment of the speech of right view.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' 'tsho ba rnams ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gsum po rnams yang dag par bsgoms pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa'i shes rab dang / bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' 'tsho ba rnams ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gsum po rnams yang dag par bsgoms pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges pa'i shes rab dang / bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: Right action, right livelihood, and right effort arise from the cultivation of the three, respectively.

original: tshod rig pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba sbyang sdom ste /
analyzed: tshod rig pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba sbyang sdom ste /
translated: The knowledge of the right amount is the training in the vow to seek the Dharma robes and so on.

original: de rnams kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams phyogs gcig tu bshad zin to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams phyogs gcig tu bshad zin to //
translated: With these, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, beginning with the applications of mindfulness, have been explained in one place.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni byang chub la de'i phyogs te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni byang chub la de'i phyogs te /
translated: The knowledge of extinction and the knowledge of non-production are enlightenment and its factors.

original: rjes su mthun zhes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun zhes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs so //
translated: The concordant is the factors of enlightenment.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad don du gnyer ba'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ngo bo la so sor rtog pa'i don du stong pa dang snying rje @59a * //üîΩdbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du bsdus nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad don du gnyer ba'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ngo bo la so sor rtog pa'i don du stong pa dang snying rje @59a * //üîΩdbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi nang du bsdus nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas should cultivate the emptiness and compassion that are inseparable from the enlightenment mind, which is the essence of the non-apprehension of the object, in order to seek all dharmas in every way and to be the cause for producing the benefit of all beings.

original: 'di rnams kyis de ltar sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas zhes pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis de ltar sprul pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas zhes pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
translated: Since they are liberated from the obscurations of emanation, they are liberated by means of the eight liberations.üîΩThe first two liberations are antidotes to attachment to form.

original: de la dngos pos ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba gsum pos gang zhig rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa las bsngags pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por ni nang gi skra la sogs pa la dmigs nas snyoms par 'jug pa'i mnyam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: de la dngos pos ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba gsum pos gang zhig rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa las bsngags pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por ni nang gi skra la sogs pa la dmigs nas snyoms par 'jug pa'i mnyam par gzhag cing /
translated: The yogi who engages in conduct in the desire realm focuses on the internal, such as hair of the head and so on, and enters meditative equipoise.

original: de'i rjes la 'di ltar phyi rol rnams la rnam par bsngos pa can la sogs par dmigs par byed pas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'di ltar phyi rol rnams la rnam par bsngos pa can la sogs par dmigs par byed pas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, he focuses on the external, such as the color of the earth, and so on, as being like a blue lotus and so on.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i bsngags pa la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis po ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i bsngags pa la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis po ste /
translated: The second concentration is the antidote to attachment to the praise of the first concentration.

original: de brjod pa ni gzugs can gzugs la lta zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de brjod pa ni gzugs can gzugs la lta zhes pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúone with form sees form‚Äù refers to that.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa'i gzugs can gyi phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas gzugs mthong ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa'i gzugs can gyi phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas gzugs mthong ba ste /
translated: He sees external form, form of the external realm, that is, form of the nature of the internal sense bases, by means of the mind of emanation.

original: mos pas sprul pa'i sems kyis mthong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mos pas sprul pa'i sems kyis mthong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúhe sees form by means of the mind of emanation.‚Äù

original: kha cig tu nang gi bdag nyid can mi dmigs pa nyid kyis phyi rol la rnam par bsdos pa la sogs par dmigs nas dang po'am gnyis pa'i bsam gtan la snga ma bzhin du snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tu nang gi bdag nyid can mi dmigs pa nyid kyis phyi rol la rnam par bsdos pa la sogs par dmigs nas dang po'am gnyis pa'i bsam gtan la snga ma bzhin du snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: In some cases, he sees external form, such as a corpse in various stages of decay, by means of the nonapprehension of internal form, and he enters the first or second meditative absorption as before.

original: de brjod pa ni nang gi bdag nyid gzugs med pa'i 'du shes can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni nang gi bdag nyid gzugs med pa'i 'du shes can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second case, stated in the root text as ‚Äúhe sees external form with a mind that is not in the formless realms but has an internal perception of formlessness.‚Äù

original: de ltar mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas sems can rnams kyi rgyud la dga' bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas sems can rnams kyi rgyud la dga' bar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, by cultivating the perception of foulness, he causes the stream of beings to become filled with joy.

original: ci bdag la yid du 'ong ba can gyi gzugs gtsang bar yid la byed par bsngags pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci bdag la yid du 'ong ba can gyi gzugs gtsang bar yid la byed par bsngags pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Is it praiseworthy to attend to a pleasant form as pure?üîΩOr is it not?

original: 'on kyang min zhes nyams tshad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas gtsang ba'i gzugs sprul par byed pa rnams la ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas go rims bzhin du kun tu
analyzed: 'on kyang min zhes nyams tshad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la dmigs par byed pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pas gtsang ba'i gzugs sprul par byed pa rnams la ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas go rims bzhin du kun tu
translated: Because he is not certain, he enters the fourth meditation and emanates a pure form, having attained the perception of a single taste.

original: spyod pa dang mi mthun pas spong bar byed pa la sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ba @59b zhes brjod do //
analyzed: spyod pa dang mi mthun pas spong bar byed pa la sdug pa'o zhes mos par 'gyur ba @59b zhes brjod do //
translated: He then cultivates the perception of foulness in order to abandon attachment to the pleasant form.

original: de ltar na gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa gsum dang gzugs med pa'i lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa gsum dang gzugs med pa'i lnga ste /
translated: Thus, there are three liberations with form and five without form.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas ji srid du tshor ba dang 'du shes 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas ji srid du tshor ba dang 'du shes 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The liberation of the base of infinite space and so on up to the liberation of the cessation of sensation and the cessation of conceptualization.

original: de la gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four formless liberations.

original: dag pa can du de la ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa can du de la ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: The liberation of the sphere of endless space is the antidote to the obscuration of relishing the lower sphere.

original: zhi ba'i gnas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the abode of peace.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar ba dang 'dra ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni thar ba dang 'dra ba'i gnas te /
translated: The cessation of discernment and feeling is the abode similar to liberation.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la gnas shing shin tu 'das nas mtshan ma rnams thams cad yid la mi byed cing 'gog pa zhi bar yid la byed pas gang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la gnas shing shin tu 'das nas mtshan ma rnams thams cad yid la mi byed cing 'gog pa zhi bar yid la byed pas gang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog la /
translated: Abiding in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, having transcended the base of nothingness, and not bringing any signs to mind, one brings the cessation of discernment and feeling to mind as peace.

original: mchog tu zhi ba la gnas pa'i sngon gyi las ldang ba ste /
analyzed: mchog tu zhi ba la gnas pa'i sngon gyi las ldang ba ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors cease and one arises from the prior karma of abiding in supreme peace.

original: de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong bas rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong bas rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of the obscurations to that.

original: 'dir ji ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyun chad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyun chad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Here, how does the stream of mind not cease for those entering the meditative attainment of nondiscernment?

original: sngon du sems kyi rgyud la bsgos pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'ong zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon du sems kyi rgyud la bsgos pa'i las kyi 'bras bu 'ong zhing skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The result of karma previously infused in the mindstream comes and arises.

original: yang skye ba de nyid la de'i las sems kyi rgyud la bsgos pas mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang skye ba de nyid la de'i las sems kyi rgyud la bsgos pas mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in that very birth, the karma that is infused in the mindstream connects with the next birth.

original: de nyid gang gis mtshams sbyar bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid gang gis mtshams sbyar bar 'gyur na /
translated: By what is it connected?

original: gang du snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems yun ring du 'gags pas de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis zhes pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: gang du snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems yun ring du 'gags pas de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis zhes pa ni gcig go //
translated: One says: It is the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent of the mind that enters meditative attainment, since it is long obstructed.

original: slob dpon dbyig gi bshes gnyen gyis ni sems dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad la /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gi bshes gnyen gyis ni sems dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad la /
translated: Master Vasubandhu explains that it is the meditative attainment of cessation that possesses mind.

original: de la sems ji lta bu na yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: de la sems ji lta bu na yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes pa ni gcig go //
translated: One says: What kind of mind is it? It is the mental consciousness.üîΩThis is the assertion of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba ste /
translated: One says: It is the foundation consciousness.

original: de'i yang bsam par bya'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: de'i yang bsam par bya'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: This is the assertion of others.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par zhugs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam sdud pa'i don du 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /üîΩdes thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par zhugs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam sdud pa'i don du 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ste / des thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the state of composure without conception because it is attained by means of the nine meditative absorptions.

original: sems gnas pas dmigs pa zil gyis mnan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la /üîΩzil @60a * //
analyzed: sems gnas pas dmigs pa zil gyis mnan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la / zil @60a * //
translated: The bases of subjugation are so called because they subjugate the object by means of the stability of mind.

original: gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de ni gzhan du brgyad de /
analyzed: gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de ni gzhan du brgyad de /
translated: The bases of subjugation are eight in number.üîΩThe first two are subsumed in the first liberation.

original: de la dang por rnam par thar pas gnyis mngon par bsdus la gnyis bas kyang gnyis so //
analyzed: de la dang por rnam par thar pas gnyis mngon par bsdus la gnyis bas kyang gnyis so //
translated: The third is subsumed in the second liberation.

original: gsum pas ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gsum pas ni bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth is subsumed in the third liberation.üîΩThe fifth is subsumed in the fourth liberation.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has stated:

original: nang gzugs kyi 'du shes can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du mthong yang de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes so //
analyzed: nang gzugs kyi 'du shes can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs chung du mthong yang de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes so //
translated: One who has the conception of internal form sees external form as small.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong la de ltar 'du shes can du ma gyur zhes pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong la de ltar 'du shes can du ma gyur zhes pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is: ‚ÄúHaving overcome, one sees, but does not become one who perceives thus.

original: de bzhin du chen pos zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //üîΩnang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chen pos zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o // nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs mthong ste /
translated: ‚Äù The second is: ‚ÄúLikewise, with a great one.üîΩ‚Äù The third is: ‚ÄúOne with the perception of no inner form sees external forms.

original: chung du de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chung du de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Those small ones.

original: de bzhin du chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //üîΩnang gzugs med pa can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o // nang gzugs med pa can gyis phyi rol gyi gzugs mthong ste /
translated: ‚Äù The fourth is: ‚ÄúLikewise, with a great one.üîΩ‚Äù The fifth is: ‚ÄúOne with no inner form sees external forms.

original: sngon po de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Those blue ones.

original: de bzhin du ser po zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The sixth is: ‚ÄúLikewise, with a yellow one.

original: de bzhin du dmar po zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmar po zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The seventh is: ‚ÄúLikewise, with a red one.

original: de bzhin du dkar po zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The eighth is: ‚ÄúLikewise, with a white one.

original: de la gzugs chung ngu ni sems can du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs chung ngu ni sems can du bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù Among those, small forms are explained as sentient beings.

original: de ni tshad chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshad chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have a small size.

original: chen po la ni sems can gyi grangs dang / khyim dang khang bzangs dang ri la sogs pa ni tshad che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chen po la ni sems can gyi grangs dang / khyim dang khang bzangs dang ri la sogs pa ni tshad che ba'i phyir te /
translated: The great is so called because the number of sentient beings, and the measure of houses, mansions, mountains, and so on are great.

original: des ni ji ltar rigs par rnam par thar pa rnams kyis lhag par mos pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: des ni ji ltar rigs par rnam par thar pa rnams kyis lhag par mos pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis zil gyis mnan te /
translated: The bases of subjugation subjugate the bases of mastery by means of the liberations, as is appropriate,

original: yang nas yang du mi snang bar byas shing mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩzil gyis mnan nas shes zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: yang nas yang du mi snang bar byas shing mthong ba'i phyir ro // zil gyis mnan nas shes zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: because they repeatedly make them invisible and visible.

original: mthong ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúknowing through subjugation‚Äù refers to calm abiding and ‚Äúseeing‚Äù refers to insight.

original: de lta'i 'du shes can du gyur pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta'i 'du shes can du gyur pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who possess such discernment are free of manifest pride.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis mnan pa'i sa la sogs pa rnams kyi zad par ni 'khor yug rnams su spro bas gzhan du 'dir zad par zhes brjod la /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis mnan pa'i sa la sogs pa rnams kyi zad par ni 'khor yug rnams su spro bas gzhan du 'dir zad par zhes brjod la /
translated: The bases of subjugation subjugate the bases of totality such as earth and so on, because they expand to the periphery of the world systems.

original: kha cig tu de las gzhan pa'i skye mched la zhes pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces brjod de /
analyzed: kha cig tu de las gzhan pa'i skye mched la zhes pa ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces brjod de /
translated: In some places, ‚Äúthe other bases‚Äù means the bases of subjugation.

original: kha cig tu sa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas pa ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tu sa la sogs pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas pa ston par 'gyur te /
translated: In some places, it shows the distinctions made by earth and so on.

original: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / @60b zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / @60b zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: The bases of totality are the totality of earth, the totality of water, the totality of fire, the totality of wind, the totality of blue, the totality of yellow, the totality of red, the totality of white, the totality of the base of infinite space,

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang zhes pa ste /
translated: and the totality of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: 'di rnams kyang 'bras bu'i don du de kho na nyid ma yin pa nyid du bsgom zhing de yang de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'di ltar so sor snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang 'bras bu'i don du de kho na nyid ma yin pa nyid du bsgom zhing de yang de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams la 'di ltar so sor snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These are also cultivated for the sake of the result, but they are not reality. Moreover, they appear individually to yogins whose nature is not reality.

original: 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i lam rnams kyang ma lus par lam gyi tshogs ni ji ltar rigs par brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par bsdus pas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i lam rnams kyang ma lus par lam gyi tshogs ni ji ltar rigs par brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par bsdus pas so //
translated: The other paths, without exception, are included in the perfection of effort, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzungs zhes pa ni mtha' dag gzung bar bya ba na gzungs kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: gzungs zhes pa ni mtha' dag gzung bar bya ba na gzungs kyi tshogs te /
translated: The aggregate of retention is that by which all is retained.

original: aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams las de bzhin nyid bskyed nas sgom par byed pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams las de bzhin nyid bskyed nas sgom par byed pa'i don du ste /
translated: The retention of the letter is the retention of the letters ‚Äúa‚Äù and ‚Äúra-pa-tsa-na,‚Äù etc., in order to generate and cultivate reality.

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na de la yi ge'i don gyi bzod pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa na de la yi ge'i don gyi bzod pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When cultivation is complete, one attains the patience of the meaning of the letters.

original: de ni bzod pa'i gzungs so //
analyzed: de ni bzod pa'i gzungs so //
translated: This is the retention of patience.

original: blo gzungs dang ldan pa des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bstan pa'i phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni chos kyi gzungs te /
analyzed: blo gzungs dang ldan pa des phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bstan pa'i phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni chos kyi gzungs te /
translated: The retention of the mind is the retention of the Dharma, which is the cause of retaining the mass of teachings of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions.

original: dran pa dang shes rab kyis gcig tu byas nas des 'dzin pa ni don gyi gzungs so //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab kyis gcig tu byas nas des 'dzin pa ni don gyi gzungs so //
translated: The retention of the meaning is the retention of the meaning of the Dharma by means of the retention of the mind, after having made it one by means of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: dran pa dang shes rab kyis gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab kyis gcig tu byas nas /
translated: Having made them one through mindfulness and wisdom,üîΩhe taught the illusion-like mantras that take care of sentient beings.

original: des sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar byed pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sngags rnams gsungs pa la dbang byed pa ni sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: des sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar byed pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sngags rnams gsungs pa la dbang byed pa ni sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: The dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of mantras is the mastery of mantras.

original: man ni shes pa la treng ni skyong ba'o //
analyzed: man ni shes pa la treng ni skyong ba'o //
translated: Man means consciousness, and tra means to protect.

original: man ni yid la /
analyzed: man ni yid la /
translated: Man means mind,

original: tra ni skyob pa ste /
analyzed: tra ni skyob pa ste /
translated: and tra means to protect.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang snying rje dag dbyer med pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang snying rje dag dbyer med pa ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra is the inseparability of the wisdom of emptiness and compassion.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir yi ge la yang sngags zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir yi ge la yang sngags zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is concordant with that, the syllables are also called mantras.

original: de la aa ni gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rig pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: de la aa ni gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rig pa'i thabs te /
translated: Among them, a is the door of all dharmas because it is originally unborn. This is the method for discerning the perfect reality of all dharmas.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is originally unborn.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni gdod ma nas dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs nyid du yang ma skyes pa nyid de ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa 'di'i ma skyes pa nyid ni aa'i don la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni gdod ma nas dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs nyid du yang ma skyes pa nyid de ma skyes shing ngo bo nyid med pa 'di'i ma skyes pa nyid ni aa'i don la /
translated: The meaning of the nonproduction of this should be known in the meaning of a.

original: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa rnams kyi don du yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa rnams kyi don du yang rig par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the meaning of ra and so on should be known.

original: 'dir ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i @61a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i @61a * //
translated: Here, the ultimate dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of generosity and so on

original: gzungs mthar thug pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs mthar thug pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa ste /
translated: is the accomplishment of the accumulation.

original: chos mchog rab tu ngo bo nyid do //üîΩshes pa nyid gong nas gong du yon tan gyi grangs mthu cher thob par byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par gnas pa'i rnam par smin par bgyi dbye bas phye bar byas pa'i yon tan la rab tu gnas par
analyzed: chos mchog rab tu ngo bo nyid do // shes pa nyid gong nas gong du yon tan gyi grangs mthu cher thob par byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par gnas pa'i rnam par smin par bgyi dbye bas phye bar byas pa'i yon tan la rab tu gnas par
translated: The supreme dharma is the very essence.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir sa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it causes the number of qualities to be obtained in ever higher and higher states of knowledge, it is called a bh≈´mi because it causes one to abide in the qualities that are distinguished by the classification of the fruitions of abiding in the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ni sa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ni sa'i tshogs te /
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages such as the stage of joy are the accumulation of stages.

original: de la dang po la rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la dang po la rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: On the first stage, one becomes joyful because one has attained the supramundane path that accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' de ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' de ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas stage of joy.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral bas dri med pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang bral bas dri med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free of the stain of immorality.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas chos chen po'i snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas chos chen po'i snang ba byed pa'i phyir 'od byed pa'o //
translated: It is the shining stage because, abiding in meditative concentration, one shines with the light of the great Dharma.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsregs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba'o //
translated: It is the blazing stage because the factors of enlightenment burn away the kindling of the afflictions.

original: gang zhig 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi rig pa dang mi bden pa'i shes pa dag 'gal bas yongs su rgal bar dka' ba de'i phyir sbyang dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi rig pa dang mi bden pa'i shes pa dag 'gal bas yongs su rgal bar dka' ba de'i phyir sbyang dka' ba'o //
translated: It is the hardtoconquer stage because it is difficult to conquer, since mundane and supramundane knowledge and nonknowledge are mutually exclusive.

original: gang gis 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu rnam par phye bas mngon du phyogs par brjod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu rnam par phye bas mngon du phyogs par brjod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the stage of Direct Vision because it is the stage of the perfection of wisdom which is directed towards the clear comprehension of dependent origination through its analysis here.

original: gang du 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la 'bad pas brtsal bas de'i phyir ring du song ba'o //üîΩgang du 'dir de nyid rlung du gyur pa'i phyir g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: gang du 'dir byang chub kyi phyogs dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa la 'bad pas brtsal bas de'i phyir ring du song ba'o // gang du 'dir de nyid rlung du gyur pa'i phyir g-yo ba ste /
translated: It is the stage Gone Afar because it is the stage of the bodhisattva who is intent on the signless by taking dependent origination and the factors of enlightenment as his objective supports.

original: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba ste /üîΩrnam par smin pa'i sa'i chos rnams thams cad lhun gyis grub pas rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid can du byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang du 'dir so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis chos ston pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i legs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba ste / rnam par smin pa'i sa'i chos rnams thams cad lhun gyis grub pas rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid can du byung ba'i phyir ro // gang du 'dir so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis chos ston pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i legs pa ste /
translated: It is the stage of Immovability because it is the stage of the bodhisattva who is unmoved by the signs of the two, by the signs of the subject and object, due to the absence of the appearance of the signs of subject and object.üîΩIt is the stage of Excellent Intelligence because it is the stage of the bodhisattva who has excellent intelligence in regard to the knowledge of the presentation of the vehicles.

original: de'i phyir na legs pa'i blo gros so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na legs pa'i blo gros so //
translated: It is the stage Cloud of Dharma because it is the stage of the bodhisattva who is covered by the cloud of the Dharma which is the concentration of the Dharma rain.

original: gang du 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab tu mngon par dbang bskur par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab tu mngon par dbang bskur par 'gyur te /
translated: Where is the Bodhisattva consecrated as regent?

original: de'i phyir na chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na chos kyi sprin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the Cloud of Dharma.

original: bcu po 'di rnams kyis so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams yang dag par bsus pa'i go rims ji lta ba @61b bzhin gyi sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: bcu po 'di rnams kyis so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams yang dag par bsus pa'i go rims ji lta ba @61b bzhin gyi sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang /
translated: By these ten, the six perfections are fully included, in the order of generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes rnams ni pha rol tu phyin par brjod de /
analyzed: thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes rnams ni pha rol tu phyin par brjod de /
translated: Skillful means, strength, aspiration, and gnosis are called perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nye bar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsal bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nye bar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsal bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the perfection of skillful means is the dedication of the roots of virtue collected by the six perfections to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i thabs kyis de mi zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thabs kyis de mi zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by that skillful means, they make it inexhaustible.

original: bzang por spyod pa la sogs pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang por spyod pa la sogs pa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of prayer is the prayer for good conduct, etc.

original: gang gis skye ba so so la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing bsgom pa'i stobs dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis skye ba so so la pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing bsgom pa'i stobs dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is the power of practice and the power of analysis, by which one practices and cultivates the six perfections in each lifetime.

original: gang gis nyi ma re re dang so so skad cig re re la de rnams la spyod cing dgongs pa ji lta ba'i sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i theg pa chen po yongs su shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste rnam par mi
analyzed: gang gis nyi ma re re dang so so skad cig re re la de rnams la spyod cing dgongs pa ji lta ba'i sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa'i theg pa chen po yongs su shes pa ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste rnam par mi
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the universal vehicle, which is not literal, and which one practices and cultivates in each day and in each moment, in accordance with the intention of the universal vehicle.üîΩThe perfection of knowledge is nonconceptual.

original: rtog pa'o // seng ge bzang pos ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ces zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rtog pa'o // seng ge bzang pos ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ces zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: BhadrapƒÅla says that the perfection of knowledge is the knowledge subsequent to nonconceptual knowledge, and that it is conceptual in character. That is not correct.

original: snga nas rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pas 'dir rtogs pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs su dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni srid pa'i dogs pa yang med de /
analyzed: snga nas rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pas 'dir rtogs pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs su dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni srid pa'i dogs pa yang med de /
translated: Since all thoughts have been abandoned from the beginning, here in the context of the ultimate perfection of realization, there is not even the possibility of any pure mundane thought.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa byams pas theg pa chen po'i rgyud bla mar gsungs la /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa byams pas theg pa chen po'i rgyud bla mar gsungs la /
translated: This is stated by the noble Maitreya in the Sublime Continuum:

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gyur las //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang gyur las //
translated: Due to the power of previous impulsion,

original: rnam rtog thams cad dang bral bas //
analyzed: rnam rtog thams cad dang bral bas //
translated: free from all thoughts,

original: yang ni 'bad pa mi mdzad de //
analyzed: yang ni 'bad pa mi mdzad de //
translated: they do not make any effort

original: lus can rnams ni yongs smin phyir //
analyzed: lus can rnams ni yongs smin phyir //
translated: in order to ripen beings.

original: lhun gyis grub pas de nyid kyi //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas de nyid kyi //
translated: By means of spontaneous accomplishment,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ni //üîΩ'grol nam mkha' gnas kyi bar //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ni // 'grol nam mkha' gnas kyi bar //
translated: they are always and uninterruptedlyüîΩengaged in the firm stability

original: brtan pa la ni yang dag 'jug / rtog pa 'di rnams rjes thob pa'i //
analyzed: brtan pa la ni yang dag 'jug / rtog pa 'di rnams rjes thob pa'i //
translated: of these thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bde gshegs rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bde gshegs rnams //
translated: The bodhisattvas, the sugatas,

original: sems can yang dag sgrol ba la //
analyzed: sems can yang dag sgrol ba la //
translated: in order to liberate beings,

original: 'jig rten na ni mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni mnyam pa nyid //
translated: are equal in the worldüîΩin terms of their activities.

original: ces so / sa rnams kyi rgyas pa ni thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan las so //
analyzed: ces so / sa rnams kyi rgyas pa ni thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan las so //
translated: The extensive explanation of the stages is in the Ornament of the Sage‚Äôs Thought.

original: yongs su spyod pa 'di rnams ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las bstan pa dang bcas pas so //üîΩde'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi @62a * //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa 'di rnams ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las bstan pa dang bcas pas so // de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi @62a * //
translated: These enjoyments are taught in the Great Mother Scripture, the Transcendent Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines.

original: shu rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: shu rtsa gsum ste /
translated: In terms of that, there are twenty-three verses of the treatise.

original: de rnams sa ji lta bas so sor byas nas bshad par bya ste /üîΩyongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: de rnams sa ji lta bas so sor byas nas bshad par bya ste / yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
translated: Having made them into individual stages, they should be explained.

original: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te //
translated: The first stage is attained by ten thorough preparations.üîΩThe nature of thought and benefit,

original: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
analyzed: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
translated: equality of thought toward sentient beings,üîΩgiving, reliance on spiritual benefactors,üîΩseeking the object of the true teaching,üîΩalways the thought of renunciation,üîΩdelight in praising the Buddha‚Äôs body,

original: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur bstod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
analyzed: gtong dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur bstod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
translated: teaching the Dharma, and the truth

original: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //üîΩ'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //üîΩ'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //
translated: are asserted to be the ten words.üîΩThese are the ten thorough preparations.

original: yongs su sbyong bar shis par bya //üîΩzhes te bsam pa ni dad pa dang 'dun pa'o //üîΩphan pa'i dngos po ni sems can thams cad kyi phan pa tshil ba nyid do //üîΩ'di rnams kyi rgyu ni sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid do //üîΩgtong pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong bar shis par bya // zhes te bsam pa ni dad pa dang 'dun pa'o // phan pa'i dngos po ni sems can thams cad kyi phan pa tshil ba nyid do // 'di rnams kyi rgyu ni sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid do // gtong pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: 10.1üîΩThe intention is faith and aspiration.üîΩThe benefit is the welfare and happiness of all beings.üîΩThe cause of these is the equality of mind toward all beings.üîΩThe giving is the perfection of generosity.üîΩ

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa po rnams la bsten bkur dang chos tshol ba dang / khyim gyi gnas nas nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /üîΩnges par 'byung ba de nyid 'dod pas de 'dod pa nyid de rtag tu 'dod pa'o //üîΩdam pa'i chos 'chad pa dang / bden pa'i tshig dang / bsam pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i sa la'o //üîΩtshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //üîΩrab tu dga' dang snying po rtse che //üîΩbla ma bkur sti gus pas nyon //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa po rnams la bsten bkur dang chos tshol ba dang / khyim gyi gnas nas nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /üîΩnges par 'byung ba de nyid 'dod pas de 'dod pa nyid de rtag tu 'dod pa'o //üîΩdam pa'i chos 'chad pa dang / bden pa'i tshig dang / bsam pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i sa la'o //üîΩtshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //üîΩrab tu dga' dang snying po rtse che //üîΩbla ma bkur sti gus pas nyon //

original: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs pa brtson //
analyzed: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs pa brtson //
translated: 8. In generosity and so on, he is diligent.üîΩIn morality, he is pure. In gratitude, he remembers even the slightest benefit. In patience, he is without malice toward any living being.üîΩIn effort, he is joyful.üîΩIn meditation, he is without distraction. In wisdom, he is without discrimination.üîΩIn generosity and so on, he is diligent.

original: zhes te / tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / bla ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mdzad pa'i phan pa chung ngu la yang cher dran pa dang / bzod pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / bla ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mdzad pa'i phan pa chung ngu la yang cher dran pa dang / bzod pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: In morality, he is pure. In gratitude, he remembers even the slightest benefit. In patience, he is without malice toward any living being.

original: mgu pa nyid ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mgu pa nyid ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: In effort, he is joyful.üîΩIn meditation, he is without distraction. In wisdom, he is without discrimination.üîΩIn generosity and so on, he is diligent.

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun spyod pa dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // @62b ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //

original: rlom med bdag nyid de rnams lnga //
analyzed: rlom med bdag nyid de rnams lnga //
translated: These five are the nature of non-conceit.

original: zhes te / thos pa mang ba dang / zang zing ni longs spyod kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: zhes te / thos pa mang ba dang / zang zing ni longs spyod kyi dngos po ste /

original: 'dir zang zing ni zang zing 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zang zing ni zang zing 'dod pa'o //

original: de'i sbyin pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa la /
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa la /
