original: yongs su spyod pa ni dag pa des de bzhin du bsod nams yongs su bsngo bas so //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa ni dag pa des de bzhin du bsod nams yongs su bsngo bas so //
translated: The enjoyment is the dedication of merit in that way with that purity.

original: yongs su mi skyo ba ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo ba ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-discouragement is for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byed pas ngo tsha ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yid la byed pas ngo tsha ba ste /
translated: The shame is by means of the attention of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rang la ltos nas so //
translated: That is in relation to oneself.

original: khrel yod pa ni gzhan la ltos nas te /
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni gzhan la ltos nas te /
translated: The embarrassment is in relation to others.

original: ngo tsha khrel yod do //
analyzed: ngo tsha khrel yod do //
translated: Those are shame and embarrassment.

original: rlom pa med pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: rlom pa med pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The nature of non-conceit is the nature of non-conceit.

original: des na rlom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na rlom pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is non-conceit.

original: rnam lnga zhes pa ni yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam lnga zhes pa ni yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: The five are the enjoyments.

original: 'od 'phro ba la ni /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba la ni /
translated: As for the radiant,

original: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yon tan sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
analyzed: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang // sbyangs pa yon tan sdom bsten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
translated: nirvana, giving up all possessions,

original: mi zhum pa dang ltos pa med //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang ltos pa med //
translated: not being discouraged, and not being dependent.

original: ces te / dgon par gnas par 'dod pa nyid dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang sdom pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: ces te / dgon par gnas par 'dod pa nyid dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang sdom pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: These are: the desire to dwell in the forest, having few desires, being content, not abandoning the virtues of the ascetic and the vows.

original: de yang zab mo'i chos kyi bzod pa mi gtong zhes pa gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: de yang zab mo'i chos kyi bzod pa mi gtong zhes pa gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: Others say that it is not abandoning the acceptance of the profound Dharma.üîΩBeing free from immorality, etc., not abandoning what has been undertaken, condemning desire, nirvana,

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / bzung ba rnams mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang/ mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / bzung ba rnams mi gtong ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang/ mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: and giving up all possessions.

original: chos rnams thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa nyid ni dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i sems kun tu mi zhum pa nyid dang / dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa nyid ni dge ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i sems kun tu mi zhum pa nyid dang / dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is not to engage in any phenomena, to give away all one‚Äôs possessions, and to have an undaunted mind.

original: sbyang dka' ba la ni /
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba la ni /
translated: The fifth ground, Difficult to Master, is explained in the following:

original: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
analyzed: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
translated: Familiarity, attachment to home, and living in a busy place,üîΩthinking ‚ÄúI am empty‚Äù while disparaging others, the ten nonvirtuous actions,

original: bdag stong gzhan la smod pa dang // mi dge las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / yid gnyis dang ni nyon mongs pa zong //
analyzed: bdag stong gzhan la smod pa dang // mi dge las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / yid gnyis dang ni nyon mongs pa zong //
translated: conceit due to pride, error, doubt, and the afflictions of miserliness,

original: bcu po 'di dag rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag rnam spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned these ten,

original: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob //üîΩces te / 'dris pa ni khyim pa la rab tu byung ba rnams kyis te /
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob // ces te / 'dris pa ni khyim pa la rab tu byung ba rnams kyis te /
translated: one attains the fifth ground.üîΩFamiliarity is for monastics with householders.

original: khyim rnams su nye bar 'gro ba @63a * //
analyzed: khyim rnams su nye bar 'gro ba @63a * //
translated: It is to go near to households.

original: pa'o // 'du 'dzir gyur ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa'i gtam rnams kyis dang bstod pa dang / brnyas pa dang / smad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'du 'dzir gyur ba ni tshul dang mi mthun pa'i gtam rnams kyis dang bstod pa dang / brnyas pa dang / smad par byed pa'o //
translated: The distraction is the distraction of the talk that is not in conformity with the Dharma, the distraction of praise, the distraction of contempt, the distraction of disparagement.

original: las kyi lam rnams dang / rlom pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi lam rnams dang / rlom pa ste /
translated: The distraction of action is the distraction of the path of action.üîΩThe distraction of pride is the distraction of the mind that is too high, the distraction of the mind that is too low.

original: sems gzengs mtho ba dang / khengs pa ni bla ma rnams la lus kyis mi 'dud pa nyid dang / phyin ci log ni don phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa dang / yid gnyis te /
analyzed: sems gzengs mtho ba dang / khengs pa ni bla ma rnams la lus kyis mi 'dud pa nyid dang / phyin ci log ni don phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa dang / yid gnyis te /
translated: The distraction of doubt is the distraction of the mind that is divided.üîΩThe distraction of passion is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the objects of desire.üîΩThe distraction of anger is the distraction of the mind that is attached to resentment.

original: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: The distraction of ignorance is the distraction of the mind that is attached to confusion.üîΩThe distraction of the sign is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the signs of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the object is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the objects of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the cause is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the cause of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the result is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the result of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the self is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the self.

original: mngon du gyur ba la ni /
analyzed: mngon du gyur ba la ni /
translated: The distraction of the view is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the view.üîΩThe distraction of the basis is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the basis of concentration.

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: The distraction of the root is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the root of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the branches is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the branches of concentration.

original: bsam gtan shes rab rab rdzogs pas //üîΩslob ma dang ni bse ru la //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab rab rdzogs pas // slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
translated: The distraction of the summit is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the summit of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the peak is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the peak of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the special is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the special of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the limit is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the limit of concentration.

original: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs la //üîΩblangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
analyzed: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs la // blangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
translated: The distraction of the extreme is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the extreme of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the eternal is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the eternal of concentration.

original: gtong yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas //
analyzed: gtong yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas //
translated: The distraction of the annihilation is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the annihilation of concentration.üîΩThe distraction of the self is the distraction of the mind that is attached to the self of concentration.

original: sa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
analyzed: sa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
translated: The distraction of the sentient being is the distraction of the

original: skrag pa ni yongs su zhum pa'o //
analyzed: skrag pa ni yongs su zhum pa'o //
translated: Fear is complete discouragement.

original: ring du song ba la ni /
analyzed: ring du song ba la ni /
translated: In Gone Far Beyond,üîΩthe bodhisattva thoroughly investigates the twenty faults that are the opposites of the twenty terms beginning with the ten that are mentioned in the sutra:üîΩthe self and sentient beings,üîΩlife, person, annihilation and permanence,üîΩsigns, causes, aggregates,

analyzed: bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtag dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag dang ni //

analyzed: khams gsum pa la gnas chags dang // sems ni kun tu zhum pa dang // dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims dang // de lta ba la mngon zhe na dang // stong ba nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni //
translated: and the faults that are contrary to those.üîΩThe bodhisattva who has eliminated

translated: attains the seventh bhumi.üîΩKnowing the three doors of liberation,üîΩthe three spheres being pure,üîΩcompassion, absence of conceit,

analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rje dang ni rlom med dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes //

analyzed: mi skye ba dang bzod shes dang // chos rnams rnam pa gcig tu ston //
translated: 1. Non-arising, acquiescence in knowledge, and teaching the Dharma in one way,

analyzed: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lha dang nyon mongs spong //
translated: 2. destroying all conceptualization, and abandoning the gods of perception and afflictions,üîΩ3. meditative serenity, and skill in insight,

original: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la //
analyzed: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la //

analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gar 'dod par //
translated: 5. not being a stage of attachment, and going wherever one wishes,üîΩ6. going to other fields, and manifesting one‚Äôs own body

analyzed: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //

analyzed: zhes te / yon tan rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i zhes pa ni lhag ma'o // @63b bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: statement.

original: nyes pa ni skyon no //
analyzed: nyes pa ni skyon no //
translated: The faults are the errors.

original: 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: Clinging is strong attachment.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa nas ji srid du skye mched du 'dzin pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa nas ji srid du skye mched du 'dzin pa'i bar ro //
translated: It is the clinging to a self, and so on, up to the clinging to the sense bases.

original: khams gsum pa la rab tu gnas pa ni dmigs pa la kun tu gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la rab tu gnas pa ni dmigs pa la kun tu gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are well established in the three realms are those who are well established in their objects.

original: der lta ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: der lta ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la sogs par lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the view of the Buddha Jewel, etc.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa nyid ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa nyid ni nges pa'o //
translated: The adherence is the conviction.

original: sangs rgyas su lta ba la gnas pa nas ji srid du tshul khrims su lta ba'i bar la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su lta ba la gnas pa nas ji srid du tshul khrims su lta ba'i bar la gnas pa'o //
translated: The abiding is abiding in the view of the Buddha, etc., up to abiding in the view of morality.

original: stong pa nyid chos zhes rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid chos zhes rtsod pa ste /
translated: The dispute is the dispute about the Dharma of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la 'gal ba'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la 'gal ba'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The contradiction is the contradiction with emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ye shes dang 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The fulfillment is the fulfillment of emptiness, the realization of the signless, and the wisdom of the wishless.üîΩThe non-attention is the non-attention to those.üîΩThe realization is the realization of the single mode of the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje ba dang / de rnams su yid la mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ston pa dang / theg pa chen po'i tshul gcig tu gyur pa so sor rtogs pa dang / mi skye ba la bzod pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje ba dang / de rnams su yid la mi byed pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ston pa dang / theg pa chen po'i tshul gcig tu gyur pa so sor rtogs pa dang / mi skye ba la bzod pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: The wisdom is the wisdom of acceptance of non-arising.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gcig tu ston pa dang / chos rnams thams cad la rnam par rtog pa thams cad kun tu bcom pa dang / 'du shes dang lta ba log pa dang / zhi gnas la nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gcig tu ston pa dang / chos rnams thams cad la rnam par rtog pa thams cad kun tu bcom pa dang / 'du shes dang lta ba log pa dang / zhi gnas la nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the eighth stage is called ‚Äúimmovable‚Äù because he is unmoved by either the afflictions or the views.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba las log pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba las log pa ste /
translated: The afflictions are the desire, etc.,

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs spong ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs spong ba'o //
translated: and the views are the view of the real existence of the person, etc., which are the reifications of signs.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the ninth stage is called ‚Äúgood intelligence‚Äù because he has attained the power of unhindered discernment of eloquence.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the tenth stage is called ‚Äúcloud of Dharma‚Äù because the great cloud of the Dharma, which is like a rain, pours down on him.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith is called a beginner.

original: sems dul ba nyid dang / mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sems dul ba nyid dang / mngon par zhen pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of greater practice is called a bodhisattva.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of sure preparation is called a hero.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of the joyous is called a conqueror‚Äôs heir.

original: mnyam zhes pa ni lhan cig pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam zhes pa ni lhan cig pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of superior morality is called a good person.

original: des de ltar sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su bdag gi lus kun tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: des de ltar sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su bdag gi lus kun tu ston pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of the light of wisdom is called a good teacher.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of the radiant is called a great teacher.

original: brgyad pa la ni /
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of the irreproachable is called a great spiritual hero.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of the far reaching is called a great sage.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of the immovable is called a great seer.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of the excellent intelligence is called a great brahman.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is in the stage of cloud of Dharma is called a great lord.

original: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang bsgrub pa dang // yongs su brtags phyir sangs rgyas bsten //üîΩdbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi //üîΩzhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las kyi rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
analyzed: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang bsgrub pa dang // yongs su brtags phyir sangs rgyas bsten // dbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi // zhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin srid pa len pa dang // las kyi rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
translated: 1. To know the minds of all beings, to play with the superknowledges, to create a good buddhaverse, and to serve the Buddhas, for the sake of the examination.üîΩ2. To know the faculties, to purify the buddhaverse, to abide like an illusion, to take on lives as wished, and to perform the various functions.üîΩThese are the eight kinds of actions of the bodhisattva.

original: ces pa ni dge ba yongs su dag pa sgrub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi chos rnams la yongs su brtag pa dang / dbang po shes pa @64a * //
analyzed: ces pa ni dge ba yongs su dag pa sgrub pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi chos rnams la yongs su brtag pa dang / dbang po shes pa @64a * //
translated: The first verse shows the bodhisattva‚Äôs eight kinds of action. The second verse shows the eight kinds of action in detail.

original: ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa'o //
translated: To know the faculties means to know the superior and inferior faculties of other beings.

original: sbyong ba ni yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyong ba ni yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: To purify the buddhaverse means to purify the receptacle world.

original: sgyu ma lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin gyis myur bar snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin gyis myur bar snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: To abide like an illusion means to enter into meditative concentration quickly through the meditative development of the superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The buddhaverse is twofold.

original: thog ma ni snod kyi 'jig rten la /
analyzed: thog ma ni snod kyi 'jig rten la /
translated: The first is the receptacle world.

original: de'i rjes la sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes pa'o //
translated: On the ground of Perfect Understanding,

original: legs pa'i blo gros la ni //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la ni //
translated: the bodhisattva is skilled in the four kinds of analytical knowledge,

original: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa tshu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa mchog dang ni //
analyzed: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa tshu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa mchog dang ni //
translated: in the three kinds of higher knowledge, and in the three vehicles.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of sentient beings and in the world of the physical cosmos.

original: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni //
translated: He is skilled in the world of the three times.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four noble truths.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the two veiwpoints.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the two vehicles.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the three vehicles.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four truths.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the five aggregates.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the six sense elements.

original: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi //
analyzed: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi //
translated: He is skilled in the world of the seven factors of enlightenment.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the eightfold path.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the nine meditative absorptions.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin // zhes pa ste /
translated: He is skilled in the world of the ten perfections.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four concentrations.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four immeasurables.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four formless states.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the five superknowledges.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the six superknowledges.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the seven branches of enlightenment.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the eight liberations.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the nine serial absorptions.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the ten universal bases.

original: chu bo ltar yongs su gang ba'i spobs pa dang / mngal 'jug pa'i mchog la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dgu ste /
analyzed: chu bo ltar yongs su gang ba'i spobs pa dang / mngal 'jug pa'i mchog la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dgu ste /
translated: He is skilled in the world of the four formless states.

original: de la rigs ni skye bo thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa ste /üîΩrgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs ni skye bo thams cad kyis bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa ste / rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in the world of the five aggregates.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the six sense bases.

original: rus ni nyi ma la sogs par skyes pa'i rus la /
analyzed: rus ni nyi ma la sogs par skyes pa'i rus la /
translated: He is skilled in the world of the seven factors of enlightenment.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the eightfold path.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the nine meditative absorptions.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the ten perfections.

original: cho 'brang ni ma la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i gnyen no //
analyzed: cho 'brang ni ma la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i gnyen no //
translated: He is skilled in the world of the four concentrations.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four immeasurables.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the four formless states.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the five superknowledges.üîΩHe is skilled in the world of the six superknowledges.

original: rang la brten pa ni 'khor la brgya byin la sogs pa mngon par dga' ba ni skyi ba'o //
analyzed: rang la brten pa ni 'khor la brgya byin la sogs pa mngon par dga' ba ni skyi ba'o //
translated: The one based on oneself is the retinue, such as Indra, who are delighted.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pas yang dag par bskul ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pas yang dag par bskul ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The one based on the Buddha is the emergence, which is the urging on of the Buddhas, etc.

original: byang chub shing ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i aa shva tva la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i aa shva tva la sogs pa'o //
translated: The tree of enlightenment is the wish-fulfilling tree, such as the a≈õvattha tree, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yon tan gyi ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yon tan gyi ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the essence of the qualities of all the Buddha natures is the perfection of the essence.

original: chos kyi sprin la ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la ni /
translated: In the Cloud of Truth stage,

original: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
analyzed: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
translated: the knowledge by which one passes beyond the nine stages

original: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
translated: and abides in the stage of the Buddha

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //üîΩbcu pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa // bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: is the tenth stage of the bodhisattva.

original: zhes te / sa ni rigs kyi sa la sogs pa dgu ste /
analyzed: zhes te / sa ni rigs kyi sa la sogs pa dgu ste /
translated: The stages are the nine stages beginning with the stage of the lineage.

original: de la rigs kyi sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The stage of the lineage is the state of the lineage-bearers who are destined for nirvana, which is conducive to penetration.

original: kha cig tu ni dang po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gsum la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni dang po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gsum la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la /
translated: In some places, the three stages of the path of preparation are called the stage of seeing purity,

original: rigs kyis ni chos mchog gi gnas skabs zhes rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyis ni chos mchog gi gnas skabs zhes rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: and the stage of the supreme mundane right is called the stage of lineage.

original: de 'dir bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dir bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: But this should not be accepted here.

original: brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pas so //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pas so //
translated: The eighth stage is the stage of entering the result of stream-entry.

original: mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i'o //
translated: The stage of seeing is the stage of stream-entry.

original: bsrabs pa'i @64b sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i @64b sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i'o //
translated: The stage of reduction is the stage of once-returner.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i'o //
translated: The stage of separation from attachment is the stage of non-returner.

original: byas pa dang ye shes kyis byas pa rtogs pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa dang ye shes kyis byas pa rtogs pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: The stage of realization of what is to be done and the stage of realization through wisdom are the stage of the arhat.

original: de'i sa ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'o //üîΩzhugs pa po rnam pa gsum dang drug po rnams bsdus pa ni nyan thos kyi sa la'o //
analyzed: de'i sa ni byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'o // zhugs pa po rnam pa gsum dang drug po rnams bsdus pa ni nyan thos kyi sa la'o //
translated: The stage of the arhat is the stage of realization of what is to be done.üîΩThe seven stages are taught with the intention of including the three and six types of enterers.

original: nyan thos kyi sa theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa la dgongs nas bdun du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa la dgongs nas bdun du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The seven stages are taught with the intention of presenting the ≈õrƒÅvaka stages in terms of the three vehicles.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: The pratyekabuddha stage is that of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva stage is that of the bodhisattvas.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i sa dgu po ste /
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i sa dgu po ste /
translated: It is the nine stages previously mentioned.

original: sa dgu bo 'di rnams zhes pa ni sa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: sa dgu bo 'di rnams zhes pa ni sa'i tshogs so //
translated: These nine stages are the collection of stages.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la theg pa la dang po yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'i mos pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa can 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed rnams kyi sems dang po bskyed pa can dang /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la theg pa la dang po yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'i mos pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa can 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed rnams kyi sems dang po bskyed pa can dang /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva on the stage of action in faith has faith in the first correct entry into the vehicle, and on the stage of joy, having a pure superior intention, has the first generation of the mind of the supramundane mind.

original: de la sogs pa nas sa bdun pa rnams yongs su 'bad rtsol dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa rnams dang / sa brgyad pa la sogs pa nas sa gsum pa mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub pas gnas pa can nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa can dang /
analyzed: de la sogs pa nas sa bdun pa rnams yongs su 'bad rtsol dang bcas pas mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa rnams dang / sa brgyad pa la sogs pa nas sa gsum pa mtshan ma med par lhun gyis grub pas gnas pa can nges par spyod pa la zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa can dang /
translated: those from the eighth level up to the three pure levels are those who are definitely engaged in practice and have the maturation of that practice,

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa khyad par gyi lam nye ba'i skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa khyad par gyi lam nye ba'i skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: and those who are impeded by a single birth are those who are impeded by a single birth in the special path.

original: nges par skye ba gcig gi rgyu bas bar chod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i phyir zhes pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: nges par skye ba gcig gi rgyu bas bar chod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i phyir zhes pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Those who are impeded by a single birth are impeded by the cause of a single birth and are on the level of buddhahood.

original: gnyan po'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gnyan po'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In terms of the collection of antidotes, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //üîΩnye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams // nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The paths of seeing and cultivation

original: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: are the eight types of antidotesüîΩfor the concepts of percepts and perceivers.

original: zhes te / goms pa ni bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: zhes te / goms pa ni bsgoms pas so //
translated: Cultivation is through meditation.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa po ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa po ste /
translated: Grasping is the grasper.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i'o //
translated: This is the realization of the peak.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of conceptualizations of the apprehended on the path of seeing:

original: dngos po tsam la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
translated: those based on mere things and those based on the side of the antidote.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang / gang zag brtags pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gang zag rdzas la brten pa dang / gang zag brtags pa la brten pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of conceptualizations of the grasper: those based on the substantial person and those based on the imputed person.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la brgyad po 'di rnams spong la gnyen po brgyad ni gnyen po'i tshogs te /üîΩde la @65a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam la brgyad po 'di rnams spong la gnyen po brgyad ni gnyen po'i tshogs te / de la @65a * //
translated: Similarly, on the path of meditation, these eight are abandoned and the eight antidotes are the collection of antidotes.

original: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang / rmi lam la sogs pa rnams kyi gzung ba'i dngos por dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams dang / rmi lam la sogs pa rnams kyi gzung ba'i dngos por dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: On the path of seeing, the conceptualizations that apprehend the apprehended as things such as reality and so on and dreams and so on are the conceptualizations of the apprehended.

original: de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar rtogs pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar rtogs pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The realization that they are empty of their own entity is the antidote.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar rnams la gnyen po'i gnyen por nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar rnams la gnyen po'i gnyen por nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the antidote to the antidotes to generosity and so on up to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes pas nye bar dmigs pa med pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes pas nye bar dmigs pa med pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of those is the antidote, because they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gang zag rdzas su nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gang zag rdzas su nye bar dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the substantial person of the arhats and so on.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of that is the antidote.

original: ming dang brda dang tha snyad la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa la de ltar mi dmigs pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: ming dang brda dang tha snyad la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa la de ltar mi dmigs pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The conception of the apprehension of names, symbols, conventions, and so on. The non-apprehension of that is the antidote.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni /
translated: On the path of cultivation,

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas mi gnas shing mi gnas pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i sbyor bas mi gnas shing mi gnas pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: one does not abide in all phenomena through the application of non-abiding, nor does one abide in non-abiding.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rnal 'byor gyis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rnal 'byor gyis so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By the yoga of the dharmadhatu, one does not abide in the non-abiding of the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar na gzung ba'i dngos po rnams nye bar mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po'i dngos po mi dmigs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas mi dmigs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag brtags pa la brten pa'i rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba'i dngos po rnams nye bar mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po'i dngos po mi dmigs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rdzas mi dmigs pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag brtags pa la brten pa'i rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is non-apprehension of the entities of the objects of perception, non-apprehension of the entities of the antidotes of generosity, etc., non-apprehension of the substance of the person of the stream-enterers, etc., and non-apprehension of the fruits of the stream-enterers, etc., which are based on the imputation of the person of the stream-enterers, etc.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa 'dis nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i go skabs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa 'dis nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i go skabs te /
translated: By ‚Äúone will go forth‚Äù he indicates the opportunity for the practice of going forth.

original: de dag gi nges par 'byung ba ni ma lus par 'gro ba'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nges par 'byung ba ni ma lus par 'gro ba'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: Their going forth is the practice of going to the end.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gong gi ji srid du sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa la /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi gong gi ji srid du sems bskyed pa nyi shu pa la /
translated: The realization of the peak is the path of meditation, and it is the twenty-first generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de'i gong du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su byas pa'i ngo bo sgrub pa med pas nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu nges 'byung thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gong du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su byas pa'i ngo bo sgrub pa med pas nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu nges 'byung thob pa ste /
translated: Since there is no accomplishment of the nature that is made into the state of the result prior to that, there is the attainment of the result of definite emergence.

original: de ni nges par 'byung ba'i phyir sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nges par 'byung ba'i phyir sgrub pa ste /
translated: Since that is definite emergence, it is the accomplishment.

original: de rnams thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: All of those are considered in the treatise.üîΩThe object of the path of definite emergenceüîΩis the nature of the eight topics:üîΩthe object, sameness,üîΩthe effortless benefit of sentient beings,üîΩdefinite emergence,üîΩthe characteristic of attaining definite emergence,üîΩomniscience,

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don bya 'bad med dang // shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang // nges 'byung thob pa'i mtshan nyid dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // nges 'byung lam gyi spyod yul can //
analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don bya 'bad med dang // shin tu nges par 'byung ba dang // nges 'byung thob pa'i mtshan nyid dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // nges 'byung lam gyi spyod yul can //
translated: and the object of the path of definite emergence.

original: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the eight topics

original: nges 'byung @65b bsgrub pa yin zhes bya /
analyzed: nges 'byung @65b bsgrub pa yin zhes bya /
translated: is called ‚Äúthe accomplishment of definite emergence.‚Äù

original: zhes te / de rnams gsungs pa ni /üîΩde skad ces bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / de rnams gsungs pa ni / de skad ces bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of those is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas byang chub sems dpa' nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas byang chub sems dpa' nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the world is overwhelmed, the bodhisattva will attain definite emergence.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: ci'i phyir 'dis 'jig rten zil gyis mnan pa yin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dis 'jig rten zil gyis mnan pa yin na /
translated: Why is it that this vehicle surpasses the world?

original: de thob pas bdag nyid chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pas bdag nyid chen po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by attaining it, one attains the state of a great being.

original: de yang ji ltar na sems can gyi phung po'i mchog nyid du sgrub pa la sems can chen po dang / spong ba chen po dang / rtogs pa che bas chen po'o zhes pa ni ched du byed pa'i nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na sems can gyi phung po'i mchog nyid du sgrub pa la sems can chen po dang / spong ba chen po dang / rtogs pa che bas chen po'o zhes pa ni ched du byed pa'i nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is established as the supreme of all groups of sentient beings because it is a great being, a great abandonment, and a great realization.

original: de'i theg pa ni chen por brjod ces pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i theg pa ni chen por brjod ces pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The vehicle of that is called the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar na mnyam pa nyid na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mnyam pa nyid na /
translated: How is it equal?

original: ji ltar nam mkha' phyogs kyi dbye bas phye yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' phyogs kyi dbye bas phye yang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: Just as space, although divided by the divisions of directions, ultimately has no nature,

original: kha dog med pa /
analyzed: kha dog med pa /
translated: no color,

original: dbyibs med pa /üîΩbstan du med pa /
analyzed: dbyibs med pa / bstan du med pa /
translated: no shape,üîΩis not demonstrable,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: is unobstructing,

original: mtha' med pa /
analyzed: mtha' med pa /
translated: has no end,

original: dbus med pa /üîΩnyams pa med pa /
analyzed: dbus med pa / nyams pa med pa /
translated: no middle,üîΩis not diminished,

original: 'phel ba med pa /
analyzed: 'phel ba med pa /
translated: is not increased,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: is unborn,

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: and unceasing,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po'o zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po'o zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the emancipation of sameness.

original: nam mkha' go phye ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam mkha' go phye ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is included within the open space of the world systems.

original: theg pa chen po yang de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang de bzhin du ste /
translated: The universal vehicle is also like that,

original: des de rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de rnams kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits those beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dang / phyogs rnams grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir na gzhal du med pa dang / bgrang ba med pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dang / phyogs rnams grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i phyir na gzhal du med pa dang / bgrang ba med pa dang / tshad med pa'o //
translated: The world systems, directions, and so on are immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless, because they are not fully grasped by enumeration.

original: rnam grangs 'dis ni bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis ni bye brag gis so //
translated: By this enumeration, they are differentiated.

original: ji ltar na de srid du de rnams kyi gong byed na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de srid du de rnams kyi gong byed na /
translated: How can they be benefited to that extent?

original: gang zhig sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang chos thams cad ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can dang nam mkha' dang theg pa chen po dang chos thams cad ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: Those beings, space, the universal vehicle, and all things are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du sems can 'di rnams ni theg pa chen pos go 'byed ces pa ni sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can 'di rnams ni theg pa chen pos go 'byed ces pa ni sems can gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, these sentient beings are the opening of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, which is the definite emergence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'ong ba ni 'ong ba la 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba ni 'ong ba la 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Coming is coming, and going is going.

original: gnas dang 'gro ba dang ldog pa gsum char theg pa chen po la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas dang 'gro ba dang ldog pa gsum char theg pa chen po la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The three‚Äîabiding, going, and returning‚Äîdo not exist in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: chos rnams thams cad mi bskyed pa ni gang zhig de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba nyid pas /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mi bskyed pa ni gang zhig de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ba nyid pas /
translated: The non-production of all phenomena is that they are empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: gang nas 'ongs pa med cing gang du 'gro ba yang med la gang du gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang nas 'ongs pa med cing gang du 'gro ba yang med la gang du gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: There is no coming from anywhere, no going anywhere, and no abiding anywhere.

original: @66a * // yongs su rdzogs pa la longs spyod pa zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: @66a * // yongs su rdzogs pa la longs spyod pa zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the complete is the effortless definite emergence.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nam mkha' la'o //
translated: In the same way means in space.

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: The prior limit is the past time.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The later limit is the future.

original: dbus ni da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbus ni da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: The middle is the present.

original: ji ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ni gang la dus gsum med pas dus gsum mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ni gang la dus gsum med pas dus gsum mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The equality of the three times is that which is without the three times, the equality of the three times.

original: theg pa chen po dang byang chub sems dpa' yang rang bzhin gyis stong la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang byang chub sems dpa' yang rang bzhin gyis stong la /
translated: The Mahayana and the bodhisattva are also empty by nature.

original: stong pa nyid la ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yang med la /
translated: In emptiness there is no past, future, or present.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med do //
translated: In it, the afflictions are not apprehended.

original: rnam par byang ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med do //
translated: There is no purification.

original: 'khor ba med do //
analyzed: 'khor ba med do //
translated: There is no samsara.üîΩThere is no nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa'i mtha' med pa ni shin tu nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa'i mtha' med pa ni shin tu nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The absence of an end is the definite emergence.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni thob pa'i nges 'byung gi go skabs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni thob pa'i nges 'byung gi go skabs te /
translated: Then, the opportunity for the definite emergence of attainment is from ‚Äúthen the Lord having spoken thus to the bodhisattva Maitreya‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Omniscience is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rjes su mthun zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su mthun zhes pa ni /
translated: In accordance with means

original: khyod kyis chos thams cad theg pa chen po zhes pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa de'i nang du 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i ye shes la de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos thams cad theg pa chen po zhes pa'i ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa de'i nang du 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i ye shes la de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: You have taught that all phenomena are included in the wisdom of the absence of an essence that is called the Great Vehicle.

original: de bas na rjes su mthun par bstan zhes par dgongs pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang zhes pa dang / de ci'i slad du zhes pa dang / gzugs zhes pa dang / de bzhin du zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas zhes pa dang / ji ltar zhes pa dang / de bzhin du zhes pa dang / ji ltar zhes pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su mthun par bstan zhes par dgongs pa'o // gzhan yang zhes pa dang / de ci'i slad du zhes pa dang / gzugs zhes pa dang / de bzhin du zhes pa dang / sangs rgyas zhes pa dang / ji ltar zhes pa dang / de bzhin du zhes pa dang / ji ltar zhes pa dang /
translated: Therefore, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa dang / de ci'i zhes pa dang / med ces pa dang / de yang zhes pa'i tshig bcu gnyis po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa dang / de ci'i zhes pa dang / med ces pa dang / de yang zhes pa'i tshig bcu gnyis po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis thob pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa la /
translated: The twelve terms beginning with ‚ÄúFurthermore‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy is that?‚Äù and ‚Äúform‚Äù and ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù and ‚Äúbuddhas‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù and ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù and ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù and ‚Äúthat‚Äù are in terms of the natural attainment of the transcendence of suffering.

original: de rnams kyis thob pa'i khyad par bcu gnyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyis thob pa'i khyad par bcu gnyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The twelve distinctions of those are stated.

original: de la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa la goms pa mthar phyin pa de rnams kyis mngon par zhen pa skye ba'i sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po rnam pa thams cad du log nas sgrib pa med pa'i kun rdzob kyi tshul
analyzed: de la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa la goms pa mthar phyin pa de rnams kyis mngon par zhen pa skye ba'i sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga po rnam pa thams cad du log nas sgrib pa med pa'i kun rdzob kyi tshul
translated: The summary meaning is: those who have perfected the practice of non-attachment to all phenomena, having completely reversed the five aggregates with the obscurations that give rise to attachment, through the method of the unobstructed relative,

original: gyis skye ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpas thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don te //
analyzed: gyis skye ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpas thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don te //
translated: attain the omniscience of all aspects of birth, which is enlightenment.

original: so so'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa brjod de /
analyzed: so so'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa brjod de /
translated: The individual meanings expressed by the BhagavƒÅn

original: theg pa chen po 'dir slob pa nyid ces pa nas ji srid du rjes su thob par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'dir slob pa nyid ces pa nas ji srid du rjes su thob par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: are from just the training in this MahƒÅyƒÅna up to how will they attain it?

original: @66b de la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnyis su byar med pas de'i phyir med cing 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: @66b de la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnyis su byar med pas de'i phyir med cing 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: There, since all of the prior limits, etc. are not to be made dual, therefore they are non-existent and non-going.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de'i sngon gyi mtha' ni sogs pa rnams ni gang du yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de'i sngon gyi mtha' ni sogs pa rnams ni gang du yang med pa nyid de /
translated: Why? The past limit of that, etc. , is not at all.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Because form, etc. , is equal to space.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas 'dir phyi ma'i mtha' dang / snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha'i dbus dang bral ba la de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas 'dir phyi ma'i mtha' dang / snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha'i dbus dang bral ba la de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Since form, etc. , is empty of intrinsic reality, here the future limit, the past and future limit, and the middle are just like that, i.e. , the Bodhisattva.

original: med cing mi dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung bas so //
analyzed: med cing mi dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid nye bar bzung bas so //
translated: Non-existence and non-apprehension are taken as the emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' bsgrags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //üîΩthams cad nas zhes pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' bsgrags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o // thams cad nas zhes pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas so //
translated: The Bodhisattva‚Äôs Dharma is the five aggregates of form, etc. , proclaimed as the Bodhisattva.üîΩAll means by the divisions of the aggregates, elements, etc.

original: thams cad kyi ji ltar gyur pa'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i cha shas kyi sde tshan rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ji ltar gyur pa'i yongs su rdzogs pa'i cha shas kyi sde tshan rnams kyi'o //
translated: All means of the divisions of the parts of the complete.

original: yang thams cad ces pa ni sde de rnams kyi re re'i thams cad do /
analyzed: yang thams cad ces pa ni sde de rnams kyi re re'i thams cad do /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the all of each of those schools.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni rang rang gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni rang rang gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll aspects‚Äù means that each is empty of itself.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of all is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos gang ni byang chub sems dpa' la brjod do //
analyzed: chos gang ni byang chub sems dpa' la brjod do //
translated: What dharma is taught to the bodhisattva?

original: chos gang gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsgrags pas so //
analyzed: chos gang gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bsgrags pas so //
translated: By what dharma is it proclaimed as the perfection of wisdom?

original: chos gang la ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrags pa'i thob par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: chos gang la ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrags pa'i thob par bya ba la'o //
translated: What dharma is proclaimed as the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects?

original: gdams par bgyi ba ni med pa nyid ces pa'i don te /
analyzed: gdams par bgyi ba ni med pa nyid ces pa'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúInstructing‚Äù means non-existence.

original: de ltar gdams pa med pa la rjes su gnas pa med pa gang gis kyang cung zhig thob pa med cing zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gdams pa med pa la rjes su gnas pa med pa gang gis kyang cung zhig thob pa med cing zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, in the absence of any instruction, there is no abiding in the absence of anything. By whom is there no attainment of anything?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù means buddhahood is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ming du btags pa tsam ste don gyis stong ba'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ming du btags pa tsam ste don gyis stong ba'i ming ngo //
translated: It is merely a nominal designation, a name empty of meaning.

original: mngon par ma grub pa med pa ni ming du btags pa nyid pas grub la /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa med pa ni ming du btags pa nyid pas grub la /
translated: Since the non-establishment of the non-established is just a nominal designation, it is established.

original: 'dir mngon par ma grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming ma grub pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams thob pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par ma grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming ma grub pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams thob pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the name of the non-established bodhisattva is not established, so it is not the case that they attain omniscience. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas dang / ming gi sgo nas thob pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas dang / ming gi sgo nas thob pa bkag nas /
translated: Similarly, having refuted attainment from the perspective of the selflessness of phenomena and from the perspective of names,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas dgag pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas dgag pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: the refutation from the perspective of the selflessness of persons is stated:

original: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for just like... and so on,

original: shin tu med pa ni mtha' gcig tu'o //
analyzed: shin tu med pa ni mtha' gcig tu'o //
translated: very non-existent means absolutely non-existent.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du zhes pa la @67a * //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o // de bzhin du zhes pa la @67a * //
translated: Non-establishment means not real.

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, as for just like... and so on,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa 'di rnams ni dngos med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa 'di rnams ni dngos med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i don to //
translated: the nature of non-entityness means the meaning of non-entityness.

original: gang zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa med pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa med pa'am /
translated: That which is free from apprehended and apprehender is without engagement or just like....

original: ma skyes pa de'i gzugs zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa ji ltar zhes pa'i bar ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa de'i gzugs zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa ji ltar zhes pa'i bar ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe non-arisen‚Äù from ‚Äúform‚Äù up to ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù

original: gang zhig kun rdzob rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de ni mngon par 'jug pa med pa skye ba med pa'i de kho na nyid de de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig kun rdzob rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de ni mngon par 'jug pa med pa skye ba med pa'i de kho na nyid de de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: That which is the non-existence of these dependently arisen conventionalities, the emptiness of intrinsic reality, is the reality of non-engagement, non-arising, and that is the ultimate.

original: de med ces pa ni dbyer med pa dgag la /
analyzed: de med ces pa ni dbyer med pa dgag la /
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist‚Äù is a negation of non-differentiation.

original: de ji snyam zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbye bas te /
analyzed: de ji snyam zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbye bas te /
translated: ‚Äú How is it?‚Äù and so forth is a differentiation.

original: mngon par grub pa med pa'i stong pa nyid tsam po'i byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par ma grub pa'i stong pa nyid tsam pos gdams par bgyi ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa med pa'i stong pa nyid tsam po'i byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par ma grub pa'i stong pa nyid tsam pos gdams par bgyi ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is just emptiness without manifest establishment should be instructed by just emptiness without manifest establishment.

original: gang du yang yod pa min zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang du yang yod pa min zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist anywhere‚Äù is the ultimate.

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate reality is the nature free from all superimpositions such as difference and non-difference.

original: gzhan du yang med ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang med ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it elsewhere means that the conventional and the ultimate are of one taste.

original: de nyid kyis na 'phags pas kun rdzob la //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'phags pas kun rdzob la //
translated: For this very reason, the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa kho nar bzhed //üîΩdngos po rang dbang med ces pa'i //
analyzed: de ni stong pa kho nar bzhed // dngos po rang dbang med ces pa'i //
translated: is explained to be emptiness.üîΩIt is dependent arising that is explained to be the middle way.

original: seng ge'i sgra khyod dang mnyam med //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra khyod dang mnyam med //
translated: You are the lion‚Äôs roar, unrivaled,üîΩthat proclaims things are powerless.

original: ces pa dang / rang dbang med pa 'dir yang 'phags pas /üîΩgang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: ces pa dang / rang dbang med pa 'dir yang 'phags pas / gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
translated: And: Since the noble ones have no power,üîΩthere is no phenomenon anywhere

original: chos 'ga' gang du yod min pas //üîΩde phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'ga' gang du yod min pas // de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: that is not dependently arisen.üîΩTherefore, there is no phenomenon anywhere

original: chos 'ga' gang na yod pa min //
analyzed: chos 'ga' gang na yod pa min //
translated: that is not empty.

original: mkhas sogs rnams la mkhas min gyi //
analyzed: mkhas sogs rnams la mkhas min gyi //
translated: The wise and the unwise

original: 'jig rten pa yis de rnams la //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis de rnams la //
translated: do not perceive the world in the same way.üîΩThe world is permanent for the wise,

original: rtag dang mi rtag rtag 'gyur yang //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag rtag 'gyur yang //
translated: but impermanent for the unwise.

original: mkhas pas don du mthong ba med //
analyzed: mkhas pas don du mthong ba med //
translated: The wise one sees nothing as real.

original: ces te / chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces te / chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thob par bya ba'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thob par bya ba'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of a Buddha are the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth that are to be attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni sngon du thob pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni sngon du thob pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: The qualities of a Bodhisattva are the previously attained virtues.

original: gang zhig rig ces pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rig ces pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
translated: The one who knows is the Bodhisattva.

original: sems dang bar mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig lnga rnams kyis ni zhi gnas kyi rnam pa lnga gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang bar mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig lnga rnams kyis ni zhi gnas kyi rnam pa lnga gsungs pa'o //
translated: The five words beginning with ‚Äúdoes not become confident‚Äù teach the five aspects of ≈õamatha.

original: phyir phyogs par mi byed ces pa'i tshig bzhi po 'di dang / zhi bar byed nye bar zhi bar @67b byed ces pa ni sems pa la gcig tu byas nas mnyam par 'dzin par byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: phyir phyogs par mi byed ces pa'i tshig bzhi po 'di dang / zhi bar byed nye bar zhi bar @67b byed ces pa ni sems pa la gcig tu byas nas mnyam par 'dzin par byed ces pa ste /
translated: The four words beginning with ‚Äúdoes not turn away‚Äù and ‚Äúpacifies‚Äù and ‚Äúcompletely pacifies‚Äù are taken as one, and ‚Äúunifies‚Äù means to hold them in equipoise.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni ngo bo nyid med pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems phyis nyams par gyur nas dngos po la chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni ngo bo nyid med pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems phyis nyams par gyur nas dngos po la chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: By these, the mind that is in equipoise on the absence of intrinsic existence does not later degenerate and become attached to things.

original: 'dir bzhis rjes la nyams par bkag nas yid rjes la nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir bzhis rjes la nyams par bkag nas yid rjes la nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, by the four, after having prohibited deterioration, the mind does not deteriorate.

original: de ltar tshig drug gis ni zhi gnas kyi tshig dgu gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshig drug gis ni zhi gnas kyi tshig dgu gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by six words, he has stated the nine words of serenity.

original: skrag par mi 'gyur zhes pa lhag mthong la mi sdang zhes pa la sogs pa tshig gnyis kyis ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur zhes pa lhag mthong la mi sdang zhes pa la sogs pa tshig gnyis kyis ni zung du 'brel ba'i lam gsungs pa'o //
translated: The two words, does not fear and does not hate and so on, refer to insight.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin la skrag par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyi cha la /
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin la skrag par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyi cha la /
translated: Thus, does not fear concentration refers to the aspect of serenity.

original: yang dag par rab tu shes pas kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni lhag mthong gi cha'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu shes pas kun tu skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun tu skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni lhag mthong gi cha'o //
translated: And does not fear, does not become frightened refers to the aspect of insight.

original: spyod ces pa ni bstan pa la lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: spyod ces pa ni bstan pa la lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The word practice refers to the teaching, and the rest to the explanation.

original: sgom pa'o zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: sgom pa'o zhes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: The word cultivation refers to serenity.

original: nye bar rtogs pa ni lhag mthong gis te /
analyzed: nye bar rtogs pa ni lhag mthong gis te /
translated: The word realization refers to insight.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: By the mode of signlessness.

original: nges par sems pa ni nye bar rtogs par byas nas mkhas pa rnams kyis zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyis sems par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par sems pa ni nye bar rtogs par byas nas mkhas pa rnams kyis zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyis sems par byed pa ste /
translated: Definitely thinking is thinking by the wise by means of the path of union, after having understood.

original: 'di'i 'thad pa ni de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dri ba la /
analyzed: 'di'i 'thad pa ni de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dri ba la /
translated: The justification for this is: why is that?

original: gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: when, etc.

original: chos ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: chos ni chos thams cad do //
translated: Dharma is all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa la'o //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom means in the manifest.

original: nye bar mi rtog ces pa ni nye bar mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩnye bar mi 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: nye bar mi rtog ces pa ni nye bar mi dmigs pa'o // nye bar mi 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
translated: Not conceptualizing means not apprehending.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not grasping means not conceiving, because of non-conceptuality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pas ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa rnams bkag nas khyad par la rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pas ngo bo nyid la rnam par rtog pa rnams bkag nas khyad par la rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir gsungs pa ste /
translated: Having refuted the conceptions about the essence by saying ‚Äúin the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù in order to refute the conceptions about the distinctions, it is said:

original: gzugs skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: One does not see the production of form, etc.

original: don dam par na skye ba la mi sbyor bas na gang du 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par na skye ba la mi sbyor bas na gang du 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since ultimately it is not connected with arising, it does not exist anywhere as ceasing.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag gi dbye ba med pa'i dgag byar bya ba dang / dbye ba dgag pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag gi dbye ba med pa'i dgag byar bya ba dang / dbye ba dgag pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, etc. is stated in order to refute the distinction of non-arisen and non-ceased forms, etc. and in order to refute the distinction.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa la rang bzhin med pas gnyis su med pa'i dngos po mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs la sogs pa la rang bzhin med pas gnyis su med pa'i dngos po mi 'thad ce na /
translated: Well, since forms, etc. are essenceless, the non-dual entity is not tenable.

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: To respond:

original: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩgang @68a * //
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / gang @68a * //
translated: Whatever, etc.

original: du kun rdzob kyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po ni skye bar byed la /
analyzed: du kun rdzob kyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po ni skye bar byed la /
translated: Where the five aggregates of form, etc. which are the nature of the conventional arise,

original: don dam par dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med pa dang zad pa med pa dag ro gcig pas gnyis su med de /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba med pa dang zad pa med pa dag ro gcig pas gnyis su med de /
translated: ultimately, non-arising and non-exhaustion, which are characterized by the absence of entity, are of one taste, and thus are non-dual.

original: gnyis su zhes pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su zhes pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Non-dual means not having the entity of two.

original: gnyis su byar med pa ni gzhan du rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo dang bral ba la byed pa po'i tshad ma med ces pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi ste /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa ni gzhan du rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo dang bral ba la byed pa po'i tshad ma med ces pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi ste /
translated: The phrase there is no valid cognition of an agent refers to the other position, that is, the position that the two are not different, that is, the position that they are free from the nature of the two aspects.

original: thob pa'i nges 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thob pa'i nges 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the determination of attainment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With the desire to teach the determination of omniscience, he said:

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, Bhagavan, etc.

original: de bzhin du ni rnam pa thams cad ces pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni rnam pa thams cad ces pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: Thus is connected with all aspects.

original: bya ba'i khyad par las 'di'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par las 'di'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of this is like the previous one, from the point of view of the particular action.

original: des na zhes pa ni gang gis gnyis su med par 'di rnams bgrang bar byas pa'i rgyu mtshan des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni gang gis gnyis su med par 'di rnams bgrang bar byas pa'i rgyu mtshan des na'o //
translated: Therefore means for that reason, by which they are counted as non-dual.

original: de'i skyon gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i skyon gsungs pa ni /
translated: The fault of that is stated:

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If, moreover, etc.

original: dka' ba'i las kyis spyod pa pos spyod pa gang de ci'i phyir spyod par 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: dka' ba'i las kyis spyod pa pos spyod pa gang de ci'i phyir spyod par 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: The practice by the practitioner through difficult action, that practice, why would it be practiced? By the effort of application.

original: chung ngu'i don la'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i don la'o //
translated: The meaning of the small.

original: dka' ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo dang lus gtong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dka' ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo dang lus gtong ba la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The difficult is that of giving up one's hands, feet, head, and body, and so on.

original: de dag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ci'i phyir spro ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
analyzed: de dag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ci'i phyir spro ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis so //
translated: The reason for undertaking those is the armor-like effort.

original: de la spyod pa med cing dmigs pa med ces pa ni rgol ba la /
analyzed: de la spyod pa med cing dmigs pa med ces pa ni rgol ba la /
translated: The statement, There is no practice and no objective support, is a response to an objection.

original: de skad ces /
analyzed: de skad ces /
translated: The statement, Subhuti, is the objection.

original: dka' ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyi lan no //
analyzed: dka' ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyi lan no //
translated: The statement, Subhuti, is the response of Subhuti.

original: de la thog ma 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa ni khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: de la thog ma 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa ni khas blangs pas so //
translated: The statement, In that case, and so on, is the response.

original: ci ltar mi 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be undesirable?

original: don dam par ni spyod par byed pa mi 'thad la /
analyzed: don dam par ni spyod par byed pa mi 'thad la /
translated: Ultimately, practice is not tenable.

original: kun rdzob tu ni dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis dka' ba'i spyod pa yid la gcags pa ni rdzogs sangs rgyas las rnam par ldog par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis dka' ba'i spyod pa yid la gcags pa ni rdzogs sangs rgyas las rnam par ldog par 'gyur bas so //
