translated: Conventionally, the mental affliction of the notion of difficulty with regard to difficult practice would cause one to turn away from perfect buddhahood.

original: yang mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan gnyis pa ni mi 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan gnyis pa ni mi 'gyur ba ni rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The second response to the question, Why is that? and so on, is that it would not be perfect.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan gsum pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan gsum pa ni /
translated: The third reply is ‚ÄúBut‚Äù and so forth.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ces pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi phung po lnga po de rnams thams cad las grol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ces pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi phung po lnga po de rnams thams cad las grol bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll suffering‚Äù refers to the five aggregates of all that is contaminated.

original: thams cad nas ni khams dang grol ba dang gang zhig gzhan la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: thams cad nas ni khams dang grol ba dang gang zhig gzhan la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù refers to the distinctions of realm, liberation, and other.

original: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gsum po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gsum po rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every respect‚Äù refers to the three kinds of suffering.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni dmigs pa rnams thams cad @68b kyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni dmigs pa rnams thams cad @68b kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every form‚Äù refers to all the objects.

original: thams cad ni lhag ma ma lus par sgrol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni lhag ma ma lus par sgrol bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù refers to the complete liberation that remains.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs te /üîΩsems la so sor rab tu skyon te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs te / sems la so sor rab tu skyon te /
translated: The ‚Äúmass of suffering‚Äù is the collection of suffering.üîΩIt is ‚Äúdeeply rooted in the mind‚Äù because it is firmly established in the mind.

original: khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúhatred‚Äù because it is the cause of the mind‚Äôs aversion.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan bzhi pa ni thams cad nas ni bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gso ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i dbye bas sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan bzhi pa ni thams cad nas ni bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gso ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i dbye bas sam /
translated: The fourth reply is ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù and so forth. ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù refers to the distinctions of self, sentient being, life, nourished being, and so on.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas so //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas so //
translated: by the means of valid knowledge such as direct perception, etc.

original: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i snang ba dang mi snang ba phye ba'i khyab pa dang cig shos gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i snang ba dang mi snang ba phye ba'i khyab pa dang cig shos gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: All means that which is pervaded by the distinction of the appearance and non-appearance of whatever there is, and the nature of the other.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnams las tha dad kyis ji ltar tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnams las tha dad kyis ji ltar tha mi dad pas so //
translated: All aspects means that which is different from the aggregates, etc., but is not different from them.

original: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i so so'i sde tshan so so ba dang bsdus pa de rnams la /
analyzed: thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i so so'i sde tshan so so ba dang bsdus pa de rnams la /
translated: All means that which is in the individual classes of whatever there is, whether individually or collectively.

original: byed pa po la sogs pa'am ngo bo nyid du de ltar chos thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po la sogs pa'am ngo bo nyid du de ltar chos thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The agent, etc., or the nature of that is not so in all dharmas.

original: thams cad kyis ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas sam rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas sam rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pas so //
translated: All means by the classification of the aggregates, elements, etc., or by their individual characteristics, etc.

original: thams cad ni cha shas thams cad las ji ltar gyur pa'i sde tshan rnams kyi cha shas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: thams cad ni cha shas thams cad las ji ltar gyur pa'i sde tshan rnams kyi cha shas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: All means that which is in all parts, whether the parts of the classes are complete or not,

original: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: whether external or internal.

original: yang thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i sde tshan la sogs pa de thams cad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang thams cad ni ji ltar gyur pa'i sde tshan la sogs pa de thams cad ces pa'i don to //
translated: Again, all means the entire class, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni dbye ba de thams cad kyi bdag nyid gang ma lus pa bsdus pa de rnams thams cad la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni dbye ba de thams cad kyi bdag nyid gang ma lus pa bsdus pa de rnams thams cad la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: All aspects means the nature of all those divisions, which is the totality of what is included without exception.

original: de nyid la dka' ba spyod pa can gyi spyod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba la lan rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la dka' ba spyod pa can gyi spyod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba la lan rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa ste /
translated: In order to respond to the consequence that there would be no conduct for one who practices austerities in that very [reality], four responses are stated.

original: bzhi kas kyang de ltar gsal bar bya ba ni dga' ba spyod pa po yang skye ba med pa'i de lta bu'i de kho na nyid la /
analyzed: bzhi kas kyang de ltar gsal bar bya ba ni dga' ba spyod pa po yang skye ba med pa'i de lta bu'i de kho na nyid la /
translated: All four clarify that even one who practices with joy, in that suchness which is non-arising,

original: de ltar de kho na nyid du mthong ba nyid kyis de ltar spyod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid du mthong ba nyid kyis de ltar spyod par bya ba'o //
translated: one should practice in that way by seeing reality in that way.

original: gang du ni 'di nus par gyur na 'bras bu chen por 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang du ni 'di nus par gyur na 'bras bu chen por 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Where, if one is able, there will be a great result.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa bkag cing bcom pa'i phyir gnas brtan no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa bkag cing bcom pa'i phyir gnas brtan no //
translated: The elder is so called because of having stopped and destroyed all conceptual thoughts regarding all phenomena in every way.

original: gang yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa nas brtsams pa'i sgra ni de ltar snga nas bshad do //
analyzed: gang yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa nas brtsams pa'i sgra ni de ltar snga nas bshad do //
translated: The words beginning with ‚Äúthe venerable one‚Äù are explained as before.

original: 'dir ni thams cad shes pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sangs rgyas kyang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni thams cad shes pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sangs rgyas kyang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, it means ‚Äúthe state of all-knowing, the state of knowing all aspects, and buddhahood.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas su byed pa po'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas su byed pa po'i chos rnams so //
translated: The dharmas of omniscience are the dharmas that make one a buddha.

original: skye ba med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //üîΩso so'i skye bo dang skye bo'i chos @69a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo // so so'i skye bo dang skye bo'i chos @69a * //
translated: Non-arising is the noble path.

original: rnams ni 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnams ni 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: The dharmas of ordinary beings and the dharmas of beings are desire.

original: de thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of stopping the conceptualization of attaining that is stated:

original: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji srid du shin tu spong bas sam zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas ji srid du shin tu spong bas sam zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Having said that, etc., up to ‚Äúbecause of thorough abandonment.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOmniscience‚Äù is the state of knowing all aspects.

original: rjes su thob ces pa ni gdod nas de de ltar de thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir la /
analyzed: rjes su thob ces pa ni gdod nas de de ltar de thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir la /
translated: The subsequent attainment is the primordial nature of all those, because they are the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid du rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin nyid du rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the dharmadhƒÅtu is completely pure in every way as the nature of the essence of non-arising.

original: de skad ces pa la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: de skad ces pa la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: The reply to that is stated as follows:

original: chos ni byang chub sems dpar brjod pa'i'o //
analyzed: chos ni byang chub sems dpar brjod pa'i'o //
translated: The Dharma is that which is called the bodhisattva.

original: thob pa ni thob par byed pa bo nyid de /
analyzed: thob pa ni thob par byed pa bo nyid de /
translated: Attainment is the very act of attaining,

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: in the context of application.

original: thob pa yang med cing mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i rtog pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su ste /
analyzed: thob pa yang med cing mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i rtog pa ni dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su ste /
translated: And there is no attainment and no realization in the context of the actual stage,

original: 'dir mi 'dod pa ni mi rigs pas thob par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir mi 'dod pa ni mi rigs pas thob par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unreasonable to assert that what is not desired here is attained.

original: rigs pa yang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa yang gsungs pa ni /
translated: The reasoning is also stated:

original: yang med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: There is no attainment, etc.

original: chos kyis zhes pa ni thob pa pos te /
analyzed: chos kyis zhes pa ni thob pa pos te /
translated: The Dharma is the one who attains.

original: thob pa dang thob bya'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa dang thob bya'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga dag ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both the characteristics of attainment and that which is to be attained are essenceless.

original: rab 'byor gyis gzhan yang skye ba'i phyogs kyis 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gzhan yang skye ba'i phyogs kyis 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti also says that it is untenable from the perspective of arising:

original: ci zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: What is non-arisen?

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du 'gyur ba'am ma skyes pa nyid ces pa'i gzhan du ji ltar the tshom gnyis skye ba la dang po na ni 'gal te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du 'gyur ba'am ma skyes pa nyid ces pa'i gzhan du ji ltar the tshom gnyis skye ba la dang po na ni 'gal te /
translated: How could there be doubt about two things, non-arisen and arisen, in the first case, there is a contradiction,

original: ma skyes pa ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni med pa nyid do //
translated: because non-arisen is non-existent.

original: de ni ji ltar yod par byed de /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar yod par byed de /
translated: How could that be made existent?

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: tshangs pa gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las rnam par ma grol ba'i chos ni rdul phra mo tsam yang skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes te ;
analyzed: tshangs pa gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las rnam par ma grol ba'i chos ni rdul phra mo tsam yang skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes te ;
translated: BrahmƒÅ, I do not see any phenomenon, not even an atom, that arises from dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir na gnyi ga yang ma skyes par gsungs pas thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gnyi ga yang ma skyes par gsungs pas thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pas so //
translated: Therefore, both are said to be non-arisen, refuting the conception of attainment.

original: de gang du 'bad pa med par thob pa ste /
analyzed: de gang du 'bad pa med par thob pa ste /
translated: It is obtained without effort.

original: kun rdzob tu ni skye ste mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams la yang 'bad pa med par 'jug pa ye shes so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni skye ste mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams la yang 'bad pa med par 'jug pa ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom that engages the stages of Immovable and so on without effort is relative.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni don dam par ni skye ba med par stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' 'jig rten zhes pas ni ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid ces pa ni gang gi gang
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni don dam par ni skye ba med par stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' 'jig rten zhes pas ni ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid ces pa ni gang gi gang
translated: Because all phenomena are ultimately unborn, they are emptiness, the nature of nonentity, the dharmadhatu, suchness, and the limit of reality.

original: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste me'i tsha ba bzhin de'i de la ngo bo nyid ces brjod la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste me'i tsha ba bzhin de'i de la ngo bo nyid ces brjod la /
translated: The nature of something is its essence, like the heat of fire.

original: gang bcos ma de ni de'i bdag nyid min te /
analyzed: gang bcos ma de ni de'i bdag nyid min te /
translated: That which is fabricated is not its nature.

original: dper na chu'i tsha ba @69b bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na chu'i tsha ba @69b bzhin te /
translated: For example, the heat of water.

original: de ltar 'dir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid yod pa min la med pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid yod pa min la med pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, here all phenomena do not have inherent existence, nor do they have the slightest nonexistence.

original: gang yang 'phags pas /
analyzed: gang yang 'phags pas /
translated: As the noble ones say:

original: stong pa nyid du mi brjod cing //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mi brjod cing //
translated: Do not speak of emptiness

original: mi stong zhes kyang 'gyur ba min //üîΩgnyis dang gnyis min zhes bya bar //üîΩbtags pas don ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang 'gyur ba min // gnyis dang gnyis min zhes bya bar // btags pas don ni brjod par bya //
translated: Nor is it said to be ‚Äúnon-empty.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is expressedüîΩby the terms ‚Äúboth‚Äù and ‚Äúneither.‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis brjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis brjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The meaning is expressed by the terms ‚Äúboth‚Äù and ‚Äúneither.‚Äù

original: bden pa'i ngo bo ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bden pa'i ngo bo ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of the truth is not fabricated,

original: gang du 'phags pas /
analyzed: gang du 'phags pas /
translated: as the noble ones have said:

original: bcos min ngo bo nyid la ni //
analyzed: bcos min ngo bo nyid la ni //
translated: In the unfabricated nature

original: gzhan la ltos pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa yod ma yin //
translated: there is no dependence on another.

original: zhes la / de yang ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes la / de yang ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is unborn,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir thob par bya ba yang med la thob pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir thob par bya ba yang med la thob pa yang med pa ste /
translated: because it is naturally luminous and because it is without beginning or end, there is nothing to attain and there is no attainment.

original: ma 'dres par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres par blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as unadulterated.

original: gang de ltar mthong ba de nyid chos rnams thams cad kyi bden pa nyid kyis sgro btags pa rnams thams cad rjes su nye bar mi dmigs pa ste de nyid yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang de ltar mthong ba de nyid chos rnams thams cad kyi bden pa nyid kyis sgro btags pa rnams thams cad rjes su nye bar mi dmigs pa ste de nyid yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de /
translated: Whoever sees in this way does not observe any superimpositions of the truth of all phenomena. That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: des phung po lnga la bden par mngon par zhen pa zad par byed cing de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rgyu can des sgrib pa thams cad kun tu 'dzin pa can gyi gnas kyi phung po lnga po rnams zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des phung po lnga la bden par mngon par zhen pa zad par byed cing de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i rgyu can des sgrib pa thams cad kun tu 'dzin pa can gyi gnas kyi phung po lnga po rnams zad par 'gyur te /
translated: That causes the extinction of manifest clinging to the five aggregates as truly existent, and through the cause of the absence of that manifest clinging, the five aggregates that are the basis for the grasping of all obscurations are extinguished.üîΩBecause the former obscurations are stopped and because the latter ones do not arise due to the absence of a cause, that extinction of obscurations is the attainment of the extinction of the five aggregates.

original: sngon gyi rlung du gyur pa rnams 'gag pa'i phyir dang / rgyu med pas de dang 'dra ba rnams kyi phyi ma rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro byang chub sems dpa' de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i kun rdzob dang don dam par ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid yin yang glo bur ba'i sgrib pa'i
analyzed: sngon gyi rlung du gyur pa rnams 'gag pa'i phyir dang / rgyu med pas de dang 'dra ba rnams kyi phyi ma rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro byang chub sems dpa' de rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i kun rdzob dang don dam par ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid yin yang glo bur ba'i sgrib pa'i
translated: Although the bodhisattva is by nature the essence of the conventional and ultimate, which are of one taste in the bodhicitta of luminous clarity, he is made to be defiled by the stains of adventitious obscurations.

original: dri ma rnams kyis dri ma can du byas pa de'i de rnams zad pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma rnams kyis dri ma can du byas pa de'i de rnams zad pa ste /
translated: The extinction of those is the attainment of the extinction of the five aggregates.

original: de zad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dag pa snga na med pa'i phyir na thob pa'o //
analyzed: de zad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dag pa snga na med pa'i phyir na thob pa'o //
translated: Because the extinction of those has the characteristic of a purity that did not exist before, it is attainment.

original: 'khrul pa thams cad log pa las kun rdzob tu skyes pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phung po lnga po stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang snga ma med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa
analyzed: 'khrul pa thams cad log pa las kun rdzob tu skyes pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phung po lnga po stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang snga ma med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpas thob pa
translated: From the reversal of all error, the five completely pure aggregates that arise conventionally, the knowledge of all aspects that has the characteristic of the exalted wisdom of emptiness is also attained by the bodhisattva, because the former does not exist.üîΩThat purity is attained and the perfect realization of the exalted wisdom of omniscience arises through that very perfect knowledge.

original: ste / de'i rnam par dag pa yang dag par rig pa de nyid kyis thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: ste / de'i rnam par dag pa yang dag par rig pa de nyid kyis thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa yang dag par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de la 'di ni glo bur gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas brtan dag tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni glo bur gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas brtan dag tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: There, this should be stated as the purification of the obscurations of the stable ones.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la gnas nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa @70a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa la gnas nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rnam par gzhag pa @70a * //
translated: The presentation of the arisen and the non-arisen is based on the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de rnams thob pa las 'di slar dri la de la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams thob pa las 'di slar dri la de la dgongs nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: From the attainment of those, this is again asked about the stains.

original: skyes pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: skyes pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúarisen‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes pa zhes pa ni skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i chos la mi spobs zhes pa ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes pa ni skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa'i chos la mi spobs zhes pa ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa de kho na nyid du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúMan‚Äù refers to a phenomenon dependent on causes and conditions for arising. ‚ÄúNot eloquent‚Äù means that, in reality, what has arisen and what has not arisen are essenceless.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rgyud gang de kho nas 'khrul pa rnams thams cad las ldog cing de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye bo zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rgyud gang de kho nas 'khrul pa rnams thams cad las ldog cing de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye bo zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the mind that observes the emptiness of all phenomena turns away from all errors and gives rise to omniscience with regard to them.

original: brjod pa'i rnam pa dang rtog pa dgag pa gsungs pa ni ma skyes pas kyang zhes pas te //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rnam pa dang rtog pa dgag pa gsungs pa ni ma skyes pas kyang zhes pas te //
translated: The statement that the aspects of expression and thought are negated is ‚ÄúAlso, the unarisen . . .‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa ni tshad mas grub par 'dod pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni tshad mas grub par 'dod pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod pa'o //
translated: The unarisen is asserted to be established by valid cognition, and so it is said.

original: de yang med ces pa ni 'bad pas 'dri ba'i brjod pa rnams dang yid dang sgras spobs shing brjod pa'i brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang med ces pa ni 'bad pas 'dri ba'i brjod pa rnams dang yid dang sgras spobs shing brjod pa'i brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat also does not exist‚Äù refers to the expression that is the object of expression, which is expressed by the mind and words that are the means of expression.

original: shin tu ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang spobs pa dang brjod pa dang bcas pa'i blo gsum po 'dir ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang spobs pa dang brjod pa dang bcas pa'i blo gsum po 'dir ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Very means free from the extremes of entity and non-entity, and the three minds with eloquence and expression are not produced here.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis de lta bu chos rnams thams cad de la snang bar byed ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis de lta bu chos rnams thams cad de la snang bar byed ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the non-conceptuality of omniscience, it is intended that all phenomena appear to him in that way.

original: de rnams bshad pas ni spros pa med pa'i don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la don dam pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams bshad pas ni spros pa med pa'i don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la don dam pa zhes brjod do //
translated: By explaining those, since it is consistent with the ultimate free from elaborations, non-production is called the ultimate.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las grol ba gzung bar byar med pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i gzung bar bya ba la spobs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las grol ba gzung bar byar med pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i gzung bar bya ba la spobs pa ste /
translated: At the time of realization, there is eloquence in the non-production of objects, due to being liberated from all concepts and being ungraspable.

original: 'dzin pa med pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i spobs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i spobs pa ste /
translated: The absence of grasping is the eloquence of grasping.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
translated: It is due to non-conceptuality.

original: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med kyang de'i ngo bo nyid la spobs pa zhes pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med kyang de'i ngo bo nyid la spobs pa zhes pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúeven though it has no reality as such, one is eloquent about its reality as such,‚Äù

original: de kho na bzhin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin zhes pa ste /
translated: it is just as it is said.

original: ji ltar mthong ba spong ba la sgrib par mi nus pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni gang dang gang zhes pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis spobs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba spong ba la sgrib par mi nus pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu ni gang dang gang zhes pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis spobs zhes pa ste /
translated: Since it is not possible to obstruct the abandonment of what is seen, whatever is pleasant when unexamined is ‚Äúeloquence‚Äù in the conventional sense.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the emancipation of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i go skabs rnams kyi byed pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'i go skabs rnams kyi byed pa ni /
translated: The function of the opportunities for the emancipation of the path

original: de skad ces smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: is stated from ‚Äúhaving said this‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dang gang zhes pa ni gang dang gang gi gnas nyid la'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes pa ni gang dang gang gi gnas nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù refers to whatever is the case.

original: 'byung ba zhes pa ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes pa ni mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArises‚Äù means is seen.

original: mi g-yo ba ni the tshom dang mi @70b shes pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni the tshom dang mi @70b shes pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnwavering‚Äù is because there is no doubt or ignorance.

original: 'gal bar mi byed pa ni phyin ci log par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'gal bar mi byed pa ni phyin ci log par mi byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúNot contradicting‚Äù is not distorting.

original: log pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no false cognition.

original: 'di rnams kyi zhes pa ni lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi zhes pa ni lam gyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: These, he says, are the emancipations of the path.

original: mi gnas pa ni mngon par zhen pa la chos ni gang de de ltar bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni mngon par zhen pa la chos ni gang de de ltar bshad pa rnams so //
translated: The non-abiding is the Dharma that is explained in that way.

original: mi g-yo zhes pa 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni gang la yang gnas pa med pa dang spros pa med pa'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams kyi nang na ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi 'da' zhes
analyzed: mi g-yo zhes pa 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa ni gang la yang gnas pa med pa dang spros pa med pa'i phyir na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams kyi nang na ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi 'da' zhes
translated: The non-wavering is the extensive explanation of this: because there is no abiding anywhere and because there is no conceptual elaboration, how is it that in these six perfections, the perfection of wisdom does not pass beyond?

original: pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is not diminished,

original: mi shes pa dang the tshom dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang the tshom dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no ignorance and no doubt.

original: 'di zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: This, he says, is what was just explained.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad nyid las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad nyid las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: This is not other than all dharmas themselves.

original: theg pa thams cad pa ni theg pa gsum gyi thun mong ba'o //üîΩde ltar ni ni gang dang ngo //
analyzed: theg pa thams cad pa ni theg pa gsum gyi thun mong ba'o // de ltar ni ni gang dang ngo //
translated: The universal vehicle is common to the three vehicles.üîΩThus is the one who is so.

original: de nyid de'i 'phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de'i 'phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the reason.

original: zhum par mi 'gyur ba ni sgyid lug pas so //
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur ba ni sgyid lug pas so //
translated: He does not become fainthearted, because of discouragement.

original: nem nur du mi 'gyur ba nyid ni the tshom gyis so //
analyzed: nem nur du mi 'gyur ba nyid ni the tshom gyis so //
translated: He does not become doubtful, because of doubt.

original: ci 'dir gzhan zhes pa ni lam gyi bar du gcod pa 'dod pas so //
analyzed: ci 'dir gzhan zhes pa ni lam gyi bar du gcod pa 'dod pas so //
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúother‚Äù here? It is the obstruction to the path.

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni de kho na nyid ma shes pa'i ngo bos bsgrub pa min pa'o //üîΩgzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni kha phyir phyogs par 'gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur ba ni de kho na nyid ma shes pa'i ngo bos bsgrub pa min pa'o // gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni kha phyir phyogs par 'gyur pa 'am /
translated: He does not become confused, because of the nature of not knowing reality.

original: log pa'i shes pas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: He does not become otherwise, because of turning away from that, or because of the characteristic of accomplishing the opposite through wrong knowledge.

original: gnas pa ni lam gyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni lam gyi ngo bos so //
translated: He remains in the path, because of the nature of the path.

original: yid la byed pa zhe pa ni rnam pa rtog pa med pa'i yid kyi lam gyi bdag nyid kyis mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs rnams la'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhe pa ni rnam pa rtog pa med pa'i yid kyi lam gyi bdag nyid kyis mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs rnams la'o //
translated: He attends to the mind, because of the aspect of the path of the nonconceptual mind, in the state of meditative equipoise.

original: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: How is it that he does not become fainthearted, and so on?

original: rtog pa pos yid la byed par 'dod pa'i 'dri ba ni yid la mi byed pa dang / gnas pa dag lhan cig mi gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa pos yid la byed par 'dod pa'i 'dri ba ni yid la mi byed pa dang / gnas pa dag lhan cig mi gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The questioner, who is conceptual and wishes to attend to the mind, does not attend to the mind, because remaining and not remaining are mutually exclusive.

original: mi 'gal na ni sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal na ni sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no contradiction, then it follows that all sentient beings abide in the perfection of wisdom.

original: legs so legs so zhes pa ni rgol ba rgya chen por byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes pa ni rgol ba rgya chen por byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excellent, excellent is because of the extensive argument.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no//
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ni lan no//
translated: Nevertheless, etc. is the answer.

original: don du gnyer bar bya bas don te /
analyzed: don du gnyer bar bya bas don te /
translated: The object of striving is the object.

original: de nyid ni bdag gis bstan pa nyid la klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag gis bstan pa nyid la klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bstan pa'o //
translated: That itself is the very teaching that is taught with the intention of finding fault.

original: yang dag pa'i gnas mngon par brjod pas zhes pa ni rnams par rtog pas yid la byas pa ni phyin ci log la kun tu gnas pa las yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid shes rab @71a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnas mngon par brjod pas zhes pa ni rnams par rtog pas yid la byas pa ni phyin ci log la kun tu gnas pa las yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid shes rab @71a * //
translated: By expressing the true state, etc. means that mental attention by conceptualization is due to abiding in error. The true reality is known by the perfection of wisdom.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa mtha' dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa mtha' dang bral ba ste /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom is free from the extremes of mental attention by conceptualization.

original: de la ni yid la byed pa nyid yid la byed par 'dod kyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni yid la byed pa nyid yid la byed par 'dod kyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
translated: There, mental attention itself is asserted as mental attention, not by conceptualization.

original: des yang dag pa'i tshig mngon par brjod par thal bar 'gyur pa las bzlog pa las bsams nas mi 'dod pa med pas rgol zhing /
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i tshig mngon par brjod par thal bar 'gyur pa las bzlog pa las bsams nas mi 'dod pa med pas rgol zhing /
translated: Having thought about the consequence that it would follow that he would express only correct words, he is opposed to that, and he is not desirous of the opposite.

original: mi 'dod par brjod pa'i klan ka la rigs pas bstan par 'dod nas rang nyid kyis slar dri ba ni de ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dod par brjod pa'i klan ka la rigs pas bstan par 'dod nas rang nyid kyis slar dri ba ni de ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: Desiring to teach with reasoning the fault of expressing what is not desired, he himself asks the question, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: de gang du yang dag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: de gang du yang dag pa'i gnas te /
translated: That is the correct basis.

original: sems can rnams ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid la ji ltar sems can rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid la ji ltar sems can rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Sentient beings have the nature of the five aggregates, and the nature of the reality of their identitylessness is emptiness.

original: de ltar de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa yang ngo //
translated: In that way, the attention that is not different from that is also identityless.

original: sems can mi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na sems can ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: sems can mi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na sems can ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Since sentient beings are not a real entity, sentient beings are identityless.

original: de kho nar skye ba la sogs pas dben pa'o //
analyzed: de kho nar skye ba la sogs pas dben pa'o //
translated: That is the reality that is devoid of arising and so on.

original: sems pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Since it is beyond thought, it is inconceivable.

original: mngon par byang ma chub ba nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid dang / log pa'i dngos po nyid dang sgra don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang ma chub ba nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid dang / log pa'i dngos po nyid dang sgra don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Non-enlightenment is not the object of right knowledge, it is not the way things really are, it is a false entity, and it is the meaning of the word.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'dis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'dis zhes pa ste /
translated: Non-enlightenment is not the object of this right knowledge.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang ma chub pa nyid de /
translated: It is not the way things really are, it is non-enlightenment.

original: tshig drug po 'di rnams ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig drug po 'di rnams ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These six terms should be applied in order to the four stages conducive to penetration and to the states of seeing and cultivation.

original: 'dis zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes pa ni ji skad du bshad pas so //
translated: By this means by what has been explained.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bos ni yang dag pa'i don so sor rtogs pa can gyis te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bos ni yang dag pa'i don so sor rtogs pa can gyis te /
translated: By such a nature means by one who has realized the meaning of reality.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i phyir 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i phyir 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is accepted means that it is accepted because it is engaged in without error.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni zhi gnas kyi ngo bo'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni zhi gnas kyi ngo bo'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: Abiding in the nature of the perfection of wisdom is by means of the path that is the nature of serenity, by means of the characteristic of definite emergence.

original: 'di ni le'u'i don rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni le'u'i don rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This is the complete meaning of the chapter.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis spyod pa spyad pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don bcu la de gsal bar byed pas le'u ste de'i le'u'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis spyod pa spyad pa ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don bcu la de gsal bar byed pas le'u ste de'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the practice of the knowledge of all aspects is the chapter that elucidates the ten topics such as the generation of the mind, and so on.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa pandi ta chen po 'jigs med @71b 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa'i gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od las le'u dang po'o /üîΩ// / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes la de khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa pandi ta chen po 'jigs med @71b 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa'i gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od las le'u dang po'o / // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes la de khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: This is the first chapter of the Candraprabha commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines composed by the great pandit Abhayakaragupta.

original: tha dad du phye ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tha dad du phye ba'i phyir lam shes pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: After the knowledge of all aspects, in order to accomplish that specifically or in order to distinguish it, the knowledge of the path should be explained.

original: gang du bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gang du bstan bcos las /
translated: In that regard, the treatise states:

original: mog mog por byed la sogs dang // slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang // 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyi //
analyzed: mog mog por byed la sogs dang // slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang // 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyi //
translated: The path of the rhinoceros-like is obscured, and so on.

original: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing is seen to have great benefit for oneself and others,üîΩin terms of the qualities of this life and the next.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,

original: byed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang dang // yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa yis //
analyzed: byed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang dang // yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa yis //
translated: dedication, rejoicing, and attention.

original: bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: The path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyi //
translated: dedication, rejoicing, and attention.

original: lam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad //
analyzed: lam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad //
translated: The path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.

original: ces te / gang du lam 'dis mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i ste /
analyzed: ces te / gang du lam 'dis mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,

original: shin tu dag pa zhes pa ni rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu dag pa zhes pa ni rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: dedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa can ni sangs rgyas kyi zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa can ni sangs rgyas kyi zhes bshad do //
translated: with the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,üîΩpraise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the practice of the path of seeing,üîΩwith the highest practice, devotion,

original: 'dir 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dag pa ni zhing la 'dir bshad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dag pa ni zhing la 'dir bshad kyi /
translated: praise, respect, admiration,üîΩdedication, rejoicing, and attention.

original: lam shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is not included in the knowledge of the path.

original: bsgom pa nyid kyi lam ni bsgom pas ji ltar na shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid kyi lam ni bsgom pas ji ltar na shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation, because it is the result of the path of cultivation that is very pure.

original: de la thog mar /
analyzed: de la thog mar /
translated: Here, first,

original: lha rnams rung par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams rung par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the gods suitable,üîΩHe obscures with light,

original: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //
translated: The determination of the object, the pervasion, the nature, and its action.

original: zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: lam shes par rung ba nyid ni sems bskyed pa la lha de rnams kyi don du mog mog por mdzad pa nyid ni dman pa dang ngan par byas pa ste /
analyzed: lam shes par rung ba nyid ni sems bskyed pa la lha de rnams kyi don du mog mog por mdzad pa nyid ni dman pa dang ngan par byas pa ste /
translated: The suitability of knowing the path is the generation of the mind. For the sake of those gods, he obscures with light. The inferior and bad actions are

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis mnan pa ni lam shes pa rnams kyi rtsa ba ni sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis mnan pa ni lam shes pa rnams kyi rtsa ba ni sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: obscured by the light of the nature of the BhagavƒÅn. The root of those who know the path is the generation of the mind.

original: de dang bral ba rnams kyis de la mi rung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dang bral ba rnams kyis de la mi rung ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because those who are separated from that are unsuitable for that.

original: de nyid kyis na 'dir rung ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'dir rung ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúsuitable here. ‚Äù

original: des na 'di nyid gtso bo la /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid gtso bo la /
translated: Therefore, this is the principal one.

original: lhag ma ni de'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de'i 'khor ro //
translated: The rest are its retinue.

original: de la mog mog por byed kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la mog mog por byed kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, the statement from the perspective of the obscuring is:

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: de'i tshe ni dus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni dus so //
translated: At that time is the occasion.

original: 'dus pa ni phyag byas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni phyag byas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The assembly is those who have made prostrations, etc.

original: 'khod pa ni nye ba na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'khod pa ni nye ba na 'dug pa'o //
translated: The arrangement is those who are nearby.

original: rig ni sde'o //üîΩrgyal po chen po ni /
analyzed: rig ni sde'o // rgyal po chen po ni /
translated: The knowledge is the class.

original: rnam thos sras la sogs pa'o //üîΩstong @72a * //
analyzed: rnam thos sras la sogs pa'o // stong @72a * //
translated: The great king is Vai≈õrava·πáa, etc.üîΩThe thousand is the thousand of the desire realm.

original: gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag nyid ni mi mjed de'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag nyid ni mi mjed de'i bdag po'o //
translated: The great billion world systems are the lord of this Endurance.

original: lnga ngo zhi gnas gtsang ma'i ris rnams la stong phrag lnga nyid do //
analyzed: lnga ngo zhi gnas gtsang ma'i ris rnams la stong phrag lnga nyid do //
translated: The five are the five thousand of the pure abodes.

original: 'dir gzugs can gyi lha'i ris ji lta ba'i gong gi khyad par can rnams kyi 'od mthu la sogs pa rnams kyi snang bas 'od zil gyis mnan ba ni sems bskyed pa'i don gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mog mog por byas nas thams cad zil gyis mnan
analyzed: 'dir gzugs can gyi lha'i ris ji lta ba'i gong gi khyad par can rnams kyi 'od mthu la sogs pa rnams kyi snang bas 'od zil gyis mnan ba ni sems bskyed pa'i don gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mog mog por byas nas thams cad zil gyis mnan
translated: Here, the light of the special ones above, such as the form gods, is outshone by the light of the BhagavƒÅn, in order to generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: zhes mkhas pa nyid kyis de'i ngo bo la dga' bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes mkhas pa nyid kyis de'i ngo bo la dga' bskyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wise one says this in order to generate delight in its nature.üîΩCoemergent means not fabricated.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni mngon par 'dus byas pa can ma yin pa'o / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ni nye bar byed pa po gang gis byas she na /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni mngon par 'dus byas pa can ma yin pa'o / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ni nye bar byed pa po gang gis byas she na /
translated: If it is asked by whom was the Buddha‚Äôs blessing made,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis te /
translated: it was made by the Buddha‚Äôs splendor.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis so //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis so // sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ste /
translated: It was made by the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs natural light.üîΩIt was made by the Buddha‚Äôs power.üîΩIt was made by the Buddha‚Äôs power.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus so sor bcom mo zhes pa ni mog mog por byed pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus so sor bcom mo zhes pa ni mog mog por byed pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: It was made by the Buddha‚Äôs power.

original: mi mjed la sogs pa rnams kyi ji ltar skye ba dang gnas pa mdor bsdus nas brjod de //
analyzed: mi mjed la sogs pa rnams kyi ji ltar skye ba dang gnas pa mdor bsdus nas brjod de //
translated: The origination and duration of the world systems are described in brief.

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis mngon par ldog cing nam mkha' rab tu gnas pa la 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu drug pa kha khyer yongs su bskor ba la grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis mngon par ldog cing nam mkha' rab tu gnas pa la 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu drug pa kha khyer yongs su bskor ba la grangs med pa'o //
translated: Here, by the power of the karma of sentient beings, the wind mandala arises in space, which is the foundation of the world systems. It is 1,600,000 yojanas in height and its circumference is incalculable.

original: de'i steng du glog me'i sprin dang bcas pa'i sprin chen po las char pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dpangs su 'dum phrag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du glog me'i sprin dang bcas pa'i sprin chen po las char pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dpangs su 'dum phrag brgyad pa'o //
translated: Above that, the water mandala arises from the great clouds of lightning and fire. It is 800,000 yojanas in height.

original: de'i steng du chu yongs su gyur pa las gser gyi dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dpangs su 'bum phrag gsum dang stong phrag nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du chu yongs su gyur pa las gser gyi dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dpangs su 'bum phrag gsum dang stong phrag nyi shu'o //
translated: Above that, the golden ground arises from the transformation of the water. It is 320,000 yojanas in height.

original: 'di gnyis kyi rgya'i tshad ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang / stong phrag gsum dang / brgya phrag phyed dang lnga ni dbus kyi rgya'i tshad do //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi rgya'i tshad ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang / stong phrag gsum dang / brgya phrag phyed dang lnga ni dbus kyi rgya'i tshad do //
translated: The diameter of this is 1,235,000 yojanas.

original: khor yug tu ni dbus kyi drang thad kyi sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khor yug tu ni dbus kyi drang thad kyi sum 'gyur ro //
translated: The outer circumference is three times the center.

original: de'i steng du ri rab grub shel bee d'u rya dang shel dang gser dang dngul te rin po che bzhi'i rang bzhin la lho la sogs pa'i logs bzhi la logs re re la tha dkar dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad cu la de'i 'khor yug tu ni zlum pos

translated: Above that, Mount Meru is established. It is made of four jewels: crystal, emerald, sapphire and gold. Each side of the four sides such as the south is 80,000 yojanas.üîΩThe outer circumference is completely surrounded by a circle.

translated: The world system is destroyed by fire up to the second concentration, by water up to the third concentration and by wind up to the fourth concentration.

analyzed: chus ji srid du gnyis pa'o //
