translated: Twenty intermediate eons elapse between the formation of the world system and the appearance of sentient beings.

original: chags pa dang gnas par 'gyur ba'i nyi shu zhes pa'i bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la ni bskal pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang gnas par 'gyur ba'i nyi shu zhes pa'i bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu la ni bskal pa chen po'o //
translated: Eighty intermediate eons elapse between the formation of the world system and the appearance of sentient beings and the appearance of the first sentient being in the empty Brahma realm.

original: de la bskal pa dang por mi rnams kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas rim gyis thung ngu nas lo bcu'i tshe'i bar ji srid de ni bar gyi bskal pa'o //üîΩde la tshe 'phel nas tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu rnams nas yang thung nas tshe lo bcu'i bar ji srid pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de la bskal pa dang por mi rnams kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas rim gyis thung ngu nas lo bcu'i tshe'i bar ji srid de ni bar gyi bskal pa'o // de la tshe 'phel nas tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu rnams nas yang thung nas tshe lo bcu'i bar ji srid pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first eon is the period during which the life expectancy of humans decreases from an immeasurable length to ten years in length.üîΩThe second eon is the period during which the life expectancy increases from ten years to eighty thousand years in length.

original: de bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa gzhan bcu bdun la ji srid du tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu de rab kyi mthar thug pa nyi shu gcig ces pa dang nyi shu'i brgyad cu po rnams kyi tshad ni mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phel ba dang 'grib pa gzhan bcu bdun la ji srid du tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu de rab kyi mthar thug pa nyi shu gcig ces pa dang nyi shu'i brgyad cu po rnams kyi tshad ni mnyam pa ste /
translated: The other seventeen eons of increase and decrease are similar to the second eon.

original: de ltar brgyad cu bskal pa bzang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar brgyad cu bskal pa bzang po'o //
translated: Thus, the eighty eons are the good eon.

original: de ltar gzhan yang bskal pa chen po phal che ba dpe skar ma lta bu'i bskal pa'i 'grib pa yang 'di nyid kyi dus kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i bar gyi bskal ba'i tshad kyi dus kyis yongs su bcad pa'i bskal pa stong phrag nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan yang bskal pa chen po phal che ba dpe skar ma lta bu'i bskal pa'i 'grib pa yang 'di nyid kyi dus kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i bar gyi bskal ba'i tshad kyi dus kyis yongs su bcad pa'i bskal pa stong phrag nyi shu'o //
translated: In the same way, the decline of the eon of example star is also twenty thousand eons, as explained in the time of this very [eon].

original: de btang nas bzang po la sogs pa'i bskal pa chen po de grangs kyi gnas gzhan drug cur gyur pa rjes su thob pa grangs med ces brjod do //
analyzed: de btang nas bzang po la sogs pa'i bskal pa chen po de grangs kyi gnas gzhan drug cur gyur pa rjes su thob pa grangs med ces brjod do //
translated: After that, the sixty other places of number of those great eons such as Bhadra are called countless.

original: de las bzlog nas grangs gzhan yang zhes pa ste grangs med gsum mo //
analyzed: de las bzlog nas grangs gzhan yang zhes pa ste grangs med gsum mo //
translated: The opposite of that is also called countless, which is three countless [eons].

original: de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las byung ba'i gang zhig thabs goms pas bsgrub par bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las byung ba'i gang zhig thabs goms pas bsgrub par bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: Thus, buddhahood is accomplished by the practice of means from the activities of giving and so forth in three countless eons.

original: de ltar yang grangs med dang pos ni sa dang po thob par 'gyur la gnyis pas ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang grangs med dang pos ni sa dang po thob par 'gyur la gnyis pas ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In that way, by the first countless [eon], one attains the first ground, and by the second, the stainless and so forth.

original: gsum pas ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o zhes mdo sde las bshad la /
analyzed: gsum pas ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o zhes mdo sde las bshad la /
translated: The third is the immoveable and so on.üîΩHere, the Bhagavat says:

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pa'i dge bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pa'i dge bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is certain to emerge through virtue for limitless millions of eons.

original: de lta bu la brtson 'grus chen pos slob par byed pa na bskal pa mang po rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu la brtson 'grus chen pos slob par byed pa na bskal pa mang po rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: When one trains with great effort in that way, many eons are reversed.

original: ji ltar bdag cag gi ston pa byang chub sems dpar gyur pas sangs rgyas nye rgyal la brten pas bskal pa dgu bcu rnam par log cing de bzhin du shin tu sbyor ba dang / thabs chen po'i khyad par gyis bskal pa bye ba mang po rnams la ji @74b srid du bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis rnam par log par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag gi ston pa byang chub sems dpar gyur pas sangs rgyas nye rgyal la brten pas bskal pa dgu bcu rnam par log cing de bzhin du shin tu sbyor ba dang / thabs chen po'i khyad par gyis bskal pa bye ba mang po rnams la ji @74b srid du bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis rnam par log par gyur pa dang /
translated: Just as our teacher, when he was a bodhisattva, reversed ninety eons by relying on the Buddha Nyagrodha, and similarly, by the special qualities of great application and great means, he reversed many millions of eons for as long as two countless eons.

original: ji srid dus gcig na yang skye ba nyung ngu rnams kyis dang / ji srid du bla na med pa'i tshul las skye ba 'di la mngon par byang chub ces gsungs pa na /üîΩde bas 'dod pa gzhan mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ji srid dus gcig na yang skye ba nyung ngu rnams kyis dang / ji srid du bla na med pa'i tshul las skye ba 'di la mngon par byang chub ces gsungs pa na / de bas 'dod pa gzhan mi 'thad do //
translated: As long as the life span is not less than eighty thousand years, there is only one Buddha in the universe.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cur song nas mar 'grib pa'i lo brgya'i bar la rdzogs sangs rgyas byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cur song nas mar 'grib pa'i lo brgya'i bar la rdzogs sangs rgyas byung bar gyur to //
translated: When the life span of humans in Jambudvƒ´pa is eighty thousand years, a perfect Buddha appears in the world.

original: dus gcig tu gling bzhi par ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu gling bzhi par ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only one TathƒÅgata appears in the universe, because the beings to be converted are ready to be converted by only one TathƒÅgata.

original: sangs rgyas mang pos gdul bar bya ba'i sems can srid pa la ni dus gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa du ma skye bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang pos gdul bar bya ba'i sems can srid pa la ni dus gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa du ma skye bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: When the beings to be converted by many Buddhas are ready to be converted, many TathƒÅgatas appear in the universe.

original: tshogs gnyis la goms pa'i rgyu'i mthus dus gcig la mtha' yas pa'i stong gsum 'jig rten pa rnams na de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshogs gnyis la goms pa'i rgyu'i mthus dus gcig la mtha' yas pa'i stong gsum 'jig rten pa rnams na de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Through the power of the cause of being habituated to the two collections, infinite tathagatas are born in infinite trichiliocosms simultaneously.

original: skyes nas kyang mya ngan las 'da' ba chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dag ni med la /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang mya ngan las 'da' ba chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dag ni med la /
translated: After being born, they attain nirvana, but there is no dharma or enjoyment body.

original: sprul pa'i sku gzugs dang dbyibs kyi khyad par la ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku gzugs dang dbyibs kyi khyad par la ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: There is only the form and shape of the emanation body.

original: ji ltar bsod rnams chung ba rnams la mi 'byung la /
analyzed: ji ltar bsod rnams chung ba rnams la mi 'byung la /
translated: Just as the moon does not appear for those with little merit,

original: de yang bsod nams bsags pa rnams kyis ni mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang bsod nams bsags pa rnams kyis ni mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: those who accumulate merit see it,

original: bdag cag legs spyad ma byas pa rnams kyis ni mi mthong ste long ba rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag cag legs spyad ma byas pa rnams kyis ni mi mthong ste long ba rnams bzhin no //
translated: but we do not see it, like the blind.

original: bdag cag gi ston pa ni 'og min du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ston pa ni 'og min du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Our teacher became fully enlightened in Akani·π£·π≠ha,

original: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis ni mi mjed kyi nang du chud pa'i gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgya rnams la rim dang cig char gyis dga' ldan du skye ba dang shi nas 'dzam bu'i gling rnams su skye ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du dgongs pa can
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis ni mi mjed kyi nang du chud pa'i gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgya rnams la rim dang cig char gyis dga' ldan du skye ba dang shi nas 'dzam bu'i gling rnams su skye ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du dgongs pa can
translated: The emanation bodies of buddhas gradually or simultaneously take birth in the Joyous Heaven and then are born in the various continents of the billion worlds of the Rose Apple Continent and so on, until they finally pass into parinirvana.üîΩ

original: gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar bstan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: The nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅyas, in the one hundred ko·π≠is of four-continent worlds contained within the Saha world system, simultaneously and gradually demonstrate birth in Tu·π£ita, death, birth in the Jambudvƒ´pa world systems, and so forth, up to the parinirvƒÅ·πáa, which isüîΩintentional.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bcom ldan 'das mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa na gang 'dir sangs rgyas la skyabs su skye bo ji ltar 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa srid pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bcom ldan 'das mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa na gang 'dir sangs rgyas la skyabs su skye bo ji ltar 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa srid pas /
translated: Since the objection is possible that, like a lamp, the Bhagavatƒ´ is in parinirvƒÅ·πáa in every way, how do beings go for refuge here in the Buddha and so forth,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa ni mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa ni mi rigs pa nyid de /
translated: the parinirvƒÅ·πáa of the hearers is not reasonable.

original: de ji ltar rgya che bar 'gyur bas nyes pa 'jug par byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgya che bar 'gyur bas nyes pa 'jug par byed /
translated: How does that lead to the fault of being extensive?

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lam shes pa la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lam shes pa la'o //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, in the knowledge of the path,

original: nye bar bstan pa ni gdams ngag go //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni gdams ngag go //
translated: The teaching is the instruction.

original: de'i don de nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i don de nyid la'o //
translated: The meaning of that is reality.

original: gnas par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i @75a * //üîΩshes rab kyis so //üîΩbslab par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung bas so //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i @75a * // shes rab kyis so // bslab par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung bas so //
translated: One should abide in it by means of the wisdom arisen from listening.üîΩOne should train in it by means of the wisdom arisen from reflection.

original: rnal 'byor du bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
translated: One should practice it by means of the wisdom arisen from meditation.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni mthu'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni mthu'i rnam grangs te /
translated: Empowerment and so on are synonyms for power.

original: de la mthu shes pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthu shes pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, knowing the power is the teaching.

original: cig shos dag gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos dag gis bshad pa'o //
translated: The others are the explanation.

original: gzi brjid kyis ni spobs par nus pa bskyed pa'i mthus so //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyis ni spobs par nus pa bskyed pa'i mthus so //
translated: By splendor, one generates the power that is able to give rise to eloquence.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rab tu rtogs pas so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rab tu rtogs pas so //
translated: By empowerment, one has full realization.

original: de bzhin du sbyor bar nus pa rnams kyi gnas skabs su byas nas de gsungs pa ni gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor bar nus pa rnams kyi gnas skabs su byas nas de gsungs pa ni gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, having made the situation of those who are able to apply themselves, he says ‚Äúthat‚Äù and so on.

original: des bskyed par bya zhes pas ni sbyor bar nus pas so //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya zhes pas ni sbyor bar nus pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is generated by that‚Äù is by one who is able to apply himself.

original: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni lam dman pas thob par bya ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag pa nyid du nges pa de des thob pas so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni lam dman pas thob par bya ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag pa nyid du nges pa de des thob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those‚Äù and so on. The nirvana that is to be attained by the inferior path is ascertained as reality by that.

original: mtshams bcad pa ni mtshams bcad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa ni mtshams bcad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe boundary is cut off‚Äù means the boundary is cut off.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gang yang nas yang du de la bor ba'i skal ba med de /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gang yang nas yang du de la bor ba'i skal ba med de /
translated: The stream-enterers and so on do not have the fortune to abandon that again and again as a cause for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ji srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis ma brlabs kyi bar du zhes pa ni sbyor bar nus pa'i yul so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis ma brlabs kyi bar du zhes pa ni sbyor bar nus pa'i yul so sor nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs long as they are not blessed by the buddhas‚Äù is the definite object that is able to apply.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ni khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ni khyab pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù and so on is the pervasion.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ni bag la nyal chad nas skye ba med pa skye ba phan tshun gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid du byed ces pa ni mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ni bag la nyal chad nas skye ba med pa skye ba phan tshun gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid du byed ces pa ni mi 'thad ce na /
translated: It is not tenable that the ≈õrƒÅvakas, having cut off the latent afflictions, produce the buddhahood that is mutually established by the nonarising of arising.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pas so so'i skye bo dang thun mong gi 'khor ba rgyun chad kyang ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa de'i rkyen dang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu de bsod nams kyi tshogs chol bas chog shes
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pas so so'i skye bo dang thun mong gi 'khor ba rgyun chad kyang ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa de'i rkyen dang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu de bsod nams kyi tshogs chol bas chog shes
translated: Although the continuum of samsara shared with ordinary beings is interrupted through the elimination of afflictions, the latent tendencies of the affliction of ignorance are not eliminated.

original: pa med pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pas du pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa med pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pas du pa med pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The condition of that and the cause of uncontaminated virtue are the accumulation of merit and the lack of satisfaction.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin gyi ma rig pa'i bag chags dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin du zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin gyi ma rig pa'i bag chags dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin du zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed la /
translated: The latent tendencies of ignorance are like the affliction of affliction, and uncontaminated karma is like the affliction of karma.

original: skye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang dbang du gyur pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba drug tu 'dus pa de yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis 'jug la /
analyzed: skye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang dbang du gyur pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba drug tu 'dus pa de yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis 'jug la /
translated: Like the affliction of birth, the six kinds of beings of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained control enter with a mental body.

original: de'i rkyen gyis yang skye bo'i rkyen bzhin du rgas pa dang shi ba la ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsgyur ba can gyi 'chi 'pho ba zhes dpal phreng seng ge'i nga @75b ro'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis yang skye bo'i rkyen bzhin du rgas pa dang shi ba la ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsgyur ba can gyi 'chi 'pho ba zhes dpal phreng seng ge'i nga @75b ro'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the glorious Lion‚Äôs Roar of Queen ≈örƒ´mƒÅlƒÅ S≈´tra says that aging and death are inconceivable transformations, like the conditions for a person‚Äôs birth.

original: de nyid kyis na theg pa gsum du gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na theg pa gsum du gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can te /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of three vehicles is provisional.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid 'dis 'gro zhes pa dang / der 'gro zhes pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i theg pa ni gcig nyid la theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni byis pa rnams theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i drang ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid 'dis 'gro zhes pa dang / der 'gro zhes pa'i lam dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i theg pa ni gcig nyid la theg pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni byis pa rnams theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i drang ba'i don du ste /
translated: Thus, this perfection of wisdom, which is the essence of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, is the path that goes and the essence of the result that is gone to. The vehicle is a single vehicle, but it is presented as three vehicles in order to guide the childish to enter the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: de ltar yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Thus the Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ says:

original: bdag gis theg gcig bshad pa las //
analyzed: bdag gis theg gcig bshad pa las //
translated: From my teaching of a single vehicle,

original: theg pa'i rnam gzhag yod min te //
analyzed: theg pa'i rnam gzhag yod min te //
translated: The presentation of vehicles does not exist.

original: byis rnams yongs su drang don du //
analyzed: byis rnams yongs su drang don du //
translated: For the sake of guiding the childish,

original: theg pa tha dad bdag gis bshad //
analyzed: theg pa tha dad bdag gis bshad //
translated: I have explained the different vehicles.

original: ces pa dang / 'phags pas kyang /
analyzed: ces pa dang / 'phags pas kyang /
translated: And the noble ones also say:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med pas //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med pas //
translated: Since there is no division in the dharmadhƒÅtu,

original: theg pa tha dad yod ma yin //
analyzed: theg pa tha dad yod ma yin //
translated: There are no different vehicles.

original: theg pa gsum ni kun bshad pa //
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni kun bshad pa //
translated: The three vehicles are all explained

original: khyod kyis sems can gzhug pa nyid //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can gzhug pa nyid //
translated: In order to guide sentient beings.

original: ces so // chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: ces so // chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu is the single suchness of all phenomena.

original: de nyid grub pa'i mtha'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid na ni mthar thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid grub pa'i mtha'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid na ni mthar thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it were different due to the divisions of philosophical tenets, it would follow that it would be endless.

original: phyogs gcig pa'i ye shes rnams kyis ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa'i ye shes rnams kyis ni de kho na nyid rtogs pa med de /
translated: The wisdoms of one part do not realize suchness,

original: rtogs na ni ches thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs na ni ches thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if they did, it would be even more absurd.

original: de'i phyir ni gang zag chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes de nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa las yang dag pa'i chos las gzhan gyis ni min zhes pas na theg pa ni gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni gang zag chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes de nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa las yang dag pa'i chos las gzhan gyis ni min zhes pas na theg pa ni gcig nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since it is said that nirvƒÅ·πáa is attained by the wisdom that directly perceives the suchness of the person, the selflessness of phenomena, and not by anything else, the vehicle is only one.

original: de'i phyir na lam gzhan la yang dag pa'i thar pa med ces pa bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na lam gzhan la yang dag pa'i thar pa med ces pa bsgrub pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the proof that there is no true liberation in other paths is as follows.

original: bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
translated: The S≈´tra on Entering the Two Truths says:

original: de la yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bsgoms pas gang gis nyon mongs pa spong gi / lam gzhan gyis min te /
analyzed: de la yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bsgoms pas gang gis nyon mongs pa spong gi / lam gzhan gyis min te /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, by meditating on the absence of essence of all phenomena, afflictions are abandoned, but not by other paths.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the afflictions are rooted in the misapprehension of things.‚ÄùüîΩAnd it is also said:

original: gang du yang gsungs pa 'jam dpal ji ltar nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gro bar 'gyur smras pa /
analyzed: gang du yang gsungs pa 'jam dpal ji ltar nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gro bar 'gyur smras pa /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how are the afflictions to be subdued by understanding the afflictions?‚Äù

original: don dam par ma skyes pa'i chos rnams kyi yod pa ma yin pa'i yul rnams la yod par sgro btags pas phyin ci log gi bdag nyid kyi lta ba kun tu ldang la /
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes pa'i chos rnams kyi yod pa ma yin pa'i yul rnams la yod par sgro btags pas phyin ci log gi bdag nyid kyi lta ba kun tu ldang la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe view of self, which is the opposite of the truth, arises from superimposing existence on nonexistent objects, namely, phenomena that are ultimately unarisen.

original: de las nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de las nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu 'jug go //
translated: From that, the afflictions arise.‚Äù

original: gang yang lha'i bu don dam par chos rnams @76a * //
analyzed: gang yang lha'i bu don dam par chos rnams @76a * //
translated: Moreover, a god son

original: ma skyes pa rab tu shes shing shes rab kyi sbyor ba mi byed pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rab tu shes shing shes rab kyi sbyor ba mi byed pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: who knows that ultimately phenomena are unborn but does not apply wisdom is free from erroneous conception.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed cing lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed cing lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not superimpose what does not exist and does not arouse views.

original: skye ba med pa de nyid la gnas pas nyon mongs pa shin tu 'dul ba nyid du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa de nyid la gnas pas nyon mongs pa shin tu 'dul ba nyid du blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should see that very nonarising as the complete subjugation of the afflictions,

original: mthong ba med pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: because of the application of nonseeing.

original: gang du don dam par skye ba med pa'i ngo bor rab tu shes nas kyang rab tu shes pa la sbyor ba med pas ni de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu shes pa med pa'i sbyor bas yongs su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du don dam par skye ba med pa'i ngo bor rab tu shes nas kyang rab tu shes pa la sbyor ba med pas ni de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu shes pa med pa'i sbyor bas yongs su shes pa yin te /
translated: When one knows that ultimately the nature of phenomena is unborn but does not apply wisdom to that knowledge, in that way one completely knows the afflictions because of the application of nonknowledge.

original: 'di lta ste dper na mche ba dug can gyi rigs brjod pas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na mche ba dug can gyi rigs brjod pas dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, by stating the family of a poisonous snake, the poison is neutralized.

original: de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa'i rigs shes pa ni de'i nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang nyon mongs pa'i rigs shes pa ni de'i nyon mongs pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, whoever knows the family of the afflictions will completely pacify those afflictions by the yoga of non-observation.

original: gang du yang lha'i bu don dam par shin tu skye ba med pa'i dngos po rnams kyis chos rnams thams cad la kun tu brtags pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang du yang lha'i bu don dam par shin tu skye ba med pa'i dngos po rnams kyis chos rnams thams cad la kun tu brtags pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs zhes gsungs so //
translated: And, ‚ÄúDivine son, this imputation of utterly non-arisen things as ultimate is called the family of the afflictions.‚Äù

original: mdo ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal por yang /
analyzed: mdo ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal por yang /
translated: The King of SamƒÅdhi S≈´tra says:

original: 'gro ba 'di rnams thams cad sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di rnams thams cad sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: All these beings will become buddhas.

original: zhes te / 'dir yang dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba'i phyir na sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas ma lus pa'i 'gro ba rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te /
analyzed: zhes te / 'dir yang dri ma rnams ni glo bur ba'i phyir na sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas ma lus pa'i 'gro ba rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te /
translated: Here, too, because the stains are adventitious, the naturally luminous mind is the essence of the tathƒÅgata, which has the character of the dharmadhƒÅtu, of all beings without exception.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du sbyor bar rung bar yod pa nyid do zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du sbyor bar rung bar yod pa nyid do zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is possible to connect with the perfect complete Buddhahood.üîΩHere, the teaching of three vehicles is provisional, and the teaching of one vehicle is definitive.

original: 'dir theg pa gsum bstan pa ni nges pa'i don la theg pa gcig bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid ces pa dang / rigs med pa'i sems can yang yod ces pa'i brtags pa ni shin tu ma brtags pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa gsum bstan pa ni nges pa'i don la theg pa gcig bstan pa ni dgongs pa can nyid ces pa dang / rigs med pa'i sems can yang yod ces pa'i brtags pa ni shin tu ma brtags pa'i ste /
translated: The investigation of whether there are sentient beings without potential is very uncritical.

original: spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya'o //
translated: It should be rejected.

original: sems can rdzogs sangs rgyas la sbyor mi rung ba ni gcig kyang med ces pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rdzogs sangs rgyas la sbyor mi rung ba ni gcig kyang med ces pas gnas pa ste /
translated: There is not a single sentient being who is not suitable to be connected with perfect Buddhahood.

original: de ltar yang dbang po thams bden pa bsgoms pas ni bdag med par mnyam pos 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dbang po thams bden pa bsgoms pas ni bdag med par mnyam pos 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by meditating on the truth of suffering, one will go to freedom from attachment.

original: 'bring gis ni cung zhig gzhan gyi don 'dod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba rtogs kyang 'dod pa'i khams rnams su dam pa'i chos nub pa na kun tu 'jug cing shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa @76b spangs nas rang sangs rgyas mngon
analyzed: 'bring gis ni cung zhig gzhan gyi don 'dod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba rtogs kyang 'dod pa'i khams rnams su dam pa'i chos nub pa na kun tu 'jug cing shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa @76b spangs nas rang sangs rgyas mngon
translated: When the sublime teaching has disappeared in the desire realm, they enter into the desire realm and, having abandoned the one aspect of the cognitive obscuration that is the conception of the apprehended, they manifest as pratyekabuddhas.

original: sum du byas nas rdzu 'phrul rnams dang lus kyis chos rnams ston par byed do //
analyzed: sum du byas nas rdzu 'phrul rnams dang lus kyis chos rnams ston par byed do //
translated: Having manifested as pratyekabuddhas, they teach the dharma with their magical powers and with their bodies.

original: dbang po rab kyis ni brtse ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sems can thams cad 'dren pa'i bsam pa can te /üîΩgsum char yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam las grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang mar me zad pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes can gyi zag pa med pa'i khams na padma'i snying po la bskul ba'am ji srid
analyzed: dbang po rab kyis ni brtse ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sems can thams cad 'dren pa'i bsam pa can te / gsum char yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam las grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa med kyang mar me zad pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes can gyi zag pa med pa'i khams na padma'i snying po la bskul ba'am ji srid
translated: Those of the highest acumen, due to their very nature of compassion, have the intention to lead all sentient beings.üîΩAll three of these types of pratyekabuddhas are liberated from the afflictive obscurations of the three realms, but they do not have the nirvana that is the complete exhaustion of the cognitive obscurations.

original: du gnas pa la /
analyzed: du gnas pa la /
translated: They have the idea that they have attained nirvana, like a butter lamp going out, and they remain in the uncontaminated element, in the center of a lotus, for as long as samsara lasts.

original: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis rab tu sad par byas nas sems bskyed par byas nas skye ba la dbang ba dang / stobs ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' bzhin gyi skye ba rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bskal pa grangs med pa bzhis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rtogs par 'gyur zhes
analyzed: de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis rab tu sad par byas nas sems bskyed par byas nas skye ba la dbang ba dang / stobs ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' bzhin gyi skye ba rnams kyis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bskal pa grangs med pa bzhis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rtogs par 'gyur zhes
translated: Having been awakened by the light rays of the Tathagata, having generated the Thought, having attained power over birth, and having attained power over the elements, the Bodhisattva who is like the lord of the unshakable and so on, by means of his births, perfects the accumulations of merit and knowledge, and thus realizes perfect Buddhahood in four incalculable aeons.

original: pa ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni khyab pa'o //
translated: This is the pervasion.

original: smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature is stated by ‚Äúvirtuous‚Äù and so on.

original: dge ba'i phyogs ni dge ba'i tshogs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs ni dge ba'i tshogs te /
translated: The virtuous side is the accumulation of virtue,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad sems bskyed pa 'dis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes pas dge ba'i phyogs nyid de sbyor bar rung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad sems bskyed pa 'dis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes pas dge ba'i phyogs nyid de sbyor bar rung ba nyid kyi rang bzhin la'o //
translated: because all virtuous dharmas are included in this generation of the Thought. Thus, the virtuous side is the nature of being suitable for application.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyis kun tu bsdus pa de rnams kyis te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyis kun tu bsdus pa de rnams kyis te /
translated: The phrase in particular refers to those who are completely imbued with the spirit of enlightenment.

original: rgyu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth cause.

original: chos khyad par du 'phags pa ni theg pa chen pos kun tu bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos khyad par du 'phags pa ni theg pa chen pos kun tu bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is superior because it is completely imbued with the universal vehicle.

original: 'bras bu gyur pa la lhag par dmigs par bya zhes te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gyur pa la lhag par dmigs par bya zhes te /
translated: One should focus on the transformation of the result.

original: thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'o //
translated: That is, one should attain it.

original: de'i phyir na bar chad mi bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bar chad mi bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the phrase do not create obstacles means that one should not create obstacles to the attainment of the result.

original: sgra'i don zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i las so //
analyzed: sgra'i don zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems de'i las so //
translated: The phrase the meaning of the word refers to the activity of that spirit of enlightenment.

original: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rgyud lam shes pa nyid la spro ba bskyed pa la 'dir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rgyud lam shes pa nyid la spro ba bskyed pa la 'dir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to generate the spirit of enlightenment in that way, the text states here, Therefore, the bodhisattvas, the great spiritual heroes, generate enthusiasm for the knowledge of the path in their own mindstreams.

original: de na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase in that case and so on.

original: khyod legs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod legs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase you are excellent means that you are engaged in the welfare of others.

original: ji ltar sngon gyi rgyal ba'i sras la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon gyi rgyal ba'i sras la /
translated: Just as the former sons of the victors, the bodhisattvas, generated the spirit of enlightenment, so should you generate it.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / de'i nyan thos rnams kyis mang du byas pa de ltar bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das dang de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mang du bya'o zhes pa ni bka' drin gzo ba'i @77a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / de'i nyan thos rnams kyis mang du byas pa de ltar bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das dang de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mang du bya'o zhes pa ni bka' drin gzo ba'i @77a * //
translated: This is the meaning of the gratitude.

original: don to // sngon gyi nyid ni sngon gyi rnams so //
analyzed: don to // sngon gyi nyid ni sngon gyi rnams so //
translated: The former ones are the former.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la de la phan par spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la de la phan par spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Brahma is nirvana, and the practice of benefitting it is pure conduct.

original: gang dag ces pa ni rnam par phye ba'i nang du phyin ci log pa can du ma ltung ba'i ji lta ba'i don no //
analyzed: gang dag ces pa ni rnam par phye ba'i nang du phyin ci log pa can du ma ltung ba'i ji lta ba'i don no //
translated: Those who are not fallen into error among those who are distinguished are the ones who have the meaning of reality.

original: ma rtogs zhes pa'i gzhung yang kha cig gis gdams zhes pa ni bstan pa'i sgra zhes pa dang / skad kyi dbyings don du ma la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su gzung bar bya ba ni gdams par bya bas rjes su bskor bar bya ba ni rjes su bstan par bya zhes pa'i phyi ma'i tshig gnyis pa yang dag pa'i sgra ni don yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs zhes pa'i gzhung yang kha cig gis gdams zhes pa ni bstan pa'i sgra zhes pa dang / skad kyi dbyings don du ma la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su gzung bar bya ba ni gdams par bya bas rjes su bskor bar bya ba ni rjes su bstan par bya zhes pa'i phyi ma'i tshig gnyis pa yang dag pa'i sgra ni don yang dag pa'o //
translated: The term right is for the right meaning.

original: bdag cag nyan thos rnams kyis kyang ni rang dang ris mthun pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyi tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag nyan thos rnams kyis kyang ni rang dang ris mthun pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyi tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we ≈õrƒÅvakas also make the convention self with regard to those of our own type.

original: legs pa ni g-yo ba med pas nyan pa la'o //
analyzed: legs pa ni g-yo ba med pas nyan pa la'o //
translated: The term well is for listening without wavering.

original: rab tu ni g-yeng ba'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: rab tu ni g-yeng ba'i yid kyis so //
translated: The term thoroughly is for those with distracted minds.

original: phyin ci ma log pa la bstan par bsgrub pa'i don du yid la bgyid pa bsam pa dang bsgom pa dag gis so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa la bstan par bsgrub pa'i don du yid la bgyid pa bsam pa dang bsgom pa dag gis so //
translated: The term unerringly is for those who practice with the intention and meditation that are established in the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni lam shes pa la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni lam shes pa la'o //
translated: The term perfection of wisdom is for the knowledge of the path.

original: gnas par bya ba ni spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba ni spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: That which is to be abided in is that which is to be practiced.

original: de la nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to that, the following is stated from the perspective of the ≈õrƒÅvaka path of seeing:üîΩEmptiness, signlessness,

original: stong pa nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and wishlessness.

original: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid las /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid las /
translated: With regard to the ƒÅryas, these are reality and non-erroneousness.

original: byis pa rnams la ni ma yin zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ni ma yin zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: With regard to the childish, they are the ƒÅrya truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: They are suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: nad kyis sdug bsngal ba la de'i nges par zad pa'i sman tshol ba bzhin gyi rim pa ste /
analyzed: nad kyis sdug bsngal ba la de'i nges par zad pa'i sman tshol ba bzhin gyi rim pa ste /
translated: The order is like that of seeking the medicine for the definite cessation of the suffering of a disease.

original: gnyi ga la yang bdag med par bstan pa'i skabs su sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gog pa'i bden pa don dam pa la /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang bdag med par bstan pa'i skabs su sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gog pa'i bden pa don dam pa la /
translated: In the context of teaching both of them that there is no self, the truth of cessation, which is characterized by the abandonment of the two obscurations, is the ultimate.üîΩThe other three are the conventional truth.

original: gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa'i gnyis po nyid ni bden pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa'i gnyis po nyid ni bden pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two truths.

original: ji skad du yab sras mjal ba'i mdo sder /
analyzed: ji skad du yab sras mjal ba'i mdo sder /
translated: As the Meeting of Father and Son S≈´tra says:

original: rnam par blta dka' bden pa 'dir ni mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: rnam par blta dka' bden pa 'dir ni mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: This truth is difficult to see, for the wise

original: rang gis mthong 'gyur gzhan gyis mnyen sogs rnams kyis min //üîΩkun rdzob dang ni gang yang de bzhin don dam las //
analyzed: rang gis mthong 'gyur gzhan gyis mnyen sogs rnams kyis min // kun rdzob dang ni gang yang de bzhin don dam las //
translated: do not see it by themselves, nor by the words of others, nor by some other means.üîΩNeither the conventional nor the ultimate

original: bden pa gsum po cung zad yod par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: bden pa gsum po cung zad yod par 'gyur ba min //
translated: is even slightly a third truth.

original: zhes te / nyan thos rnams las ni 'khor ba las yid byung ba'i don du gang zag gi bdag med tsam la gzhug pa'i @77b rnam pa bzhi po bstan to //
analyzed: zhes te / nyan thos rnams las ni 'khor ba las yid byung ba'i don du gang zag gi bdag med tsam la gzhug pa'i @77b rnam pa bzhi po bstan to //
translated: For the disciples, the four noble truths were taught in order to turn them away from cyclic existence, and they were taught in terms of the individual no self.

original: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba'i 'khor ba pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba'i 'khor ba pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therein, the aggregates of cyclic existence are suffering, because they are suffering due to the suffering of pain, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the composite. The cause of suffering is the origin.

original: sdug bsngal zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering is cessation.

original: de thob pa'i ye shes ni lam ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i ye shes ni lam ste /
translated: The wisdom that attains that is the path.

original: gang 'di rnams kyi rnam pa de rnams stong pa nyid la gnas shing stong pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams kyi rnam pa de rnams stong pa nyid la gnas shing stong pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: The aspects of these are the emptiness of emptiness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni nyan thos kyi gang zhig mthong ba'i lam la gnas par bya ba la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni nyan thos kyi gang zhig mthong ba'i lam la gnas par bya ba la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis te /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, the ≈õrƒÅvaka who is situated on the path of seeing is by means of the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: stong pa nyid du mthong ba dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mthong ba dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is by means of the vision of emptiness and the non-apprehension of the aspects of the four noble truths.

original: de ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos las /
translated: This is stated in the treatise:

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul las ni //üîΩ'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul las ni // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //
translated: From the perspective of the path of knowledge,üîΩthe ≈õrƒÅvaka should know this pathüîΩthrough the non-apprehension of the aspects

original: rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //üîΩnyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
translated: of the four noble truths.

original: zhes te / nyan thos kyi sde snod la rnam pa bcu drug tu bshad de /
analyzed: zhes te / nyan thos kyi sde snod la rnam pa bcu drug tu bshad de /
translated: In the ≈õrƒÅvaka pi·π≠aka, it is explained in sixteen aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rtag pa dang gzhan dang bdag gir sgro btags pa las ldog pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa dang stong pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang gzhan dang bdag gir sgro btags pa las ldog pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa dang stong pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of suffering as impermanent, suffering, and selfless, and as empty, turning away from the superimpositions of permanence, other, and mine.

original: kun 'byung ba la chos rnam pa thams cad rgyu med pa can dang dus la sogs pa'i sems med pa'i rtog pa'i rgyu can dang gtso bo dang sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i dngos po'i rgyu can dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can zhes pa'i sgro btags pa'i gnyen por rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la chos rnam pa thams cad rgyu med pa can dang dus la sogs pa'i sems med pa'i rtog pa'i rgyu can dang gtso bo dang sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i dngos po'i rgyu can dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can zhes pa'i sgro btags pa'i gnyen por rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen no //
translated: The antidote to the superimposition that the origin of suffering is causeless, caused by the mind of time and so on, caused by the transformation of things by prakriti, purusha, and so on, and caused by the intelligent Ishvara and so on is the truth of origin, which is cause, origin, strong generation, and condition.

original: 'gog pa med cing thar pa dang sdug bsngal ba las thar pa med do ;
analyzed: 'gog pa med cing thar pa dang sdug bsngal ba las thar pa med do ;
translated: There is no cessation and no liberation or freedom from suffering.

original: / bsam gtan gyi bde ba kho na las gya nom pa med pa ste /
analyzed: / bsam gtan gyi bde ba kho na las gya nom pa med pa ste /
translated: There is nothing more sublime than the bliss of the dhyanas.

original: grol kyang yang 'khor ba na lhung zhes pa'i gnyen por 'gog pa zhi ba gya nom pa nges par 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: grol kyang yang 'khor ba na lhung zhes pa'i gnyen por 'gog pa zhi ba gya nom pa nges par 'byin pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the idea that even if one is liberated, one will fall back into samsara is the truth of cessation, which is peace, sublime, and definite release.

original: lam med de /
analyzed: lam med de /
translated: There is no path.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam bdag nyid kyis rtag par yod pa'i lam ngan pa las 'dir gzhan du med pa dang las yang dag par ldog pas so zhes pa'i gnyen por lam rigs pa bsgrub pa nges par 'byung ba ste 'dir de gzung bar mi bya
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam bdag nyid kyis rtag par yod pa'i lam ngan pa las 'dir gzhan du med pa dang las yang dag par ldog pas so zhes pa'i gnyen por lam rigs pa bsgrub pa nges par 'byung ba ste 'dir de gzung bar mi bya
translated: The path is established by reasoning as the means of definite emergence, but it should not be grasped here.

original: la / gang du yum chen mo las gsungs pa de 'dir gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: la / gang du yum chen mo las gsungs pa de 'dir gzung bar bya ste /
translated: What is stated in the Great Mother should be grasped here.

original: re bar 'gyur na nyan thos kyi byang chub kyang tshegs chung ngu de rnams kyis thob pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: re bar 'gyur na nyan thos kyi byang chub kyang tshegs chung ngu de rnams kyis thob pa'i phyir ro//
translated: If one hopes for that, they will attain the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas with little difficulty.

original: @78a * // de la sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhi rnams kyis yid la byed pa de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: @78a * // de la sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhi rnams kyis yid la byed pa de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: With regard to that, the mental contemplation of the four aspects of suffering is as before.

original: mi rtag pa las byung ba 'jig pa dang bral bar sbyor ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal ba la so sor mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dang / zhi pa la bdag gis stong pa'i phyir te /üîΩbdag gis stong pa ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las byung ba 'jig pa dang bral bar sbyor ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal ba la so sor mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dang / zhi pa la bdag gis stong pa'i phyir te / bdag gis stong pa ni zhi ba ste /
translated: because it is applied to what is impermanent as being free from destruction, because it is applied to what is suffering as being free from the characteristics of the self, and because it is applied to what is empty as being free from the characteristics of the self, and because it is applied to what is insubstantial as being free from the characteristics of the self.üîΩIt is applied to what is insubstantial as being free from the characteristics of the self, because it is applied to what is peaceful as being empty of the self.

original: ro bzhin no //
analyzed: ro bzhin no //
translated: It is applied to what is peaceful as being empty of the self, because it is applied to what is insubstantial as being free from the characteristics of the self, like a corpse.

original: kun tu 'byung ba la ni dbye ba bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba la ni dbye ba bcu gcig ste /
translated: There are eleven varieties of origination.üîΩHere, the four varieties of origination are: origination as a cause, origination as a condition, origination as a basis, and origination as a result.üîΩThe four varieties of origination as a cause are: origination as a cause of the body, origination as a cause of the world, origination as a cause of suffering, and origination as a cause of the self.üîΩThe four varieties of origination as a condition are: origination as a condition of the body, origination as a condition of the world, origination as a condition of suffering, and origination as a condition of the self.üîΩThe four varieties of origination as a basis are: origination as a basis of the body, origination as a basis of the world, origination as a basis of suffering, and origination as a basis of the self.

original: de la rnam pa bzhis spangs pas dgra bcom pa shes pa'i phyir nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu dang sdig pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gzengs bstod pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / 'dren par dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'di'i dang gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyis na sdig pa dang chos mthun pa'o //üîΩyang bzhi rnams kyis ni nus pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhis spangs pas dgra bcom pa shes pa'i phyir nad dang 'bras dang zug rngu dang sdig pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gzengs bstod pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / 'dren par dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'di'i dang gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyis na sdig pa dang chos mthun pa'o //üîΩyang bzhi rnams kyis ni nus pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: The four varieties of origination as a result are: origination as a result of the body, origination as a result of the world, origination as a result of suffering, and origination as a result of the self.

original: pha rol dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i chos dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i chos dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'joms pa ste /
translated: the other shore, the nature of complete destruction, the moving, and the complete destruction.

original: bdag ni bcom par mi nus pas 'dir pha rol la so sor skad cig la 'jig pa'i phyir na rab tu 'jig pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bdag ni bcom par mi nus pas 'dir pha rol la so sor skad cig la 'jig pa'i phyir na rab tu 'jig pa'i chos so //
translated: The other shore is the other side of the river of samsara. It is the nature of complete destruction because it is destroyed moment by moment.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi drungs 'byin pa'i phyir g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi drungs 'byin pa'i phyir g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is the moving because it is uprooted by the arhats.

original: rang bzhin gyi lam gyis rab tu bcom pa'i phyir rab tu 'joms pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi lam gyis rab tu bcom pa'i phyir rab tu 'joms pa nyid do //
translated: It is the complete destruction because it is completely destroyed by the path of the nature.

original: gdung bar mi byed pa'i don du yang gsum rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gdung bar mi byed pa'i don du yang gsum rnams kyis te /
translated: For the purpose of not being tormented, there are three:

original: 'jig pa nyid dang / nye bar 'tshe ba nyid dang / nye bar bsgyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid dang / nye bar 'tshe ba nyid dang / nye bar bsgyur ba nyid de /
translated: destruction, harm, and transformation.

original: kun tu 'dus pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / 'byung po dang srin po la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa dang / mu ge dang phas kyis dgra bo la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'dus pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir dang / 'byung po dang srin po la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa dang / mu ge dang phas kyis dgra bo la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it is the cause of fear, like being bound and so on, and because it is similar to spirits, rakshasas, and so on, and because it is similar to famine, enemies, and so on.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mi mthun pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa de nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mi mthun pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa de nas brtsams te /
translated: The reverse process of dependent origination is the cessation of formations due to the cessation of ignorance and so on.

original: ji srid du de bzhin nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du de bzhin nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The reverse process of dependent origination is the cessation of the aggregates of suffering in suchness, beginning with the cessation of ignorance and ending with the cessation of old age and death.

original: de la bkag pas 'gag ces pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la /
analyzed: de la bkag pas 'gag ces pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la /
translated: The truth of cessation is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthrough the cessation of that, this ceases.‚Äù

original: 'dis 'gag pa 'gyur zhes pa ni 'gog pa'i lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'gag pa 'gyur zhes pa ni 'gog pa'i lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthrough the practice of this, that is stopped.‚Äù

original: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni rnam pa bdun gyis te /
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i bden pa la ni rnam pa bdun gyis te /
translated: The truth of cessation is understood in seven ways:

original: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa @78b med pa nyid dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa @78b med pa nyid dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid do //
translated: as the absence of self, as peace, as isolation, as emptiness, as signlessness, as wishlessness, and as the absence of any occasioning karma.

original: bdag ni rnal 'byor pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi phung po rnams la 'dir sdug bsngal med pas bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rnal 'byor pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi phung po rnams la 'dir sdug bsngal med pas bdag med pa'o //
translated: The absence of self is the absence of suffering in the aggregates of suffering for the yogi.

original: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because the afflictions are completely pacified.

original: sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i mi gtsang ba dag nye bar zhi bas dben pa ste zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i mi gtsang ba dag nye bar zhi bas dben pa ste zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is void because the impurities of suffering and the afflictions are completely pacified.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bas stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bas stong pa'o //
translated: It is emptiness because it is free from ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas pa'i mtshan ma thams cad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i mtshan ma thams cad med pa'o //
translated: It is signlessness because all signs of the conditioned are absent.

original: de'i khams gsum pa la smon pa'i smon pa zad pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khams gsum pa la smon pa'i smon pa zad pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: It is wishless because the wish for the three realms is exhausted.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa med pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa med pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conditioning because it does not create the karma that will lead to rebirth.

original: lam gyi bden pa la yang rnam pa bdun po 'di rnams nyid kyis te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la yang rnam pa bdun po 'di rnams nyid kyis te /
translated: The truth of the path also has these seven aspects.

original: 'gog pa'i thob pa po ni lam des na bdag med pa dang zhi ba dang dben pa la sogs pa'i thob par byed pa po'i phyir na lam yang bdag med pa dang zhi ba dang dben pa dang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa
analyzed: 'gog pa'i thob pa po ni lam des na bdag med pa dang zhi ba dang dben pa la sogs pa'i thob par byed pa po'i phyir na lam yang bdag med pa dang zhi ba dang dben pa dang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa
translated: The path is also without self, peaceful, void, empty, signless, wishless, and non-conditioning because it is the means by which one attains the absence of self, peace, voidness, and so forth.

original: med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ste /
translated: and non-existence and non-performance.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa dgus ni 'dir nyan thos kyi lam myur bar de'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa dgus ni 'dir nyan thos kyi lam myur bar de'i byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, the Sravaka path is swift, because of the attainment of his enlightenment.

original: de yang rnam pa 'di rnams mi dmigs pa ni lam shes pa nyid la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa 'di rnams mi dmigs pa ni lam shes pa nyid la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: And that is the non-apprehension of these aspects, which is the entrance into the knowledge of the path.

original: gang gis dman pa'i lam bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa dman pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar nus te /
analyzed: gang gis dman pa'i lam bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa dman pa'i byang chub tu 'gro bar nus te /
translated: By which the Bodhisattva who cultivates the inferior path, being unskilled in means, is able to go to the inferior enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir rgyu des na 'di lam shes pa la go cha chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa chen po bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir go bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu des na 'di lam shes pa la go cha chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa chen po bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir go bgo bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, by the knowledge of the path, he should don the great armor and be skilled in great means, in order to protect himself.

original: de la 'di'i go cha chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'di'i go cha chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: There, his great armor is as follows:

original: phung po lnga po rnams dang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid de las tha mi dad ces pa'i stong pa nyid dang / snying rje ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga po rnams dang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid de las tha mi dad ces pa'i stong pa nyid dang / snying rje ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: The cultivation of the thought of enlightenment, which is the emptiness of the five aggregates, which is not different from emptiness, and which is of one taste with compassion.

original: 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: This is the path of seeing of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The factors conducive to penetration are taught:

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not stand in form, etc.‚Äù

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa ni drod do //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gnas pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa ni drod do //
translated: Therein, the absence of standing in form, etc., and the absence of manifest clinging is heat.

original: de ltar gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not stand in form, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la 'dir des rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pas ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la 'dir des rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pas ni rtse mo'o //
translated: The absence of apprehension of form, etc., by that [heat] due to the non-apprehension of their intrinsic identity is the peak.

original: gzugs rtag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rtag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not stand in form as permanent, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gnyis su mi dmigs @79a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gnyis su mi dmigs @79a * //
translated: The non-apprehension of form, etc. as a duality

original: pas ni bzod pa'o stong pa'o zhes dmigs pas nye bar dmigs par byed pa dang / de ltar dmigs pa ni de'i phyir stong pa nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba gnyis dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par la gnas pa med pas na chos mchog ste ;üîΩ'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩ'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //üîΩgzugs sogs phung po stong pa'i phyir //

original: zhes te / lam shes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i lam gyi rgyu mtshan la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams kyang stong pa nyid pas stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams tha mi dad de /
analyzed: zhes te / lam shes pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i lam gyi rgyu mtshan la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de rnams kyang stong pa nyid pas stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams tha mi dad de /
translated: Emptiness and form, etc., are not different.üîΩThe application of impermanence, etc., to those forms, etc., is the negation of the observation of the reality of those forms, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa de rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa sbyor ba rnams kyis de la gnas pa nye bar dmigs pa bkag pas sa dang po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i yum chen mor nye bar mi dmigs pa rgyaüîΩchen pos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa de rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa sbyor ba rnams kyis de la gnas pa nye bar dmigs pa bkag pas sa dang po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i yum chen mor nye bar mi dmigs pa rgya chen pos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Mother, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, teaches extensively that one should not observe the first stage, etc.

original: ji ltar bstan zhe na chos rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan zhe na chos rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: How is it taught? By ‚Äúbecause phenomena are not seen,‚Äù etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams la mi gnas pa gsungs pas sa bcu rnams la mi gnas pa nye bar mtshon pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams la mi gnas pa gsungs pas sa bcu rnams la mi gnas pa nye bar mtshon pas so //
translated: Here in this Transcendent Wisdom, it is said that one should not abide in the distinctions of the fruit of stream enterer, etc.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes pa ste /üîΩgang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus par gyur pas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang po rnam par 'gyur ba'i yongs su gcod pa po la 'dra ba tsam gyi bde ba la sogs pa
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes pa ste / gang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus par gyur pas bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang po rnam par 'gyur ba'i yongs su gcod pa po la 'dra ba tsam gyi bde ba la sogs pa
translated: Contact of the eye, etc.üîΩWhen the sense faculty, object, and consciousness come together, contact arises, which is concordant with the generation of feeling such as pleasure, and it is the agent that determines the transformation of the sense faculty.

original: dang bcas pa'i tshor ba skyed pa po'i sems las byung ba reg bya'i dbang po las byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba reg par byed par 'gyur zhes pa nyid de /
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i tshor ba skyed pa po'i sems las byung ba reg bya'i dbang po las byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang 'dra ba reg par byed par 'gyur zhes pa nyid de /
translated: Contact is similar to the transformation of the sense faculty that generates feeling such as pleasure.

original: 'di dbang po'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dbang po'i dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of contact isüîΩfrom contact of the eye up to contact of the mind.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas ji srid du yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar de dang / sdug pa ni @79b gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas ji srid du yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar de dang / sdug pa ni @79b gtsang ba'o //
translated: The pleasant is the pure.

original: mi sdug pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: The unpleasant is the impure.üîΩThe neutral is the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas pas dbang du phyed pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / ma rig pa zad pa'i 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pas dbang du phyed pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / ma rig pa zad pa'i 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The neutral is the conditioned because it is not dominated by affliction and ignorance.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams te de nyid la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams te de nyid la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten la'o //
translated: This world is the desire realm, and it is the world that possesses desire.

original: 'di nyid ni skye ba 'di nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni skye ba 'di nyid la'o //
translated: This very life is the present life.

original: so so'i skye ba'i sa ni mos par spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye ba'i sa ni mos par spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: The stage of ordinary beings is the stage of devoted interest.

original: phung po lhag ma med ces pa ni phung po ni phung po lnga la de nyid kyi gang du lhag ma de ni 'di phung po lhag ma la nyon mongs pa 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid can mya ngan las 'das pa la gang du de yang 'gag pas 'gyur
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med ces pa ni phung po ni phung po lnga la de nyid kyi gang du lhag ma de ni 'di phung po lhag ma la nyon mongs pa 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid can mya ngan las 'das pa la gang du de yang 'gag pas 'gyur
translated: The state without residual aggregates is nirvana, which is characterized by the cessation of the aggregates and the cessation of the afflictions.

original: ba de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ba de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: The state without residual aggregates is the state in which even that ceases.

original: de yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la shes bya'i sgrib pa yod kyang gnyis po dag gi mar mi bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes nyid kyis rnam par bzhag la /
analyzed: de yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la shes bya'i sgrib pa yod kyang gnyis po dag gi mar mi bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'du shes nyid kyis rnam par bzhag la /
translated: Moreover, even though sravakas and pratyekabuddhas have the obstacle to the knowable, they are described as having attained nirvana because they have eliminated the two obstacles of the passions and the ones that are the basis for the passions.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya'i sgrib pa lnga spangs shing 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid rnams ni rnam pa thams cad du shes bya'i sgrib pa lnga spangs shing 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The bodies of the emanations of the perfect Buddhas are totally free from the five obscurations of the knowable and are in a state of cessation, nirvana.

original: 'dir gnyis pa bshad pa ni gzhan du na gdul bya'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //üîΩchos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo rnams ni sgrib pa gnyis po'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga 'gags nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob kyi phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can phung
analyzed: 'dir gnyis pa bshad pa ni gzhan du na gdul bya'i ngo bo'i phyir ro // chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo rnams ni sgrib pa gnyis po'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga 'gags nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob kyi phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can phung
translated: Here, the second is explained, because of the nature of the disciples.

original: po lhag ma med pa nyid du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: po lhag ma med pa nyid du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The bodies of the Dharma and the Enjoyment of the Dharma are in a state of cessation of the five aggregates of the two obscurations together with their propensities, and they are in a state of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, which are the nature of the five aggregates of the relative, which are of one taste with the utterly pure emptiness.

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ste rab tu mi gnas pas so //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa ste rab tu mi gnas pas so //
translated: Here, all conceptual thoughts are in that way in nirvana, in a state of non-abiding.

original: 'dzin zhes pas dbyings te /
analyzed: 'dzin zhes pas dbyings te /
translated: By ‚Äúgrasping,‚Äù the dhƒÅtu is meant.

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i rgyu te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i rgyu te /
translated: It is the cause of benefiting others.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa las gzhan du 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa las gzhan du 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist apart from the remaining aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi ni gzungs pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ni gzungs pa ni //
translated: The retention of that is

original: sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ste /
