analyzed: 'khor ba kun tu rtags pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa des na /
translated: Since he does not abide in either cyclic existence or nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: go rims bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad zad nas /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad zad nas /
translated: in order, all afflicted phenomena are exhausted,

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po rnams kyi nam mkha' ji srid par 'gro ba'i don byed pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga po rnams kyi nam mkha' ji srid par 'gro ba'i don byed pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and he abides in the world to benefit beings for as long as space exists through the five uncontaminated aggregates.

original: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni thob pa dang nyams pa la'o //
analyzed: de las bzhengs pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni thob pa dang nyams pa la'o //
translated: He does not arise from that means that he does not attain or regress.

original: gnas pa ma yin la mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa ni yid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / @80a * //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin la mi gnas pa yang ma yin pa ni yid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / @80a * //
translated: He does not abide and he does not not abide because he does not abide in the mind and

original: langs pa min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs pa min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he does not arise.

original: mi mthun par gnas pa ma yin zhing mi mthun pa med par yang gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ni rab tu rgyu ba'i sbyor bar sngon bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par gnas pa ma yin zhing mi mthun pa med par yang gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ni rab tu rgyu ba'i sbyor bar sngon bzhin du'o //
translated: Because they do not abide in a way that is incompatible, and also do not abide in a way that is not incompatible, they are applied in the practice of movement, as before.

original: yul med pa la dgag pa mi srid pas gnyi ga la mi mthun par mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul med pa la dgag pa mi srid pas gnyi ga la mi mthun par mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it is impossible to negate the absence of an object, they do not abide in a way that is incompatible with both.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o zhes pa ni chos kyi mchog go /
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o zhes pa ni chos kyi mchog go /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ji ltar na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di rnams nyan thos thams kyi ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di rnams nyan thos thams kyi ni /
translated: How are these factors conducive to penetration of all ≈õrƒÅvakas

original: de la 'dir 'phags pa'i lam la ched du byed pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir 'phags pa'i lam la ched du byed pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is because they are intent on the ƒÅrya path.

original: bse ru'i lam bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bse ru'i lam bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With the desire to teach the path of the rhinoceros-like, it is said:

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: gang yang kha cig gis gang nyan thos kyi lam yang rab 'byor gyis ston par byed pa la 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
analyzed: gang yang kha cig gis gang nyan thos kyi lam yang rab 'byor gyis ston par byed pa la 'di ni shin tu zab ste /
translated: Some say that what is taught by Subh≈´ti as the ≈õrƒÅvaka path is very profound.

original: ji ltar gnod sbyin rnams dang zhes pa ni nges brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnod sbyin rnams dang zhes pa ni nges brjod pa'o //
translated: As for what is said about the yak·π£as, etc., this is a definite expression.

original: ji ltar gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa ni des smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa ni des smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is spoken by that, like the language of the yak·π£as.

original: de skad ces pa ni bstan pa la /
analyzed: de skad ces pa ni bstan pa la /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: sgra ni dag go //
analyzed: sgra ni dag go //
translated: Sound is the voice.

original: tshig ni ngag gi tshogs rnams so/ smras pa ni /üîΩtshig gi ngag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshig ni ngag gi tshogs rnams so/ smras pa ni / tshig gi ngag rnams kyis so //
translated: Words are the collections of speech.üîΩSpoken is by the speech of words.

original: rab tu brjod pa ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so //üîΩ'chad pa ni gdams pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu brjod pa ni ngag gi tshogs rnams kyis so // 'chad pa ni gdams pa'o //
translated: Uttered is by the collections of speech.üîΩExplained is the instruction.

original: brjod pa ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: Expressed is the subsequent teaching.

original: 'di yang go skabs thob pa'i phyir slo la gnas pa'i bse ru'i ye shes kyis mchog tu brtags par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang go skabs thob pa'i phyir slo la gnas pa'i bse ru'i ye shes kyis mchog tu brtags par byas pa'o //
translated: This is also the rhinoceros-like one who dwells in solitude, who is considered supreme by the wisdom that has obtained the opportunity.

original: shes par mi rung ba ni gzhan las te /
analyzed: shes par mi rung ba ni gzhan las te /
translated: It is not suitable to be known from others.

original: tshig gnyis kyis kun tu brtags pa'i phyir 'dir de rnams las gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa'i don med do //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis kun tu brtags pa'i phyir 'dir de rnams las gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa'i don med do //
translated: Because of the two words, it is imagined here. Therefore, there is no other meaning to be shown from those.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here means the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: chos gang yang smos par ma byas par ni bstan par ro //
analyzed: chos gang yang smos par ma byas par ni bstan par ro //
translated: Without mentioning any phenomena, it is taught.

original: thos ba med pa ni rna bas te /
analyzed: thos ba med pa ni rna bas te /
translated: The ear is the absence of hearing,

original: chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: dper na sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sprul pa'i 'khor rnams la chos rton par byed pa'i ston pa po bstan pa dang / 'khor srid pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sprul pa'i 'khor rnams la chos rton par byed pa'i ston pa po bstan pa dang / 'khor srid pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like the teacher who causes the emanated Buddha to teach the doctrine to the emanated retinue.

original: gsal ba ni zab mo'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni zab mo'o //
translated: The clear is the profound.

original: gzengs bstod pa ni gnyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzengs bstod pa ni gnyis brjod pa'o //
translated: The encouragement is the repetition.

original: 'phags pa min pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa min pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis ni ring ba'o //
translated: It is far because it is not the domain of the noble ones.

original: spros pa med pa'i phyir phra ba'o /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i phyir phra ba'o /
translated: It is subtle because it is free from mental fabrication.

original: gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir na zab ba'o //
analyzed: gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir na zab ba'o //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult to fathom.

original: nyan thos kyi ma las ches ring ba dang / ches phra ba dang / ches zab pa'i ye shes la rab tu @80b 'jug pa'i sems pas so /üîΩston par byed cing ni gzhung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ma las ches ring ba dang / ches phra ba dang / ches zab pa'i ye shes la rab tu @80b 'jug pa'i sems pas so / ston par byed cing ni gzhung ngo //
translated: It is the wisdom that is far, subtle, and profound, which engages the minds of the hearers.üîΩIt is taught in the text.

original: 'chad pa ni don no //üîΩde lta bas na 'dir med ces pa la sogs pas ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'chad pa ni don no // de lta bas na 'dir med ces pa la sogs pas ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is explained in the meaning.

original: ye shes zab pa ston to //
analyzed: ye shes zab pa ston to //
translated: Therefore, here, the phrase ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù and so on teaches the profundity of wisdom because it is difficult to fathom.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /

analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //

analyzed: gang du bstan bcos las //

analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams sam /
translated: that is, for the sake of the factors conducive to penetration,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la'o //
translated: or for the noble path.

original: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe venerable one‚Äù and so on.

original: bzod pa 'di lam bsten par //
analyzed: bzod pa 'di lam bsten par //
translated: ‚ÄúThis patience is the path to be relied upon‚Äù

analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu ni 'dir med ces pa la sogs pa bshad de /

analyzed: gzung ba med pa'i shes pas thob bya thos pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by the cognition of non-apprehension, there is no object to be attained, no hearing.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes pa ni mdor bsdus nas gsum ka'i 'bras bu yang bzod pa 'di lam brten par zhes pa dang 'brel bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te zhes pa ni mdor bsdus nas gsum ka'i 'bras bu yang bzod pa 'di lam brten par zhes pa dang 'brel bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd so on‚Äù means that in brief, the result of all three is to be connected with ‚Äúthis patience is the path to be relied upon.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: 'dir yang nyan thos rnams kyis kyang rang gi shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang blang bar bya ba la shin tu myur bar bse ru rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba zhes pa la dgongs pa ni de ltar bse ru rnams kyis bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nyan thos rnams kyis kyang rang gi shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang blang bar bya ba la shin tu myur bar bse ru rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba zhes pa la dgongs pa ni de ltar bse ru rnams kyis bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa'o //
translated: Here, the intention is that the rhinoceros-like ones should realize that the knowledge of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the knowledge of the tathƒÅgatas are to be taken up very quickly, and that the conceptualization of the rhinoceros-like ones should be abandoned.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i mthus so sor rnang bar byad pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rdzu 'phrul sprul nas bstan pa dang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i mthus so sor rnang bar byad pa'i sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang rdzu 'phrul sprul nas bstan pa dang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like the magical person and the magical emanation taught through the power of mantra and so forth.

original: sgyu ma dang gnyis su med ces pa ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid kho na sgyu ma nyid du sems pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang gnyis su med ces pa ni kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid kho na sgyu ma nyid du sems pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-different from illusion‚Äù means thinking that the nature of the conventional is just illusion.

original: rab 'byor gyis kun rdzob kyi khyad par dang / sgyu ma dang rmi lam de dag 'dra bas kun rdzob nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis kun rdzob kyi khyad par dang / sgyu ma dang rmi lam de dag 'dra bas kun rdzob nyid kho na'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, because of the difference in the conventional and the similarity of illusion and dream, it is just the conventional.

original: de'i phyir na sgyu ma dang sems can dang @81a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sgyu ma dang sems can dang @81a * //
translated: Therefore, illusion and sentient beings

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams kyang med de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams kyang med de /

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: don dam par ni yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir la /
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no distinction of existence and non-existence.

original: rigs pas ni sems can la sogs pa yang sgyu ma dang / bdag nyid gcig pa nyid do zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas ni sems can la sogs pa yang sgyu ma dang / bdag nyid gcig pa nyid do zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that by reason of the identity of the self with the magical creation, the sentient beings, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gzugs kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gzugs kyi sku ste /
translated: The perfect Buddha is the form body.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid chos kyi sku ni mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku zhes khas blangs nas brjod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid chos kyi sku ni mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku zhes khas blangs nas brjod kyi /
translated: The Dharma body, which is the nature of the realization of perfect enlightenment, is the body of the nature of the nirvana that is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las khyad par du gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference from nirvana.

original: so sor 'dod par byed ces pa ni yid ches par byed pa la de rnams med pa ni yid ches pa po ste /
analyzed: so sor 'dod par byed ces pa ni yid ches par byed pa la de rnams med pa ni yid ches pa po ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should believe‚Äù means that one should have confidence in the non-existence of those.

original: sems can rnams don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings do not exist in the ultimate sense.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni rang gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par rtogs pa'i rang rgyal gyi byang chub la'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni rang gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par rtogs pa'i rang rgyal gyi byang chub la'o //
translated: The irreversible one is the pratyekabuddha who has realized his own enlightenment.

original: de la mngon par rang gi byang chub la ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par rang gi byang chub la ste /
translated: In that, he is intent on his own enlightenment.

original: 'dir rang gi byang chub po //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi byang chub po //
translated: Here, he is intent on his own enlightenment.

original: 'dod pas ni byang chub sems dpa' la lus kyi sems can gyi don byed pa la mos pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas ni byang chub sems dpa' la lus kyi sems can gyi don byed pa la mos pas sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The one who is intent on the welfare of sentient beings is the bodhisattva, the great being, who is intent on the welfare of sentient beings through his body.

original: lta ba phun sum tshogs pas ni shes rab 'bring pos so //
analyzed: lta ba phun sum tshogs pas ni shes rab 'bring pos so //
translated: The one who is endowed with the view is the one of middling wisdom.

original: dgra bcom pas ni rang gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir na mchod 'os so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ni rang gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir na mchod 'os so //
translated: The one who is worthy of offerings is the arhat, because he has abandoned the obscurations of the path of seeing.

original: smras pa ste snang bar ma byas pas ni bstan pas so //
analyzed: smras pa ste snang bar ma byas pas ni bstan pas so //
translated: The one who is not visible is the one who is not visible through his teaching.

original: yongs su gsal ba ni gsal bar ro //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba ni gsal bar ro //
translated: The one who is fully evident is the one who is evident through his teaching.

original: brtags pa ni nyan pa po dang ston pa po rnams kyis tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni nyan pa po dang ston pa po rnams kyis tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is imagined is the one who is imagined by the listeners and teachers through their conventions.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du don dam par med pa la sems can kun rdzob tu ni nang gi bdag nyid can kho na'i phung po la sogs pa la sems can du btags pa 'ba' zhig la /üîΩdes sems can du btags pa la brten nas phung po la sogs pa la 'dzin pa po'i 'di rnams yod ces pa de bse ru rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du don dam par med pa la sems can kun rdzob tu ni nang gi bdag nyid can kho na'i phung po la sogs pa la sems can du btags pa 'ba' zhig la / des sems can du btags pa la brten nas phung po la sogs pa la 'dzin pa po'i 'di rnams yod ces pa de bse ru rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in every way, in the ultimate, there is no sentient being, but conventionally, only in the aggregates, etc. which have the nature of the internal, is a sentient being imputed.üîΩThat is the conception of the rhinoceros-like, which is not abandoned.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni bse ru rnams kyi rigs gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni bse ru rnams kyi rigs gsungs te /
translated: Then, the rhinoceros-like are said to be of three types, beginning with ‚ÄúThen, Subh≈´ti, the Lord said to the Bodhisattva, the MahƒÅsattva, the Superior, the rhinoceros-like one.‚Äù

original: 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs ni chos kyi dbye ba ste bse ru'i lam la'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi rnam grangs ni chos kyi dbye ba ste bse ru'i lam la'o //
translated: Here, the enumeration of dharmas is the division of dharmas, in the path of the rhinoceros-like.

original: yang gi sgra tshig gi rgyan la /
analyzed: yang gi sgra tshig gi rgyan la /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is an ornament of speech.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa po la mchod pas chos la mchod pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa po la mchod pas chos la mchod pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti‚Äù is because the one who teaches the Dharma is worshipped, and because the Dharma is worshipped.

original: brgya byin la zhes pa ni brgya byin la ste /
analyzed: brgya byin la zhes pa ni brgya byin la ste /
translated: ‚Äú≈öatakratu‚Äù is ≈öatakratu.

original: 'chad par gyur pa 'di rnams su rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: 'chad par gyur pa 'di rnams su rnam par rtog ste /
translated: These are the explanations.

original: me tog ces pa ni dri ma med pa nyid kyis @81b me tog dang chos mthun pa ste bse ru'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: me tog ces pa ni dri ma med pa nyid kyis @81b me tog dang chos mthun pa ste bse ru'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúflower‚Äù is similar to a flower by way of being stainless, and is a root of virtue included in the rhinoceros-like path.

original: lha rnams su ma mthong ba ni zag pa med pa nyid kyis khams las byung ba nyid ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams su ma mthong ba ni zag pa med pa nyid kyis khams las byung ba nyid ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot seen among the gods‚Äù is intended to mean ‚Äúarisen from the realm‚Äù by way of being uncontaminated.

original: mngon par gtor ba ni 'khor la sprul pa'i me tog rnams gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gtor ba ni 'khor la sprul pa'i me tog rnams gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúScattered‚Äù means that the emanated flowers were made manifest to the retinue.

original: yid las byung zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: yid las byung zhes pa ni nye bar bsdus pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMentally produced‚Äù is a summary term.

original: yid kyi sprul pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi sprul pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means ‚Äúemanated by the mind.‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa ni yid las byung ba yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni yid las byung ba yang dag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúUnborn‚Äù is the correct mental production.

original: don dam par skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji ltar yang gzung bya shing la sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang gzung bya shing la sogs pa rnams la /
translated: Just as the objects to be apprehended, such as trees,

analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes pa ni de rnams las skyes pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúdo not exist,‚Äù they are not produced from those.

original: de ltar yid la yang ste /
analyzed: de ltar yid la yang ste /
translated: In the same way, ‚Äúin the mind‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa po la yang skyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po la yang skyes pa yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: the apprehender is not produced.

original: gang yang skyes pa de ni ma yin zhes pa ni bse ru'i lam gyi rten du gyur pa ma yin zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang skyes pa de ni ma yin zhes pa ni bse ru'i lam gyi rten du gyur pa ma yin zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not born as anything‚Äù is that it is not the support of the rhinoceros-like path.

original: de ltar gzhan du khyad par med par skyes pas skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du khyad par med par skyes pas skyes pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is born as anything, because it is born without any other distinction.

original: rigs mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is of a similar type means it is of a similar type.

original: 'dis bse rus gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rigs mthun pa'i chos kyi dbyings ni de ltar bse ru'i lam gyi rten gyi rigs la /
analyzed: 'dis bse rus gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas rigs mthun pa'i chos kyi dbyings ni de ltar bse ru'i lam gyi rten gyi rigs la /
translated: This passage rejects the conception that the rhinoceros-like path is the object apprehended by the rhinoceros-like one. The dharmadhatu of a similar type is the support of the rhinoceros-like path.

original: nyan thos kyi chos kyi dbyings las skyes pas rigs mthun pa'i bse ru'i lam gyi rten ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos kyi dbyings las skyes pas rigs mthun pa'i bse ru'i lam gyi rten ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the support of the rhinoceros-like path that is born from the dharmadhatu of the sravaka.üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
translated: The different types of supported phenomena

original: de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod // ces pa ste /
translated: are fully expressed as its different types.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, the treatise states:üîΩBecause the conception of an object is impaired,

original: gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
translated: because the conception of a subject is not abandoned,

original: rten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: rten gyi bse ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: the support of the rhinoceros-like path

original: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //
analyzed: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //
translated: is correctly subsumed.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThe two paths of the ≈õrƒÅvaka as explained and this one are the path of the pratyekabuddha, due to the difference in the basis of abandonment.üîΩThe stage of heat is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyan thos kyi lam dang 'di gnyis ni spong ba'i rten gyi khyad par dag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyan thos kyi lam dang 'di gnyis ni spong ba'i rten gyi khyad par dag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The stage of peak is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the highest worldly realization.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩde nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩming gi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni / de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste / ming gi tshogs rnams so //
translated: The stage of poised readiness is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the support of penetration.üîΩThe stage of the supreme mundane state is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the result of penetration.üîΩThe stage of heat is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to penetrative insight.üîΩThe stage of peak is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the highest worldly realization.

original: btags pa ni tha snyad de /üîΩde ltar yang gzugs la sogs pa ni btags pa tsam nyid la /
analyzed: btags pa ni tha snyad de / de ltar yang gzugs la sogs pa ni btags pa tsam nyid la /
translated: The stage of poised readiness is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the support of penetration.üîΩThe stage of the supreme mundane state is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the result of penetration.

original: btags pa tsam gyi chos nyid du 'dir nye bar ston par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni drod do //
analyzed: btags pa tsam gyi chos nyid du 'dir nye bar ston par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni drod do //
translated: The stage of heat is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to penetrative insight.üîΩThe stage of peak is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the highest worldly realization.

original: gang zhig tshad med pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar slob par mi 'gyur te dmigs pa med pas zhes pa ni rtse mo'o //üîΩgang zhig gzugs 'phel zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig tshad med pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar slob par mi 'gyur te dmigs pa med pas zhes pa ni rtse mo'o // gang zhig gzugs 'phel zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The stage of poised readiness is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the support of penetration.
The stage of the supreme mundane state is taught in order to explain the factors conducive to the result of penetration.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la yongs su gzung ba med par rigs pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las nang stong pa nyid la zhes pa nas ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du nye bar gzung ste zhes pa ni
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la yongs su gzung ba med par rigs pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las nang stong pa nyid la zhes pa nas ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du nye bar gzung ste zhes pa ni
translated: The reasoning of not apprehending form and so on is from the Great Mother, the Transcendent Conqueror, ‚Äúin inner emptiness‚Äù up to ‚Äúin the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.‚ÄùüîΩThat is acceptance.

original: bzod pa'o // de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: bzod pa'o // de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi mchog go //
translated: Then, from ‚ÄúThen again, the venerable one‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on is the supreme mundane quality.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni blo la gnas pa gsal bas mchog tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni blo la gnas pa gsal bas mchog tu brtags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù is the supreme investigation by the clarity of abiding in the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las gang zhig gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yum chen mo las gang zhig gsungs te /
translated: What is taught in the Great Mother, the Transcendent Conqueror?

original: de ltar yang gzugs skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /üîΩ'gag par yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzugs skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / 'gag par yang ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not see the origin of form.üîΩOne does not see cessation.

original: yongs su gzung bar yang ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar yang ma yin /
translated: One does not see apprehending.

original: nub par yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nub par yang ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: One does not see disappearance.‚Äù

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, in the treatise, it says:

original: btags pa dang ni mi 'gal bas //
analyzed: btags pa dang ni mi 'gal bas //
translated: Not contradicting imputation,

original: chos nyid ston pas dror gyur pa //
analyzed: chos nyid ston pas dror gyur pa //
translated: the teacher of dharmatƒÅ is the heat.

original: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: The peak is form and so on.

original: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //üîΩnang stong nyid la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye // nang stong nyid la sogs pa yi //
translated: The distinctions are made by the absence of decrease, etc.üîΩThe acceptance of the doctrine of form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa //üîΩgzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyis //
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi 'dzin phyir bzod pa // gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyis //
translated: is the acceptance of the non-apprehension of the internal emptiness, etc.üîΩThe supreme mundane qualities are the aspects of the non-production, etc.

original: rnam pa rnams kyi chos kyi mchog / ces te /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams kyi chos kyi mchog / ces te /
translated: of form, etc.

original: rtse mor son pa dang rtse mor son par gyur pa dang / rtse mor rtog pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs zhes pa'i don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rtse mor son pa dang rtse mor son par gyur pa dang / rtse mor rtog pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs zhes pa'i don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The summit is the same as the summit attained, the summit thought, and the summit stage.

original: de bzhin du ji srid du chos mchog bde bar ro zhes gsungs pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid du chos mchog bde bar ro zhes gsungs pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //
translated: The path of insight is the four moments of the knowledge of the doctrine, which is the path of insight.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa ni /üîΩbstan bcos las /üîΩbden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa ni / bstan bcos las / bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
translated: The path of cultivation is the four moments of subsequent knowledge, which is the path of cultivation.üîΩThe path of no-more-learning is the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-production.üîΩThe path of insight is the four moments of the knowledge of the doctrine, which is the path of insight.

original: lam shes nyid las mthong ba'i lam //üîΩphan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //
analyzed: lam shes nyid las mthong ba'i lam // phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //
translated: The path of cultivation is the four moments of subsequent knowledge, which is the path of cultivation.

original: zhes te / bden pa re re la bzod pa gnyis dang shes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes te / bden pa re re la bzod pa gnyis dang shes pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-production.

original: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i lam gang gis nyon mongs pa rab tu spong la /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i lam gang gis nyon mongs pa rab tu spong la /
translated: Here the Abhidharma Synthesis explains that the uninterrupted meditative stabilization of the path of preparation up to the supreme mundane qualities completely abandons afflictions,

original: de'i rjes la dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthong ba'i lam mo zhes theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus par bshad la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthong ba'i lam mo zhes theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa kun las btus par bshad la /
translated: and that the subsequent meditative stabilization without objective reference is the path of seeing.

original: rnam par grol ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo las sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i @82b bzod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can gyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo las sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i @82b bzod pa dang /
translated: The nature of the forbearance of the doctrine of nonproduction, which is the nature of the paths of liberation and of absence of obstacles, is the forbearance of the doctrine with regard to suffering, the doctrine that knows suffering, the forbearance of the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering,

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: and the subsequent knowledge of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la ste /
translated: Similarly, there are those with regard to the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: da ltar byung ba'i de ltar phung po lnga ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi kun 'byung gi dbang gis 'khor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal lo//
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i de ltar phung po lnga ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi kun 'byung gi dbang gis 'khor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal lo//
translated: The five aggregates of the present are suffering because they are the result of the five aggregates of affliction in the past, since they arise due to the power of origination.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa dang ldan pas phyi ma'i sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa dang ldan pas phyi ma'i sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates of affliction that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are origination because they are the cause of future suffering.

original: 'dun pa'i sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: From the generation of the mind of aspirationüîΩup to the path of cultivation,

original: lam bsgoms pas de kho na nyid rtogs par gyur nas sngon du mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ste ;
analyzed: lam bsgoms pas de kho na nyid rtogs par gyur nas sngon du mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ste ;
translated: one realizes reality, and the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: de yang kun 'byung dang des byas pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di 'gag par 'gyur zhes pa la 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de yang kun 'byung dang des byas pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di 'gag par 'gyur zhes pa la 'gog pa'o //
translated: are cessation because they cease, and the suffering that is produced by origination also ceases.üîΩThat very reality of suffering that is produced by the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of cultivation

original: de nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bya'i nyon mongs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi de kho na nyid du yod pa nyid la /
analyzed: de nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bya'i nyon mongs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi de kho na nyid du yod pa nyid la /
translated: exists as the reality of the path.

original: phyis rtogs pa rdzogs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pas sgom par byed pa'i phyir na lam la /
analyzed: phyis rtogs pa rdzogs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pas sgom par byed pa'i phyir na lam la /
translated: Since later on, the realization is complete, it is the path of meditation because it meditates on the single taste that is one with emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi ni sgom pa po rnam par shes pa gtso bo bas na lam zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ni sgom pa po rnam par shes pa gtso bo bas na lam zhes brjod la /
translated: Since the meditator is the primary consciousness of that, it is called the path.

original: de ltar de'i bden pa bzhi po'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni thams cad du de kho na nyid du de ltar cha shas med pas dus gcig nyid kyis yongs su chad par 'gyur la
analyzed: de ltar de'i bden pa bzhi po'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni thams cad du de kho na nyid du de ltar cha shas med pas dus gcig nyid kyis yongs su chad par 'gyur la
translated: Thus, the nature of the four truths, which is the nature of dependent origination, is the aspect of emptiness. Since it is always like that without parts, it is the single time that is completely severed.

original: / 'dzin stongs kyi khyad par de bzhin du gsal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa mtha' dag mngon sum du byed de gang du rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ni ma 'dres la /
analyzed: / 'dzin stongs kyi khyad par de bzhin du gsal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa mtha' dag mngon sum du byed de gang du rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ni ma 'dres la /
translated: Since the difference between the empty apprehender and the empty apprehended is clearly seen, all aspects are actualized. Since it is not mixed with different types of conceptuality,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang cig car mi srid pa'i phyir na rim gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang cig car mi srid pa'i phyir na rim gyis 'gyur te /
translated: since it is impossible for the various types of conceptuality that are desired to occur simultaneously, it is sequential.

original: dper na sngon po bskyod pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par la skye bos autpala mthong la de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa skad cig la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa rnams su myong bas mngon sum du byed pa la rnam par rtog pa ni
analyzed: dper na sngon po bskyod pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par la skye bos autpala mthong la de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa skad cig la gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa rnams su myong bas mngon sum du byed pa la rnam par rtog pa ni
translated: For example, people see an utpala flower that has the features of being blue and moving, and in the same way, other and non-other are experienced in moments of other and non-other.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa la rab tu 'jug cing 'dzin nas rjes su mtshams sbyor ba'i ngo bo rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa la rab tu 'jug cing 'dzin nas rjes su mtshams sbyor ba'i ngo bo rnams te /
translated: Conceptual consciousnesses engage and apprehend objects just as they are desired and they are the nature that connects to subsequent moments.

original: rnam pa kun gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid yin kyang rnam par shes pa'i 'gog pa gsal ba la sogs pa gang zhig sgro btags pa'i rnam par bzlog par nus la /
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid yin kyang rnam par shes pa'i 'gog pa gsal ba la sogs pa gang zhig sgro btags pa'i rnam par bzlog par nus la /
translated: Even though they apprehend the nature of all aspects, they are unable to reverse the superimpositions of consciousness and so on that are clear and so forth.

original: de nyid kyis sgro btags pa log pa'i ched dang rjes su 'brel ba'i @83a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis sgro btags pa log pa'i ched dang rjes su 'brel ba'i @83a * //
translated: For that very reason, they are unable to reverse the superimpositions of the aggregates and so on that are connected to the superimpositions of consciousness and so on.

original: sgrib pa spang ba ni tshad ma las gzhan med pas de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma las gzhan pa'i zha nye dkar po la dngul bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgro btagsüîΩpa'i rnam pa phyin ci log par rab tu skye ba'i nyon mongs pa drungs 'byin pa po nyid kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i skad cig bco lnga zhes pa dang / skad cig bcu drug pas mthong ba'i lam rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa spang ba ni tshad ma las gzhan med pas de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i ngo bo'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma las gzhan pa'i zha nye dkar po la dngul bzhin du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgro btags pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log par rab tu skye ba'i nyon mongs pa drungs 'byin pa po nyid kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i skad cig bco lnga zhes pa dang / skad cig bcu drug pas mthong ba'i lam rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i dngos po ste /
translated: Since there is no other way to abandon obscurations than through valid knowledge, the fifteen moments of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on, which are by nature the patience accepting the fact that phenomena are not produced, are the antidote that uproots the misconceptions that are the cause of the mistaken superimposition of the aspect of the self of persons, which is like the white clay of silver.üîΩThe sixteenth moment is the path of seeing, the level of the joyous.

original: des zhugs pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyid la gang du seng ge bzang pos sa'i tshogs su rab tu dga' ba'i sa skad cig ma dang po ni mthong ba'i lam la de las gzhan pa snga ma de ma thag pa'i skad cig ma nas
analyzed: des zhugs pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nyid la gang du seng ge bzang pos sa'i tshogs su rab tu dga' ba'i sa skad cig ma dang po ni mthong ba'i lam la de las gzhan pa snga ma de ma thag pa'i skad cig ma nas
translated: The first moment of the path of seeing, the level of the joyous, is the first moment of the path of seeing.

original: brtsams pa'i gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi bsgom pa'i lam du bshad de /
analyzed: brtsams pa'i gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi bsgom pa'i lam du bshad de /
translated: The second moment of the path of seeing and so on are explained as the path of meditation up to the level of buddhahood.

original: de la yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa de ltar zhe sdang spangs pas bcu zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa de ltar zhe sdang spangs pas bcu zhes pa ste /
translated: On that path, the six afflictions of desire realm attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, the afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are abandoned and the six afflictions of the form and formless realms are abandoned, making ten.

original: de ltar bcu drug rab tu spong bar 'gyur zhes pa dang / lam shes par ni mthong ba'i lam du rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar bcu drug rab tu spong bar 'gyur zhes pa dang / lam shes par ni mthong ba'i lam du rnam par bshad de /
translated: Thus it is said that the sixteen are completely abandoned and it is explained that knowledge of the path is the path of seeing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug pa'i mthong ba'i lam de la brgyad pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag ces pa yang bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug pa'i mthong ba'i lam de la brgyad pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag ces pa yang bshad de /
translated: It is also explained that the path of seeing of bodhisattvas is posited as the eighth moment and so on of the path of seeing that has sixteen moments.

original: de la 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal bar yang ma shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal bar yang ma shes pa nyid do //
translated: Here, he does not understand that the former and latter moments are contradictory.üîΩThen, the fifteen moments beginning with the second are the path of meditation, since they are the nature of the path of meditation.üîΩIf that is so, then the fifteen moments would be the path of meditation, since they are the nature of the stainless and so on.üîΩSince they are not the path of seeing, they would not be the path of seeing.üîΩSince they are not the path of meditation, they would not be the path of meditation.

original: de nas gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skad cig bco lnga po rnams kyang bsgom pa'i bdag nyid can gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam ni zhes brjod pa tsam na ni de ltar na ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i rang bzhin nyid bsgom pa'i lam la des
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa la sogs pa'i skad cig bco lnga po rnams kyang bsgom pa'i bdag nyid can gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam ni zhes brjod pa tsam na ni de ltar na ni dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa'i rang bzhin nyid bsgom pa'i lam la des
translated: Since they are not the path of no further learning, they would not be the path of no further learning.üîΩSince they are not the path of liberation, they would not be the path of liberation.üîΩSince they are not the path of distinction, they would not be the path of distinction.üîΩSince they are not the path of preparation, they would not be the path of preparation.üîΩSince they are not the path of uncontaminated transcendent wisdom, they would not be the path of uncontaminated transcendent wisdom.üîΩSince they are not the path of the three vehicles, they would not be the path of the three vehicles.üîΩSince they are not the path of the three realms, they would not be the path of the three realms.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two vehicles, they would not be the path of the two vehicles.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two truths, they would not be the path of the two truths.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two obscurations, they would not be the path of the two obscurations.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two accumulations, they would not be the path of the two accumulations.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two cessations, they would not be the path of the two cessations.

original: spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal spangs pa la lan cig ma yin pas so sor bsgrubs pas skad cig ma bco lnga po rnams la ji ltar rigs zhes pa'i tshul ngan pa mang po la don med kyang sems kyi skad cig nyi shu rtsa gnyis po'i semsüîΩbskyed pa'i dbye ba rnams kyang kun tu tha snyad pa ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal spangs pa la lan cig ma yin pas so sor bsgrubs pas skad cig ma bco lnga po rnams la ji ltar rigs zhes pa'i tshul ngan pa mang po la don med kyang sems kyi skad cig nyi shu rtsa gnyis po'i semsüîΩbskyed pa'i dbye ba rnams kyang kun tu tha snyad pa ste /
translated: Since they are not the path of the two purities, they would not be the path of the two purities.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two realities, they would not be the path of the two realities.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two kinds of no-self, they would not be the path of the two kinds of no-self.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two kinds of wisdom, they would not be the path of the two kinds of wisdom.üîΩSince they are not the path of the two kinds of emptiness, they would not be the path of the two kinds of emptiness.

original: dus kyi khyad par gyis 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes bya la shes @83b pa yongs su rdzogs pa la ji srid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par gyis 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes bya la shes @83b pa yongs su rdzogs pa la ji srid du rig par bya ste /
translated: It is to be known for as long as the complete knowledge of the object to be known, which is characterized by the complete result, is not complete.

original: dper na mi khom pa brgyad la sogs pa'i skad cig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi khom pa brgyad la sogs pa'i skad cig bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the moment of the eight inopportune states and so on.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can du gzhan brgyad po rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba ni bzod par brjod la /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid can du gzhan brgyad po rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba ni bzod par brjod la /
translated: In that, the eight others are called acceptance, which is the nature of the uninterrupted path that abandons the afflictions.

original: 'dir rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas ni khams gsum pa'i chos rnams la brjod du med pa nyid du so sor rig par 'gyur ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa thob pas shes rab tu 'gyur nas sngon du 'dod pa'i khams la shes rab med nas der ltung ba
analyzed: 'dir rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas ni khams gsum pa'i chos rnams la brjod du med pa nyid du so sor rig par 'gyur ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa thob pas shes rab tu 'gyur nas sngon du 'dod pa'i khams la shes rab med nas der ltung ba
translated: Here, by the acceptance of subsequent knowledge, one obtains the second moment of the realization of the inexpressibility of phenomena of the three realms. Through that, one becomes wisdom. Previously, in the desire realm, one lacked wisdom and fell there.

original: rnams kyi chos rnams la ngo bo nyid med par so sor rig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnams kyi chos rnams la ngo bo nyid med par so sor rig par 'gyur la /
translated: One realizes the realitylessness of phenomena.

original: 'dir de dang mnyam pa dang de'i rgyun gyis de'i rjes su bzod par gyur ba la ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir de dang mnyam pa dang de'i rgyun gyis de'i rjes su bzod par gyur ba la ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Here, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge is called the perseverance for subsequent knowledge because it is equal to that and because it is perseverance that is subsequent to that continuum.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo des ni nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byas pa la mngon sum du byed pa'i rjes su chos shes pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo des ni nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byas pa la mngon sum du byed pa'i rjes su chos shes pa brgyad do //
translated: The eight subsequent knowledges of the truth of the path are the direct perception of the separation from affliction by that nature of the liberated path.

original: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i yang brgyad po ni nges par shes pas na gzhan du nye bar brtags nas rjes su chos shes par gzhan du brjod la /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i yang brgyad po ni nges par shes pas na gzhan du nye bar brtags nas rjes su chos shes par gzhan du brjod la /
translated: The eight that are concomitant with that are called subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path because they are definitely subsequent knowledge.

original: 'di'i gnas skabs su ni snang ba dang dmigs pa dag gi kho na'i mngon sum du byed pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gnas skabs su ni snang ba dang dmigs pa dag gi kho na'i mngon sum du byed pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: In this context, they are posited as the direct perception of the appearance and focal object of the truth of the path.

original: 'dir bzod pa'i rjes su nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bas mngon sum du byas pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis bzod pa la rtog pa'i shes pa la yang gzhan du mngon sum du byed par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir bzod pa'i rjes su nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bas mngon sum du byas pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis bzod pa la rtog pa'i shes pa la yang gzhan du mngon sum du byed par brjod do //
translated: Here, because of being liberated from the afflictions subsequent to perseverance, it is said that the knowledge that directly realizes that is also the knowledge that fully understands the truths, since it is concomitant with that.

original: de nyid kyis nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na gang gis rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la kun tu rtog par byed pa de la sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes chos mngon pa kun las btus par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis na gang gis rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la kun tu rtog par byed pa de la sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes chos mngon pa kun las btus par bshad do //
translated: The Compendium of Abhidharma explains that the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is called subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering because it is characterized by that subsequent knowledge.

original: lam la rjes su shes pas ni ma mthong ba mthong ba med pas mthong ba'i lam ma yin pa nyid ces 'dod na bzod pa la rtog pa'i shes pa gzhan rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pas ni ma mthong ba mthong ba med pas mthong ba'i lam ma yin pa nyid ces 'dod na bzod pa la rtog pa'i shes pa gzhan rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is asserted that the path of seeing is not the path of seeing because it does not see what has not been seen, then it follows that the other knowledges that fully understand the truths, such as the knowledge that fully understands the truths that is concomitant with perseverance for subsequent knowledge, would not be the path of seeing.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi pos ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /üîΩmchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / @84a * //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi pos ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / @84a * //
translated: The four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.

original: brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams pa la so sor bcu zhes pas bzhi bcu la /
analyzed: brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams pa la so sor bcu zhes pas bzhi bcu la /
translated: The four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi po la ni de nyid la khong khro ba spangs pas bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhir son pa'i la bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa dang / nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde la 'dod chags ni bag la nyal gyis zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa bzhi po la ni de nyid la khong khro ba spangs pas bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhir son pa'i la bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa dang / nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar 'gyur ro // de la 'dod chags ni bag la nyal gyis zhen pa'o //
translated: The four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.

original: khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The four acceptances of Dharma knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.üîΩThe four acceptances of subsequent knowledge eliminate the four afflictions of the desire realm: attachment

original: yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin pa'i khyad par gyis sems kyi gzengs bstod pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin pa'i khyad par gyis sems kyi gzengs bstod pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the exaltation of mind that occurs when one discriminates between what is right and what is wrong.

original: rtag pa la sogs par nang du sgro btags nas de la mchog nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par nang du sgro btags nas de la mchog nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The belief in the supremacy of one's view is the adherence to the supremacy of that view which is based on the superimposition of permanence, etc.

original: de nyid la rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The belief in the supremacy of one's morality and way of life is the adherence to the supremacy of that morality and way of life which is based on the superimposition of liberation.

original: lhag ma ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest is as already explained.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni mdo sde tshangs pa'i dra ba nas bshad pa'i lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis nang du 'dus pa can te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni mdo sde tshangs pa'i dra ba nas bshad pa'i lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis nang du 'dus pa can te /
translated: The belief in the transitory aggregates is included in the sixty-two views explained in the Brahmajala Sutra.

original: de yang 'dir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' man ngag gis bdag tu 'dzin pa de rab tu spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang 'dir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' man ngag gis bdag tu 'dzin pa de rab tu spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Here, the belief in the transitory aggregates is the adherence to the self which is based on the tenets of another.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ring mo nas 'jug pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam de nyid kyis rab tu spong ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ring mo nas 'jug pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam de nyid kyis rab tu spong ste /
translated: Since the innate view of the perishing aggregates has long been engaged, it is completely abandoned by the path of meditation itself.üîΩThe innate view of the perishing aggregates is the conception of i and mine that arises through the power of the beginningless latent propensities of the view of the transitory collection.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni sems can du lta ba'i bag chags thog ma med pa nas kyi stobs kyis byung bar gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag gi'o zhes pa'i blo ni rim gyis nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang 'gal ba'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni sems can du lta ba'i bag chags thog ma med pa nas kyi stobs kyis byung bar gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag gi'o zhes pa'i blo ni rim gyis nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang 'gal ba'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong
translated: Having gradually seen all phenomena that are incompatible with all afflictions as emptiness,

original: nas yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: nas yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba med de /
translated: afflictions do not arise again.üîΩAlso, the ≈öavara teaches:

original: gang yang / sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal 'dir //
analyzed: gang yang / sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal 'dir //
translated: In this clear light nature of mind,

original: glo bur ba yi dri ma rnams //
analyzed: glo bur ba yi dri ma rnams //
translated: the adventitious stains

original: de yi snga nas nus med na //
analyzed: de yi snga nas nus med na //
translated: have been powerless from the beginning.

original: phyis ni nub pa gang nas byung ste /
analyzed: phyis ni nub pa gang nas byung ste /
translated: Where can they set later?

original: de nyid kyis na bdag de'i tshe de'i dus su ri dags kyi rgyal po smod med lus zhes bya bar gyur zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bdag de'i tshe de'i dus su ri dags kyi rgyal po smod med lus zhes bya bar gyur zhes pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis zhes pa ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said this because of the power of his former aspirations.

original: rgyas par dgos pa med do //
analyzed: rgyas par dgos pa med do //
translated: There is no need to elaborate.

original: 'dir mthong ba'i lam la 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams su mngon du gyur pa dag ces gsungs kyang /
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba'i lam la 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams su mngon du gyur pa dag ces gsungs kyang /
translated: Here, although it is said that the factors conducive to penetrative insight of the world manifest on the path of seeing,

original: bcom ldan @84b 'das la 'dzin pa yod pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhir phye ba rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo ni phyin ci log pas bskyed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bcom ldan @84b 'das la 'dzin pa yod pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhir phye ba rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo ni phyin ci log pas bskyed pa'i phyir la /
translated: those who hold that the BhagavƒÅn has grasping apprehend the four conceptions of apprehender and apprehended. Because of the error of conception, they are mistaken. Because they are generated by error, they are the nature of attachment to things and nonthings.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i nang du 'dus pas ma rig pa spangs pas de ltar spang ste /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i nang du 'dus pas ma rig pa spangs pas de ltar spang ste /
translated: Since they are included in ignorance, they are abandoned by abandoning ignorance.üîΩThus the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras explains:

original: de ltar yang mdo sde rgyan las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las gzhan pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs ni gnyis las grol ba'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang dri ma dang ldan pa'i mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa gnas gzhan du mi 'jug pas de ltar
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde rgyan las nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams las gzhan pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs ni gnyis las grol ba'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang dri ma dang ldan pa'i mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa gnas gzhan du mi 'jug pas de ltar
translated: The state of the path of seeing other than that compatible with penetrative insight is uncontaminated because it is free from the knowledge liberated from the two and it is free from the union of the subject and object aspect, it is free from the subject and object aspect because it is nonconceptual and it is free from the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing that possess stains.

original: 'dir sa dang por 'dod do zhes bshad la /
analyzed: 'dir sa dang por 'dod do zhes bshad la /
translated: Thus it is asserted that the path of seeing is the first ground.üîΩArya Vimuktisena also explains:

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam zhes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol sdes kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam zhes so //
translated: The antidote to the fourth conception of subject and object is the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir na seng ge bzang pos sngon du bstan pa bzhi po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nas ci rigs par mngon du rgyu ba'i gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni khyad par gyi lam gyi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs
analyzed: de'i phyir na seng ge bzang pos sngon du bstan pa bzhi po'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nas ci rigs par mngon du rgyu ba'i gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni khyad par gyi lam gyi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say that the four forerunners of the path of seeing, the four aspects of definite discernment, and the conceptions of apprehended and apprehender that manifest in the four forerunners are abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation that are included in the peak application of the special path.

original: pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam bdag nyid kyis spang bar bya'o zhes bshad pa ni 'thad pa ma yin pas 'di rnams su ni bag chags 'di ltar rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes pa'i 'thad pa dang bcas pa bshad par bya ste
analyzed: pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam bdag nyid kyis spang bar bya'o zhes bshad pa ni 'thad pa ma yin pas 'di rnams su ni bag chags 'di ltar rab tu spong bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes pa'i 'thad pa dang bcas pa bshad par bya ste
translated: Therefore I will explain the rationale for how these are the levels on which these habitual tendencies are completely eliminated.

original: / 'di rnams kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: / 'di rnams kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa rnams kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five verses on the defining characteristics of the sixteenth moment of these.üîΩSuchness and the buddhas

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun rten la brten med phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun rten la brten med phyir //
translated: are mutually dependent, but not dependent on each other.

original: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad med nyid dang bcas //
analyzed: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad med nyid dang bcas //
translated: And it is endowed with the immeasurability of the great.üîΩIt is immeasurable, without the two extremes,

original: dpag med mtha' gnyis med pa dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: dpag med mtha' gnyis med pa dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: And in it, form and so forthüîΩAre ascertained as buddhahood.üîΩIt is without acceptance and without rejection, and so forth,üîΩAnd it is endowed with love and so forth, with emptiness,üîΩAnd with the attainment of buddhahood,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams pa sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams pa sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
translated: And it is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.

original: @85a * // mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi srung la sogs //
analyzed: @85a * // mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi srung la sogs //
translated: It is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.

original: srog mi gcod pa la brtsams pa'i //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa la brtsams pa'i //
translated: It is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: And it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,

original: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
translated: And it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //üîΩlam shes nyid kyis skad cig ma //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //üîΩlam shes nyid kyis skad cig ma //
translated: It is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,üîΩAnd it is the removal of all distress and disease.üîΩIt is the pacification of the apprehension of nirvana,üîΩAnd it is the protection and so forth of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the complete inclusion of all that is pure,

original: zhes te / gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni skad cig ma brgyad pa rnams kyis sngon gyi la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes te / gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni skad cig ma brgyad pa rnams kyis sngon gyi la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: The forms, etc. are related to the previous eight moments, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid du sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma brgyad pa la byams pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su mthong bas de la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid du sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma brgyad pa la byams pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su mthong bas de la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Because of the suffering and origination of forms, etc., in the eighth moment, one sees the forms, etc., of love, etc., and so one focuses on them.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni sems can du bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni sems can du bshad de /
translated: Forms, etc., are explained as sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa med la /
analyzed: 'phags pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las gsungs pa / gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid la yang de bzhin gshegs pa med la /
translated: The Twenty-Five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sutra says:üîΩThe Tathagata does not exist in the reality of forms, etc.,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid med ces /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid med ces /
translated: and the reality of forms, etc., does not exist in the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of forms, etc., is just the non-entityness of the Tathagata.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dir sems can rnams ni de bzhin nyid kho na ji lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dir sems can rnams ni de bzhin nyid kho na ji lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te /
translated: Here, sentient beings are just the reality of the Tathagata's essence.

original: 'dir phan tshun du rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir phan tshun du rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, they do not exist as the thing that is the mutual support.

original: rnam grangs ni tha dad pa la khas mi len pa ni tha dad par khas mi len zhes pa'i don te /üîΩgzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa med la /
analyzed: rnam grangs ni tha dad pa la khas mi len pa ni tha dad par khas mi len zhes pa'i don te / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan du yang de bzhin gshegs pa med la /
translated: The alternative is that the non-acceptance of difference is the meaning of non-acceptance of difference.üîΩThe Thus-Gone is not other than the suchness of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan du yang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid med ces rnam grangs kyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan du yang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid med ces rnam grangs kyis te /
translated: The suchness of form is not other than the Thus-Gone.üîΩThis is the alternative.

original: bye brag gzhan gyis khas mi len cing tha dad pa med ces pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nye bar dmigs su med pa gsungs la /
analyzed: bye brag gzhan gyis khas mi len cing tha dad pa med ces pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nye bar dmigs su med pa gsungs la /
translated: The non-acceptance of difference by way of other distinctions is stated as the non-observation of difference and non-difference.

original: de'i rjes la der yang gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la der yang gsungs te /
translated: This is also stated in the next line:üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is not form and so on, and the perfection of wisdom is not other than form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med ces pas de bzhin nyid rjes su rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med ces pas de bzhin nyid rjes su rtog pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: The realization of suchness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: ste / 'di nyid kyis na tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa nye bar dmigs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: ste / 'di nyid kyis na tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa nye bar dmigs pa gsungs la /
translated: Thus, it is said that the object of observation is observed as different and not different.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni mdor bsdus nas gsungs ba'i dang po'i skad cig gi gnas skabs ni de @85b nas yang lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni mdor bsdus nas gsungs ba'i dang po'i skad cig gi gnas skabs ni de @85b nas yang lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, in the Bhagavatƒ´, it is said in brief:

original: le'u bstan pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa las don dam par tha dad pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: le'u bstan pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa las don dam par tha dad pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The first moment of the occasion is not ultimately different from form, etc.,

original: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not non-different.

original: de ltar yang gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gang gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang yang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyis dang / gang yang tshol ba'i chos 'di rnams thams cad ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ni dngos po'i chos kyi phyir zhes pa'i sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal
analyzed: de ltar yang gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gang gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang yang gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyis dang / gang yang tshol ba'i chos 'di rnams thams cad ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ni dngos po'i chos kyi phyir zhes pa'i sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal
translated: Thus, all of these phenomena that are sought, such as the perfection of wisdom, form and so on, and also the suchness of form and so on, are ultimately without an essence because they are not different or the same, since they are phenomena that are things.

original: la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The nonobservation of suffering and the characteristics of suffering is the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: brgya byin gyis chen po la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis chen po la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa yin la /
translated: The brief teaching is Indra‚Äôs ‚Äúgreat‚Äù and so on.

original: rab 'byor gyis bstod pa dang bcas pas rjes su rtsom pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis bstod pa dang bcas pas rjes su rtsom pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is Subh≈´ti‚Äôs praise and subsequent composition.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams las chen po med ces pa nyid du yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnams las chen po med ces pa nyid du yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: There, since one does not eliminate the great and so on as not existing among form and so on,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis na chen po la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis na chen po la /
translated: the great is the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chen po nyid ces pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang chen po nyid ces pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is the object of that, the perfection of wisdom is also called ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù
