original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings dang ro gcig pas mngon par zhen pa med par blta bar byas pas mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bshad de /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid pas gang yang tshad kyis yongs su mchod pas tshad med ces pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings dang ro gcig pas mngon par zhen pa med par blta bar byas pas mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bshad de / gzugs la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' lta bu'i stong pa nyid pas gang yang tshad kyis yongs su mchod pas tshad med ces pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the great perfection and so on is explained as ‚Äúnon-apprehending‚Äù because it is seen to be without attachment, since it is of one taste with the dharmadhƒÅtu.üîΩ‚ÄúImmeasurable‚Äù means that forms and so on are like space, empty, and therefore not measured by any measure. This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la grangs kyis yongs su ma chod pas gzhal du med ces pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la grangs kyis yongs su ma chod pas gzhal du med ces pa ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIncalculable‚Äù means that forms and so on are not limited by number. This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: mtha' nyid ni mtha' la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la mtha' med pa nyid de yul gyis yongs su mchod pa dang / rtsom pa mtha' med de /
analyzed: mtha' nyid ni mtha' la gzugs la sogs pa rnams la mtha' med pa nyid de yul gyis yongs su mchod pa dang / rtsom pa mtha' med de /
translated: The extreme of extremes is the absence of an extreme in forms, etc.

original: rtsom pa'i chos de rnams thams cad la mtha' yod pa ma yin pa la bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / med pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtha' dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i chos de rnams thams cad la mtha' yod pa ma yin pa la bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / med pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtha' dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object that is fully known, and it is not an extreme of composition, because all those phenomena of composition are not an extreme, since they transcend enumeration and are nonexistent, because they lack the extremes of origination and destruction.

original: de'i phyir na dbus gnas pa med la sems can la dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang bdag med pa'i shes pa la de yang mtha' med kyi /üîΩcung @86a * //üîΩzhig bgrang ba dang lhan cig sbyor bas med pa'i bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyis na med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dbus gnas pa med la sems can la dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang bdag med pa'i shes pa la de yang mtha' med kyi / cung @86a * // zhig bgrang ba dang lhan cig sbyor bas med pa'i bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyis na med pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the middle does not exist, and the knowledge of selflessness in both the context of sentient beings and the context of the transcendent ones is also without an extreme.üîΩIt is not an extreme that is to be enumerated,üîΩbecause it transcends enumeration, since it is not associated with even the slightest enumeration.

original: mi brjod pa ni grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: mi brjod pa ni grangs med pa'o //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it is inexpressible, and it is not an extreme that is to be expressed.

original: chos kyi tshig bla dgas zhes pa ni chos ni phung po la sogs pa la bdag dang rdzas ni med pas tshig bla dgas te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig bla dgas zhes pa ni chos ni phung po la sogs pa la bdag dang rdzas ni med pas tshig bla dgas te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúdharma‚Äù is a designation for the aggregates, etc., because the self and substantial reality do not exist.

original: chos nyid kyi rang gi don mngon par brjod pa'i chos kyi tshig bla dgas ni ma yin gyis //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rang gi don mngon par brjod pa'i chos kyi tshig bla dgas ni ma yin gyis //
translated: It is not a designation for the dharma that expresses the meaning of reality itself.

original: rmongs pa rnams kyi rab tu spros pa dang ldan pa gang zhig glo bur bar yod pa ni rnam par brtags na g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams kyi rab tu spros pa dang ldan pa gang zhig glo bur bar yod pa ni rnam par brtags na g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is imagined by the ignorant as having a nature of elaboration is, when examined, not found to exist, because it is in motion.

original: gang du dngos po med pa can ni bdag dang rdzas ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du dngos po med pa can ni bdag dang rdzas ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is devoid of substantial reality is devoid of the self and substantial reality.

original: bdag tu btags pa'i yul phung po la sogs pa la bdag gir byed pa gang de yang med pas bdag gi bya ba med pa la rtsom pa'i yul de la med pas rtsom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu btags pa'i yul phung po la sogs pa la bdag gir byed pa gang de yang med pas bdag gi bya ba med pa la rtsom pa'i yul de la med pas rtsom pa med pa'o //
translated: That which is the object of the designation of self, the aggregates, etc., is also non-existent, because the activity of the self does not exist. Since the object of the activity does not exist, there is no activity.

original: 'di la zhes pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa la ste /
analyzed: 'di la zhes pa ni ston pa'i bstan pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the teaching of the Teacher.

original: 'dis ni tshig thob nas kyang grub pa med par grub pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig thob nas kyang grub pa med par grub pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This shows that, having obtained the words, one should teach without establishing.

original: ci ltar sems can mtha' yas zhes pa ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyis dang / gang du yang bdag med par tshad mas grub pa ni gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar sems can mtha' yas zhes pa ni bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa nyid kyis dang / gang du yang bdag med par tshad mas grub pa ni gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú And also‚Äù and so forth are the valid cognition that establishes the absence of self anywhere.

original: dbyangs kyis ni tshig la mtha' yas pa ni 'jig rten te /
analyzed: dbyangs kyis ni tshig la mtha' yas pa ni 'jig rten te /
translated: ‚Äú The world‚Äù is the infinite words of sound.

original: rnam par rig pa ni don shes par byed pa'i sgra dbyangs so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni don shes par byed pa'i sgra dbyangs so //
translated: ‚Äú Cognition‚Äù is the sound of the voice that causes the meaning to be understood.

original: sgra zhes pa ni de ltar brjod pas so //
analyzed: sgra zhes pa ni de ltar brjod pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Sound‚Äù is expressed in that way.

original: de ltar shin tu dbyangs che ba'i phyir na zab mo'i dbyangs te /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu dbyangs che ba'i phyir na zab mo'i dbyangs te /
translated: Since it is such a great sound, it is a profound sound.

original: rnga phran gyi dbyangs bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnga phran gyi dbyangs bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Like the sound of a lute, it is various.

original: sgra yis zhes pa la de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: sgra yis zhes pa la de ltar brjod do //
translated: ‚Äú Sound‚Äù is expressed in that way.

original: ma zhugs pa ni ngal ma bsos pas so //
analyzed: ma zhugs pa ni ngal ma bsos pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Not entering‚Äù is not resting.

original: zin kyang ni cung zhig go //
analyzed: zin kyang ni cung zhig go //
translated: ‚Äú Having entered‚Äù is a little.

original: gdod nas dag pa'i phyir ni gdod nas de ltar med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gdod nas dag pa'i phyir ni gdod nas de ltar med pa nyid de /
translated: ‚Äú Since it is pure from the beginning‚Äù means that it does not exist in that way from the beginning.

original: yongs su dag pa nyid ni thams cad mu med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa nyid ni thams cad mu med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Complete purity‚Äù is the absence of everything.

original: rnam grangs 'dis zhes pa ni bye brag 'dis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis zhes pa ni bye brag 'dis so //
translated: By this enumeration, by this distinction.

original: sems can mtha' med pa zhes pa ni sems can la skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mtha' med pa zhes pa ni sems can la skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Endless sentient beings, because sentient beings are free from the extreme of origination and cessation.

original: 'di ltar yang zhes pa ni de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang zhes pa ni de lta bu nyid do //
translated: Thus, in this way, in just this way.

original: bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa nyid min zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //üîΩde'i zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa la sangs rgyas nyid du @86b 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa nyid min zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o // de'i zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa la sangs rgyas nyid du @86b 'dzin pas so //
translated: Not beyond counting, because of the acquiescence to the knowledge of the origination of things.üîΩHis, of the knowledge of the origination of things.üîΩBuddhahood should be seen in the perfection of wisdom abiding in form, etc.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bya //
translated: Buddhahood should be seen in the perfection of wisdom abiding in form, etc.

original: zhes pa ni skad cig ma drug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skad cig ma drug pa ste /
translated: This is the sixth moment.

original: de'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage concerning that stage begins with ‚ÄúThen, etc.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po ni 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po ni 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams te /
translated: The lord of beings is the four world guardians.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos thos nas rab tu mgu nas 'bad pa med par tshig gis ched du brjod pas ched du brjod do //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos thos nas rab tu mgu nas 'bad pa med par tshig gis ched du brjod pas ched du brjod do //
translated: Having heard the Dharma that is especially exalted, he was very pleased. Without effort, he uttered a spontaneous utterance:

original: chos bstan pas ni chos la yang chos ni chos rab tu gsal bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: chos bstan pas ni chos la yang chos ni chos rab tu gsal bar byas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma has been taught, and the Dharma has been made clear by the Dharma.

original: mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: This is the path of seeing.

original: chos de rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The reality of those dharmas is their nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of the TathƒÅgata is the arising of the Dharma.üîΩThe arising of the Dharma is the arising of the Sangha.

original: de'i phyir na gsol ba ni gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gsol ba ni gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, I request that you allow me to go forth.‚Äù

original: rab tu 'byung zhes pa ni skye ba zag pa med par ye shes kyi mtshan nyid la smos pa ni de'i tshig las thog mar cung zhig yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung zhes pa ni skye ba zag pa med par ye shes kyi mtshan nyid la smos pa ni de'i tshig las thog mar cung zhig yid ches pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing forth‚Äù means to be born in the undefiled state, characterized by wisdom. The mention of ‚Äúat the very beginning‚Äù means that he had a little faith in the words of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de nas rim gyis gsal zhing gsal bar gyur nas gsal ba dang yid ches par gyur pa la bstan par gyur pa dang / rab tu bshad par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis gsal zhing gsal bar gyur nas gsal ba dang yid ches par gyur pa la bstan par gyur pa dang / rab tu bshad par 'gyur ba dang / rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, gradually, as he became clearer and clearer, he became clear and had faith. He was taught, he was explained, he was spoken to.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma drug po de nyid gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni skad cig ma drug po de nyid gsol ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthus-gone‚Äù and so on refers to those very six moments.

original: de nas zhes pa ni de nas brtsams nas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni de nas brtsams nas so //
translated: ‚Äú Then‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom then on.‚Äù

original: ma bral ba ni thob pa las ma nyams pas so //
analyzed: ma bral ba ni thob pa las ma nyams pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Not separated‚Äù means not having fallen away from the attainment.

original: gnas par 'gyur zhes pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur zhes pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bgyi //
translated: ‚Äú Abide‚Äù means to manifest.

original: zhes pa ni gang zhig bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du nges pa'i khyad par des thob pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang zhig bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du nges pa'i khyad par des thob pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Should be taken as a thus-gone‚Äù means that by attaining that thus-gone state that was explained,

original: de thob pas lung bstan pa thob la /
analyzed: de thob pas lung bstan pa thob la /
translated: one attains the prophecy.

original: de las gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de las gsungs pa ni /
translated: What is taught from that is

original: gang du bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du bdag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúwherever I am‚Äù and so on.

original: lo nyung ba'i gtsang sbra can la bram ze'i khye'u zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lo nyung ba'i gtsang sbra can la bram ze'i khye'u zhes brjod do //
translated: One who is young and pure is called a young brahmin.

original: chos rnams ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du rtogs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: One who realizes the suchness of phenomena is a thus-gone.

original: dgra ni nyon mongs pa la de bcom pa dang ldan pas dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra ni nyon mongs pa la de bcom pa dang ldan pas dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: One who possesses the destruction of the afflictions, which are the enemies, is an arhat.

original: yang dag par phyin ci log ma lus par rtog pa 'dis ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci log ma lus par rtog pa 'dis ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: By this complete, correct understanding, he is a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: de nyid kyis ni stong pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni stong pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: By this very fact, he is said to be endowed with emptiness.

original: mi gsungs pa med pa'am /
analyzed: mi gsungs pa med pa'am /
translated: He is not one who does not speak,

original: phyin ci ma log par gsungs pas ston pa yin te /üîΩphyin ci log gi tshig ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis sam /üîΩmi shes pa las byung la de gnyi ga yang 'di la med pas go rims bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i phyir dang / yang @87a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par gsungs pas ston pa yin te / phyin ci log gi tshig ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis sam / mi shes pa las byung la de gnyi ga yang 'di la med pas go rims bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i phyir dang / yang @87a * //
translated: but he is a teacher who speaks correctly.

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Words that are incorrect arise from the power of the afflictions or from ignorance. Since neither of these two exist in him, he is, respectively, an Arhat and a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: 'khor ba pas ji ltar 'di 'dra ba can du nus she na /
analyzed: 'khor ba pas ji ltar 'di 'dra ba can du nus she na /
translated: How can a transmigrator be like this?

original: gsungs pa / bde bar gshegs pa ni yang srid pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / bde bar gshegs pa ni yang srid pa las grol ba'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe Sugata is liberated from rebirth.‚Äù

original: bde ba'i sgra ni bkra shis pa dang yang phyir mi ldog pa dang / ma lus pa'i don te /
analyzed: bde ba'i sgra ni bkra shis pa dang yang phyir mi ldog pa dang / ma lus pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúwell‚Äù means auspicious, ‚Äúgoing‚Äù means non-returning, and ‚Äúcompletely‚Äù means without remainder.

original: gzugs mdzes pa lta bu dang / rims nad legs par byang ba lta bu dang / bum pa legs par gang ba lta bu ste /üîΩphyi rol gyi slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams rnam par bcad pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs mdzes pa lta bu dang / rims nad legs par byang ba lta bu dang / bum pa legs par gang ba lta bu ste / phyi rol gyi slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams rnam par bcad pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: like a beautiful form, like a well-healed wound, like a well-filled vase.üîΩThe Blessed One is not like that, because he is the opposite of those three.üîΩHe is the Sugata because he has gone to bliss, since he has gone to the other shore of the ocean of excellences, and since he has gone to the other shore of the ocean of the two obscurations.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gshegs pa'i phyir bkra shis par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis gshegs pa'i phyir bkra shis par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Sugata because he has gone to the world, since he has gone to the world by means of the supramundane path.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The tirthikas have not gone to the world in that way,

original: dus mtshams dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i thar pa ni thar pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshams dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i thar pa ni thar pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their liberation is not liberation, since it is accompanied by a remainder.üîΩHe is the Sugata because he has gone irreversibly, since the faults of birth, etc.,

original: yang mi ldog ces bshad pa ni slob pa de rnams la skye ba'i skyon kun tu 'byung la /
analyzed: yang mi ldog ces bshad pa ni slob pa de rnams la skye ba'i skyon kun tu 'byung la /
translated: do not occur for him, but do occur for those in training.

original: bcom ldan 'das la ni slob pa med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ni slob pa med de /
translated: The Blessed One is not in training,

original: de'i phyir yang mi ldog par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi ldog par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: and therefore he has gone irreversibly.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rims nad kyi lhag ma ma lus pa med pas lus dang / ngag dang / blo la lam bshad pa'i yon tan thams cad la gsal ba dang mi ldan pa med pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rims nad kyi lhag ma ma lus pa med pas lus dang / ngag dang / blo la lam bshad pa'i yon tan thams cad la gsal ba dang mi ldan pa med pas so //
translated: Since there is no remainder of the disease of the afflictions, there is no lack of clarity in the body, speech, and mind with regard to all the qualities of the path that are taught.

original: de la slob pa rnams kyi theg pa rnams kyi theg pa dman pa la ni dgra bcom pa rnams ji ltar srid cing yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la slob pa rnams kyi theg pa rnams kyi theg pa dman pa la ni dgra bcom pa rnams ji ltar srid cing yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Among those in training, the Arhats are not inferior with regard to the vehicles, as is possible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni de ma lus pa la gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni de ma lus pa la gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One has gone to the end of that, and so he is the One Gone to Bliss.

original: bde ba'i sgra ni gcig pu gcig gis don gsum 'grel ba'i tshul gyis brjod do //
analyzed: bde ba'i sgra ni gcig pu gcig gis don gsum 'grel ba'i tshul gyis brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúbliss‚Äù is expressed in the manner of explaining the meaning of the single word ‚Äúsu‚Äù in three ways.

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa na gang du rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa na gang du rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa ste /
translated: When he goes to bliss, he goes to where there is knowledge and feet.

original: 'dir rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la /
analyzed: 'dir rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la /
translated: Here, knowledge is the training in superior wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni zhabs te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni zhabs te /
translated: Superior morality and superior mind are the feet.

original: rig pa de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they precede that knowledge.

original: 'dir rig pa'i spyan gyis bltas nas cig shos dag gi rkang pa gnyis bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rig pa'i spyan gyis bltas nas cig shos dag gi rkang pa gnyis bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: Here, the TathƒÅgata is the ‚Äúwell-gone‚Äù in the sense that he has gone well with the eye of knowledge, as opposed to the other who has gone with his feet.

original: de la tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni ston pa po nyid kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni ston pa po nyid kyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first two phrases state the perfection of the cause of the teacher.

original: 'jig rten gdul bar bya ba la dus dang / dus ma yin pa yongs su mi mkhyen pa med pas 'jig @87b rten mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gdul bar bya ba la dus dang / dus ma yin pa yongs su mi mkhyen pa med pas 'jig @87b rten mkhyen pa'o //
translated: He is the ‚Äúknower of the world‚Äù because there is nothing that he does not know about the world, such as what is timely and untimely for training disciples.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba ni gdul bya'i gdul bar bya ba 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba ni gdul bya'i gdul bar bya ba 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the ‚Äútrainer of those who can be trained‚Äù because he trains those who are to be trained.

original: de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha lo sgyur ba ste /
translated: He is their ‚Äúleader‚Äù because he leads them.

original: yang dag par dul ba nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag par dul ba nyid de /
translated: He is the ‚Äúperfecter‚Äù because he perfects them.

original: mdzes dga' dang / sor phreng dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / ser skya la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdzes dga' dang / sor phreng dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs dang / ser skya la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: He is not like Udraka, Arada, Sa√±jayin, or Kapila.

original: de las lhag pa med pa ni bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: de las lhag pa med pa ni bla na med pa ste /
translated: He is ‚Äúunsurpassed‚Äù because there is no one higher than him.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba dang kha lo sgyur ba'i tshig 'di gnyis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyi las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba dang kha lo sgyur ba'i tshig 'di gnyis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyi las gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrases ‚Äútrainer of those who can be trained‚Äù and ‚Äúleader‚Äù state the perfection of the activity of the teacher.

original: de lta bu'i las kyi yul ci ngan song du song ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i las kyi yul ci ngan song du song ba'am zhe na /
translated: As for the field of such karma, is it the lower realms?üîΩNo, it is said.

original: min ces gsungs pa de lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes pa ste //
analyzed: min ces gsungs pa de lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes pa ste //
translated: He is the teacher of gods and men.

original: rang nyid mngon par byang chub pas shin tu ba'i blo 'di la yod ces pas ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rang nyid mngon par byang chub pas shin tu ba'i blo 'di la yod ces pas ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is a buddha because he has this highest mind, which is fully enlightened.

original: drang srong gi thog ma'i phyir dang de dang 'dra ba'i rang rgyal ba yang med ces rnam par bcad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: drang srong gi thog ma'i phyir dang de dang 'dra ba'i rang rgyal ba yang med ces rnam par bcad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa ste /
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is the first of sages and because there is no pratyekabuddha equal to him.

original: rnam pa drug dang ldan pa dang bcom pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rnam pa drug dang ldan pa dang bcom pa'i phyir la /
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he possesses six aspects and because he has conquered.

original: de la ni mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is not associated with that, that is, with the origin of suffering.

original: ngo mtshar ba ni skyes pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba ni skyes pa nyid la'o //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is born as a wonder.

original: mchog tu ngo mtshar ba ni rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa la ste /
analyzed: mchog tu ngo mtshar ba ni rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa la ste /
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is the supreme wonder, because he is the supreme holder.

original: ji srid kyi sgra ni mtha' thug pa'i don te /
analyzed: ji srid kyi sgra ni mtha' thug pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúever‚Äù means ‚Äúuntil the end.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage from ‚Äúthe perfection of giving‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe knowledge of all modes‚Äù is this.

original: skyed par byed pa ni 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúproducer‚Äù is the one who attracts.

original: rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa po zhes pa'i rjes su'i sgra ni ched du'i don la /
analyzed: rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa po zhes pa'i rjes su'i sgra ni ched du'i don la /
translated: The word ‚Äúafter‚Äù in ‚Äúthe one who completely holds after‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúfor the sake of.‚Äù

original: ched du dang ldan pa dag ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ched du dang ldan pa dag ni rigs pa'o //
translated: Those who have the meaning of ‚Äúfor the sake of‚Äù are the reasonable ones.

original: yongs su gzung ba dang / ma btang ba dag sgrub par byed pa'i rgyur yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dang / ma btang ba dag sgrub par byed pa'i rgyur yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The one who completely holds is the cause for accomplishing the complete holding and the not giving up.

original: ji ltar yongs su blang ba med cing dor ba med pa de ltar yongs su blang ba zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su blang ba med cing dor ba med pa de ltar yongs su blang ba zhes pa'i don te /
translated: Just as there is no taking up and no giving up, so there is the meaning of ‚Äútaking up.‚Äù

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, in the treatise, it says:

original: blang med dor ba med sogs dang // zhes so //
analyzed: blang med dor ba med sogs dang // zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúNo taking up, no giving up, etc.‚Äù

original: blang ba med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: blang ba med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: No taking up is non-discrimination.

original: 'di ni blang ba med pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni blang ba med pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúno taking up.‚Äù

original: dor ba med pa nyid ni mi dor ba ste /
analyzed: dor ba med pa nyid ni mi dor ba ste /
translated: No giving up is non-abandonment.

original: 'dir ni mi gtong ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi gtong ba'i don to //
translated: Here, it has the meaning of ‚Äúnot letting go.‚Äù

original: kun tu len pa ni thog ma nas yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu len pa ni thog ma nas yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Taking up is taking up from the beginning.

original: mi 'jig pa dang mi gtong ba nyid ni thog ma nas de ltar ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa dang mi gtong ba nyid ni thog ma nas de ltar ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Not destroying and not giving up are just so from the beginning.

original: de ltar mi len pa dang / mi 'dor bdag la ni byang chub sems dpas blang du med ces pa'i don to zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //üîΩbrgya byin gyis go @88a * //
analyzed: de ltar mi len pa dang / mi 'dor bdag la ni byang chub sems dpas blang du med ces pa'i don to zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o // brgya byin gyis go @88a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva has nothing to take up in regard to a self that does not take up and does not give up. This is the forbearance that is subsequent understanding of the truth of the origin.

original: skabs phye ba'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni brgya byin gyi le'u'o //
analyzed: skabs phye ba'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni brgya byin gyi le'u'o //
translated: Because Indra opened the way, the chapter that illustrates this is called Indra's Chapter.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel ba gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel ba gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This completes the second chapter of the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines called the Light of the Moon of the Essential Points, composed by the great pandit Abhayakaragupta.

original: // / byams pa la sogs zhes pa ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te tshad med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: // / byams pa la sogs zhes pa ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms te tshad med pa bzhi ste /
translated: Love and so forth refers to the four immeasurables: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de'i bdag nyid can mthong ba'i skad cig ma brgyad pa la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can mthong ba'i skad cig ma brgyad pa la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin the eighth moment of seeing that has that nature‚Äù is as follows.

original: de ston pa'i gleng gzhi /
analyzed: de ston pa'i gleng gzhi /
translated: The Introduction to That

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa pos smras pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ni sdud pa pos smras pa ste /
translated: Then, the compiler said, ‚ÄúThen, the BhagavƒÅn said to the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva Maitreya . . .‚Äù

original: dpang du byas pa ni skad cig ma brgyad pa na theg pa dman pa ltung ba'i gnyen po la shin tu gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpang du byas pa ni skad cig ma brgyad pa na theg pa dman pa ltung ba'i gnyen po la shin tu gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The witness is the generation of great respect for the antidote to falling to the lower vehicle in the eighth moment.

original: skad cig ma de nyid la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs statement in that very moment is

original: gang la la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i mthong ba'i skad cig ni shes rab la de nyid kyis theg pa dman par ltung ba'i sa las pha rol tu 'gro ba ni gang 'dir gang zhig tshad med pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can
analyzed: gang la la zhes pa la sogs pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rab tu 'byed pa'i mthong ba'i skad cig ni shes rab la de nyid kyis theg pa dman par ltung ba'i sa las pha rol tu 'gro ba ni gang 'dir gang zhig tshad med pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever . . . ‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the moment of seeing the divisions. That is the perfection because it goes beyond the level of falling to the lower vehicle.

original: du mthong ba la de ltar ni byang chub sems dpa' des thob pa ste /
analyzed: du mthong ba la de ltar ni byang chub sems dpa' des thob pa ste /
translated: Here, whoever sees the four immeasurables, which are the nature of the perfection of wisdom, in that way, that bodhisattva obtains it.

original: sems can thams cad la bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du bltas nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du bltas nas /
translated: Having seen all sentient beings as equal to oneself,

original: des skyob pa dang / phan pa'i bdag nyid kyi phan pa 'ga' zhig gis 'dir de gang yang theg pa dman par mi ltung bas de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa'i mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: des skyob pa dang / phan pa'i bdag nyid kyi phan pa 'ga' zhig gis 'dir de gang yang theg pa dman par mi ltung bas de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa'i mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: one should protect them, and by some benefit of one's own nature, one should not fall into the lower vehicle. Therefore, the seeing of love, etc. is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid skad cig ma brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig ma brgyad pa'o //
translated: That itself is the eighth moment.

original: de rnams kyis gang zhig ces pa nas ji srid du kun chub par byed pa'i bar te ;
analyzed: de rnams kyis gang zhig ces pa nas ji srid du kun chub par byed pa'i bar te ;
translated: By those, what? up to mastering.

original: mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab tu 'don par byed pa ni gzhan dag las rab tu ston pa'i phyir de rnams la des 'dzin pa nas ji srid du 'chang ba'i bar gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro // rab tu 'don par byed pa ni gzhan dag las rab tu ston pa'i phyir de rnams la des 'dzin pa nas ji srid du 'chang ba'i bar gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of manifesting.

original: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni phan yon te /
analyzed: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni phan yon te /
translated: Reciting is because of teaching others. By that, etc. is the benefit.

original: rab tu 'don par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: rab tu 'don par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: Up to will recite.

original: glags tshol ba ni 'jug pa la skabs ni skyon te /
analyzed: glags tshol ba ni 'jug pa la skabs ni skyon te /
translated: Seeking an opportunity is an occasion for engaging. An occasion is a fault.

original: de dang ldan pa ni glags lta ba'i bsam pa ni glags tshol ba'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni glags lta ba'i bsam pa ni glags tshol ba'o zhes pa ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: One who possesses that is one who has the intention of seeking an opportunity, and seeks an opportunity.

original: 'gog pa la bcu drug ces pa bstan bcos su bshad de /
analyzed: 'gog pa la bcu drug ces pa bstan bcos su bshad de /
translated: The explanation in the treatise is that there are sixteen with regard to cessation.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams kyis thob pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma dgu pa la ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams kyis thob pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma dgu pa la ste /
translated: The attainment of the sixteen kinds of emptiness is in the ninth moment of seeing.

original: @88b de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: @88b de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: in the line beginning with ‚ÄúFurthermore,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yang mthong ba'i skad cig ma ni shes rab la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mthong ba'i skad cig ma ni shes rab la /
translated: Here, the moment of seeing is wisdom,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams kyang kun tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni stong pa nyid bcu drug rnams kyang kun tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the perfection is the sixteen kinds of emptiness, because they are seen.

original: grong las gzhu 'dom lnga brgya'i pha rol gyi gnas ni dgon pa'o //
analyzed: grong las gzhu 'dom lnga brgya'i pha rol gyi gnas ni dgon pa'o //
translated: A place five hundred bow-lengths from a town is a wilderness.

original: thog ma phub pa'i sa phyogs ni bla gab med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma phub pa'i sa phyogs ni bla gab med pa'o //
translated: A place where a roof was first built is a shelterless place.

original: dgon pa las grong du 'brog dgon pa ste /
analyzed: dgon pa las grong du 'brog dgon pa ste /
translated: A wilderness is a place where one roams from town to town.

original: de nyal ba ni nyal ba'o //
analyzed: de nyal ba ni nyal ba'o //
translated: To sleep there is to sleep.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang bcas pa ni sba ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang bcas pa ni sba ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDefense‚Äù is the protection of the one who is guarding.

original: de la sngags la sogs pa ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sngags la sogs pa ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: Of these, the mantra, etc. is the protection.

original: srung ba po nges par sbyor ba ni bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba po nges par sbyor ba ni bskyab pa'o //
translated: The application of the protector is the defense.

original: rang nyid nye bar son nas byin gyis brlab pa ni sbed pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid nye bar son nas byin gyis brlab pa ni sbed pa'o //
translated: The consecration by one‚Äôs own presence is the concealment.

original: yang na lus kyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa ni bsrung ba la phyi rol gyi nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog pa ni bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi bde ba nye bar sgrub pa ni bsrung ba la phyi rol gyi nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog pa ni bskyab pa'o //
translated: Or else, the attainment of physical bliss is the protection. The prevention of external harm is the defense.

original: nang gi nad la sogs pa las bzlog pa ni sbed pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi nad la sogs pa las bzlog pa ni sbed pa'o //
translated: The prevention of internal disease, etc. is the concealment.

original: de rnams kyi bgyi ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bgyi ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Their activity is the right application.

original: ngag dang yid do zhes pa nye bar son nas byin gyis brlab pa ni sbed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag dang yid do zhes pa nye bar son nas byin gyis brlab pa ni sbed pa'o //
translated: The consecration by one‚Äôs own presence is the concealment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dngos po nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid la gang gis sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yongs su 'dzin te mtshan dang 'od dang dbyangs dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing rnams su sangs rgyas
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dngos po nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid la gang gis sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yongs su 'dzin te mtshan dang 'od dang dbyangs dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing rnams su sangs rgyas
translated: The actual buddhahood is the buddha itself, which is fully embraced by the cause of the occurrence of a buddha, by the perfection of the major and minor marks, light, melodious voice, concentration, powers of mental retention and so on.üîΩ

original: kyi gzugs su bdag nyid kyis ston te /
analyzed: kyi gzugs su bdag nyid kyis ston te /
translated: The reality of the Buddha is the Buddha himself, who is the one who takes hold of the arising of the Buddha, and who, by the perfection of the marks, light, voice, meditative stabilization, retention, and so forth, in buddha-fields where there is no Buddha, manifests himself in the form of a Buddha.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated:

original: de nas yang brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, ≈öatakratu, the ≈öuddhƒÅvƒÅsa gods, and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma bcu pa la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma bcu pa la'o //
translated: With respect to the perfection of wisdom is with respect to the tenth moment of seeing.

original: de la ni khyad par du 'phags pas so //
analyzed: de la ni khyad par du 'phags pas so //
translated: There, because of the superiority,

original: mthong ba'i chos ni skye bas thob pa'o//
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni skye bas thob pa'o//
translated: the seen dharma is obtained by birth.

original: de las byung ba'i yon tan gyis mtshan phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa thob ces pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i yon tan gyis mtshan phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa thob ces pa ni bstan pa'o //

original: bshad pa ni yongs su 'dzin par gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni yongs su 'dzin par gyur zhes pa ste /

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'o //

original: rnam par byang ba byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: Purification is that which purifies,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //

original: des ni thams cad yongs su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: des ni thams cad yongs su bsdus pa'o //
translated: By that, everything is included.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated

original: yang ci zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang ci zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: ma ni zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: ma ni zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMother‚Äù is the receptivity to the cognition of the subsequent cessation.üîΩThe tirthikas who are fault-finding and harmful

original: klan ka dang gnod par byed pa'i mu stegs rnams dang lhan cig rtsod pa dang / rgol ba dang / 'gal ba @89a * //
analyzed: klan ka dang gnod par byed pa'i mu stegs rnams dang lhan cig rtsod pa dang / rgol ba dang / 'gal ba @89a * //
translated: argue, dispute, and contradict.

original: de rnams zhi la /
analyzed: de rnams zhi la /
translated: Those are pacified.

original: de ltar yang de zhi nas ji ltar de rnams kyis phyis theg pa gsum po 'di thos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor bar bsgrags pa'i nad zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yang de zhi nas ji ltar de rnams kyis phyis theg pa gsum po 'di thos pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor bar bsgrags pa'i nad zad par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when that is pacified, later those who possess the hearing of this tripi·π≠aka will extinguish the illness that is proclaimed as the afflictions, the lower realms, and sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma bcu gnyis la ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa ni mthong ba'i skad cig ma bcu gnyis la ste /
translated: Therefore, all illnesses of harm are pacified in the twelve moments of seeing.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is statedüîΩbeginning with ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: chos ston pa la rtsod pa byed pa ni bzhad gad kyis so //
analyzed: chos ston pa la rtsod pa byed pa ni bzhad gad kyis so //
translated: One disputes about the teaching of the Dharma with laughter.

original: rgol bar byed pa ni 'thab mos so //
analyzed: rgol bar byed pa ni 'thab mos so //
translated: One argues with fighting.

original: 'gal bar byed pa ni phan tshun la zhe sdang bas so //
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa ni phan tshun la zhe sdang bas so //
translated: One contradicts with mutual hatred.

original: des rtsod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa la de bzhin ni de yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: des rtsod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa la de bzhin ni de yin zhes pa ste /
translated: With that intention to dispute, etc., he says, Just so, etc.

original: chos 'di nyid la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos 'di nyid la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, in this very Dharma.

original: skad cig ma bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu gnyis po 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: In the characteristics of these twelve moments.

original: sman ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sman ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Medicine is powerful.

original: sbrul gdug pa ni de'i 'dir mche ba dug can pas sbrul gdug pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa ni de'i 'dir mche ba dug can pas sbrul gdug pa'o //
translated: A poisonous snake is a snake with poisonous fangs.

original: skye bo ni lus can la /
analyzed: skye bo ni lus can la /
translated: Beings are embodied beings.

original: srog chags su gyur pa ni dud 'gro'i bye brag go //üîΩgzi brjid kyis ni mthus so //üîΩstobs ni gnod par byed pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: srog chags su gyur pa ni dud 'gro'i bye brag go // gzi brjid kyis ni mthus so // stobs ni gnod par byed pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Creatures are a particular kind of animal.üîΩBy its splendor is by its power.üîΩPower is the ability to harm.

original: mthus ni gnod par byar med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: mthus ni gnod par byar med pa nyid du'o //
translated: By splendor is the inability to harm.

original: stobs bskyed pa ni de la sbyor ba'i nus pa bskyed nas so zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bskyed pa ni de la sbyor ba'i nus pa bskyed nas so zhes pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: The generation of strength is the generation of the ability to apply to that.

original: 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa de gsungs pa ni /
translated: The attachment to grasping that is stated is

original: ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: why?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bcu gsum shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bcu gsum shes pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of the thirteen moments,

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the forbearance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / lha rnams kyis srung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / lha rnams kyis srung ba ste /
translated: It is protected by the buddhas and the gods.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated

original: rgyal po bzhis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po bzhis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: by the four kings, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bcu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bcu bzhi pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the fourteenth moment,

original: lam la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba ni srog mi gcod pa la de thog mar byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas shing /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba ni srog mi gcod pa la de thog mar byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa nas ji srid du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas shing /
translated: Abandoning killing is not killing. Having made that the first, one abides in the six perfections, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nyid la gzhan dag kyang dgod pa ni skad cig ma bco lnga la ste /
analyzed: de nyid la gzhan dag kyang dgod pa ni skad cig ma bco lnga la ste /
translated: And establishing others in that is the fifteen moments.

original: de gsungs pa ni /üîΩgzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni / gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is stated:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bco lnga la ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma bco lnga la ste /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom is in fifteen moments.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams gzhan dag la nye bar ston pa'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams gzhan dag la nye bar ston pa'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa ste /
translated: The words of teaching the perfections and so on to others are worthy of being taken to mind,

original: de @89b la rang nyid kyang de rnams la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: de @89b la rang nyid kyang de rnams la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i tshig gzung bar 'os pa'o //
translated: because one oneself abides in those.

original: 'di'i tshig 'jam zhing snyan pas zhes pa ni tshig 'jam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i tshig 'jam zhing snyan pas zhes pa ni tshig 'jam pa ste /
translated: The words of this are gentle and pleasant.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug po rnams la gnas pa rnams gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug po rnams la gnas pa rnams gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words are gentle because they are spoken by abiding in the six such as generosity.

original: tshig ngan pa ni gsung de nyid do //üîΩtshig 'chal pa med pa ni /
analyzed: tshig ngan pa ni gsung de nyid do // tshig 'chal pa med pa ni /
translated: The words are not harsh.üîΩThe words are not incoherent because one does not speak words mixed with what is not beneficial.

original: des phan pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i tshig mi smra bas so zhes pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: des phan pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i tshig mi smra bas so zhes pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the receptivity to the subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug gsungs pa ni /
translated: The sixteen moments are taught.

original: khro bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khro bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúanger‚Äù teaches the sixteen moments.

original: yongs su 'dul bar byed pa ni khro ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dul bar byed pa ni khro ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFully subduing‚Äù is because anger is pacified.

original: yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nga rgyal zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nga rgyal zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFully transforming‚Äù is because pride, which has the characteristic of haughtiness, is exhausted.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni dgra bor ro //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni dgra bor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHolding a grudge‚Äù is toward an enemy.

original: gnod sems ni zhe sdang la /
analyzed: gnod sems ni zhe sdang la /
translated: ‚ÄúMalice‚Äù is toward hatred.

original: bag la nyal ni mdud par ro //üîΩdran pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bag la nyal ni mdud par ro // dran pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúDormant tendencies‚Äù are toward knots.

original: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúthat‚Äù teaches the three recollections.

original: de zhes pa ni gnod sems kyis te /
analyzed: de zhes pa ni gnod sems kyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is anger.

original: yongs su phye ba ni rnam par 'gyur bas te /
analyzed: yongs su phye ba ni rnam par 'gyur bas te /
translated: ‚ÄúFully analyzed‚Äù is through transformation.

original: de bzhin du sdang bar byed pa 'khor dang bcas pa spang bar byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdang bar byed pa 'khor dang bcas pa spang bar byas la /
translated: In the same way, one should abandon the angry one together with the retinue.

original: bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems can gyi phung po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems can gyi phung po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the dedication of one's own giving, etc. for the sake of causing the mass of sentient beings to attain perfect enlightenment is the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: lam shes pa'i skad cig ma 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i skad cig ma 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
translated: These moments of knowledge of the path are of the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang shes par byas la /üîΩthar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i go cha'i sgrub par bshad pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dga' ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bshad pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang shes par byas la / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i go cha'i sgrub par bshad pa'i 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dga' ba la /
translated: In this path of seeing, one should understand the aids to penetration explained as the knowledge of all aspects,üîΩand the joy explained as the armor practice of the aids to liberation.üîΩThe latter has the characteristics to be explained below.

original: sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the other aids to liberation.

original: de la sems can ni 'dir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems can ni 'dir zhes pa ste /
translated: Therein, sentient beings here refers to the mass of sentient beings.

original: mthong ba la sogs lam gyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs lam gyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as following the path of seeing, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid la /
translated: The path of seeing is supramundane.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of meditation has two types:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: mundane and transcendent.

original: de rnams ni rting la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni rting la brjod par bya ste /
translated: These will be explained later.

original: de dag gi byed pa ni chos mchog chen po'i bye brag nas brtsams nas nye bar sogs shing drod nas brtsams nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu 'dod pas rab tu 'jug ces pa ni dang po brjod par bya ba ste /üîΩde la bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de dag gi byed pa ni chos mchog chen po'i bye brag nas brtsams nas nye bar sogs shing drod nas brtsams nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu 'dod pas rab tu 'jug ces pa ni dang po brjod par bya ba ste / de la bstan bcos las /
translated: The function of the path of meditation is to approach and emerge from the heat stage of the path of preparation and so on, up to the supreme mundane state, and to enter the path of seeing through the desire for the result.

original: kun nas dul dang @90a * //
analyzed: kun nas dul dang @90a * //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge explains:üîΩFully disciplined,

original: thams cad nas /
analyzed: thams cad nas /
translated: in all,üîΩvictorious over all afflictions,üîΩunshakable by harm,

original: nyon mongs kun las rgyal ba dang // gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs kun las rgyal ba dang // gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid // ces pa ste /
translated: enlightened and worshiped by the world.

original: kun nas zhes pa ni yongs su zhes pa'i sgra don la /
analyzed: kun nas zhes pa ni yongs su zhes pa'i sgra don la /
translated: Fully means completely.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dag la zhen pa med pa ni dul ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dag la zhen pa med pa ni dul ba la /
translated: Lack of attachment to self and mine is discipline.

original: bdag gi rjes su yid dga' bar mi byed pas ni yongs su dul ba dang / yongs su khengs pa med pa ste go rims bzhin du zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dag yongs su zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rjes su yid dga' bar mi byed pas ni yongs su dul ba dang / yongs su khengs pa med pa ste go rims bzhin du zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dag yongs su zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not delight in his own followers, he is completely disciplined, and because he is not puffed up, he is completely transformed, respectively, because of the complete exhaustion of hatred and pride.

original: de skad ces smras pa gnyis dang brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa gsol ba ni /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa gnyis dang brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa gsol ba ni /
translated: Thus addressed, the request ≈öakra, etc.

original: byed pa sdug pa 'di rnams la'o //
analyzed: byed pa sdug pa 'di rnams la'o //
translated: is for these who are dear to do.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the path of meditation.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni gal te zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni yongs su dul ba dang yongs su sgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni gal te zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni yongs su dul ba dang yongs su sgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: As to how, the meaning is if, and thus is the complete discipline and transformation.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa ste srog gi bar chad du 'gyur zhes pa ni de nyid la mtshon chas bsnun pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa ste srog gi bar chad du 'gyur zhes pa ni de nyid la mtshon chas bsnun pas so //
translated: The Blessed One, etc. would be an obstacle to life is because of being struck with a weapon right there.
